column2: d
column3: n
column4: t
column5: g
column6: r
column7: b
column8: v
column9: s

column1: finti,$x_{1}$ invents/creates/composes/authors $x_{2}$ for function/purpose $x_{3}$ from existing elements/ideas $x_{4}$.,$x_1$ is creative/inventive.  See also cmavo list {fi'e}, {ciska}, {pemci}, {zbasu}, {larcu}, specific works of authorship, {prosa}, {skina}.,gismu,compose,invent,fin,fi'i,fint,finti,fi'e,se fi'e,te fi'e,ve fi'e,
column2: flalu,$x_{1}$ is a law specifying $x_{2}$ (state/event) for community $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$ by lawgiver(s) $x_{5}$.,$x_1$ is a legality; $x_2$ is legal/licit/legalized/a legality (= {selfla} for reordered places).  See also {javni}, {ritli}, {zekri}, {pulji}, {tinbe}.,gismu,law,fla,flal,flalu,,
column3: flani,$x_{1}$ is a flute/pipe/fife/recorder [flute-like/air-reed musical instrument].,See also {zgike}.,gismu,flute,flan,flani,,
column4: flecu,$x_{1}$ is a current/flow/river of/in $x_{2}$ flowing in direction to/towards $x_{3}$ from direction/source $x_{4}$.,[$x_1$ is a stream of $x_2$; $x_2$ is a fluid Gas or liquid. (= {selfle} for reordered places); $x_1$ flushes toward $x_3$; flush (= {caifle}, {sukfle})]; See also {rirxe}, {senta} where no directionality is implied, {rinci}, {xampo}, {dikca}, {sakci}, {gapci}, {litki}, {ciblu}.,gismu,flow,fle,flec,flecu,,
column5: fliba,$x_{1}$ fails at doing $x_{2}$ (state/event); $x_{1}$ is a failure at its role in $x_{2}$.,Baffled (= {pesfli}, {jmifli}, {dafspufli}, {menfli}, among other senses); also $x_2$ ceases/does not complete/fails to continue due to failure on the part of $x_1$.  See also {cfila}, {snada}, {srera}, {troci}, {sisti}, {ranji}, {denpa}, {bebna}, {zunti}.,gismu,fail,fli,flib,fliba,,
column6: flira,$x_{1}$ is a/the face [head/body-part] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is facial.,See also {sefta}, {stedu}, {crane}, {mebri}.,gismu,face,fir,flir,flira,,
column7: foldi,$x_{1}$ is a field [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a broad uniform expanse of $x_{2}$.,Also woods (= {ricfoi}), lawn/meadow (= {sasfoi}), brush (= {spafoi}, {cicyspafoi}).  See also {purdi}, {cange}.,gismu,field,flo,foi,fold,foldi,,
column8: fonmo,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of foam/froth/suds of material $x_{2}$, with bubbles/vacuoles of material $x_{3}$.,See also {zbabu}.,gismu,foam,fom,fo'o,fonm,fonmo,,
column9: fonxa,$x_{1}$ is a telephone transceiver/modem attached to system/network $x_{2}$.,See also {tcana}.,gismu,telephone,fon,fonx,fonxa,,
column10: forca,$x_{1}$ is a fork/fork-type tool/utensil for purpose $x_{2}$ with tines/prongs $x_{3}$ on base/support $x_{4}$.,See also {dakfu}, {smuci}, {komcu}, {tutci}.,gismu,fork,fro,forc,forca,,
column11: fraso,$x_{1}$ reflects French/Gallic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {ropno}.,gismu,French,fas,fras,fraso,,
column12: frati,$x_{1}$ reacts/responds/answers with action $x_{2}$ to stimulus $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is responsive.,$x_3$ stimulates $x_1$ into reaction $x_2$, $x_3$ stimulates reaction $x_2$ (= {terfra} for place reordering); attempt to stimulate, prod (= {terfratoi}, {tunterfratoi}).  See also {preti}, {danfu}, {spuda}, {cpedu}, {tarti}.,gismu,react,treat,fra,frat,frati,,
column13: fraxu,$x_{1}$ forgives $x_{2}$ for event/state/activity $x_{3}$.,See also {dunda}, {curmi}, {zungi}.,gismu,forgive,fax,frax,fraxu,,
column14: frica,$x_{1}$ differs/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike $x_{2}$ in property/dimension/quantity $x_{3}$.,Also other-than (less common meaning).  See also {ranxi}, {drata}, {dunli}, {simsa}, {vrici}.,gismu,differ,fic,fric,frica,,
column15: friko,$x_{1}$ reflects African culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {ropno}, {xazdo}.,gismu,African,fi'o,frik,friko,,
column16: frili,$x_{1}$ (action) is easy/simple/facile for $x_{2}$ (agent) under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{2}$ does $x_{1}$ freely/easily.,See also {nandu}, {sampu}, {zifre}.,gismu,easy,facile,fil,fril,frili,,
column17: frinu,$x_{1}$ is a fraction, with numerator $x_{2}$, denominator $x_{3}$ ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$).,See also {parbi}, {dilcu}, {mekso}, {fendi}, {fi'u}.,gismu,fraction,frin,frinu,,
column18: friti,$x_{1}$ offers/proffers $x_{2}$ [offering] to $x_{3}$ with conditions $x_{4}$.,($x_4$ may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posfriti}, {posyselfriti} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {canja}, {dunda}, {rinsa}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {vitke}.,gismu,offer,fit,frit,friti,,
column19: frumu,$x_{1}$ frowns/grimaces (facial expression).,$x_1$ frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to $x_2$ (= {frufra}).  See also {cmila}, {cisma}.,gismu,frown,fru,frum,frumu,,
column20: fukpi,$x_{1}$ is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of $x_{2}$ in form/medium $x_{3}$ made by method $x_{4}$ (event).,See also {krefu}, {rapli}, {gidva}.; Borrowing (={fu'ivla}).,gismu,copy,fuk,fu'i,fukp,fukpi,,
column21: fulta,$x_{1}$ (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is buoyant.,See also {limna}, {bloti}, {sakli}.,gismu,float,ful,flu,fult,fulta,,
column22: funca,$x_{1}$ (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of $x_{2}$; (note mabla/zabna not implied). $x_{1}$ is determined by chance.,See also {cunso}, {mabla}, {zabna}.,gismu,luck,fun,fu'a,func,funca,,
column23: fusra,$x_{1}$ rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is rotten/decayed/fermented.,See also {birje}, {vanju}, {vifne}.,gismu,rotten,fur,fusr,fusra,,
column24: fuzme,$x_{1}$ is responsible/accountable for $x_{2}$ (action/resulting state) to judge/authority $x_{3}$.,See also {bilga}.,gismu,responsible,fuz,fu'e,fuzm,fuzme,,
column25: gacri,$x_{1}$ is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering $x_{2}$.,See also {pilka}, {gapru}, {marbi}, {drudi}, ve {botpi}, {bitmu}, {calku}.,gismu,cover,gai,gacr,gacri,,
column26: gadri,$x_{1}$ is an article/descriptor labelling description $x_{2}$ (text) in language $x_{3}$ with semantics $x_{4}$.,$x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu.  'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.,gismu,article,gad,gadr,gadri,,
column27: galfi,$x_{1}$ (event) modifies/alters/changes/transforms/converts $x_{2}$ into $x_{3}$.,Causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= {gafygau}, {gafyzu'e}).  (cf. {stika} for non-resultative, {binxo} for not-necessarily causal change, {cenba} for non-resultative change; {zasni}),gismu,modify,gaf,ga'i,galf,galfi,,
column28: galtu,$x_{1}$ is high/up/upward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.,Also upper; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself.  See also {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}.,gismu,high,gal,ga'u,galt,galtu,,
column29: galxe,$x_{1}$ is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole].,See also {cnebo}, {kevna}, {tunlo}.,gismu,throat,galx,galxe,,
column30: kajde,$x_{1}$ (event/experience) warns/cautions $x_{2}$ (person) of/about danger $x_{3}$ (event/state/property).,Agentive warning (= {jdegau}, {jdezu'e}); an attempt to warn which may not succeed (= {jdetoi}, {jdegautoi}, {jdezuktoi}).  See also {ckape}, {nupre}, {snura}, {tcica}, {xlura}.,gismu,warn,jde,kajd,kajde,,
column31: kajna,$x_{1}$ is a shelf/counter/bar in/on/attached to supporting object $x_{2}$, for purpose $x_{3}$.,See also {balni}.,gismu,shelf,kajn,kajna,,
column32: kakne,$x_{1}$ is able to do/be/capable of doing/being $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$ (event/state).,Also: has talent; know how to; know how to use (= {plika'e}).  (cf. {stati}, {certu}, {gasnu} (in the time-free potential sense), {cmavo} list {ka'e}, cmavo list {nu'o}, cmavo list {pu'i}, {djuno}, {zifre}),gismu,able,ka'e,kakn,kakne,,
column33: kakpa,$x_{1}$ (agent) digs $x_{2}$ [material] up/out of $x_{3}$ [source/hole] with limbs/tool(s) $x_{4}$.,Also $x_1$ cuts into $x_3$ (with material removal).  See also {katna}, {plixa}, {sraku}, {canpa}, {sraku}.,gismu,dig,kakp,kakpa,,
column34: kalci,$x_{1}$ is a/the feces/excrement/dung/shit of $x_{2}$ (animal/person); (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is fecal (matter).,Also crap.  See also {ganxo}, {pinca}, {vikmi}, {mabla}, {festi}.,gismu,feces,kalc,kalci,,
column35: kalri,$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is open/ajar/not shut permitting passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.,As a doorway. $x_{3}$ is given access to $x_{2}$ through portal $x_{1}$. See also {ganlo}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}.,gismu,open,kar,kalr,kalri,,
column36: kalsa,$x_{1}$ is chaotic/disordered in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka).,See also {cunso}, {cnici}.,gismu,chaotic,kas,kals,kalsa,,
column37: kalte,$x_{1}$ hunts/stalks prey/quarry/game $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.,Also verb: to fish (= {fipkalte}).  See also {jersi}, {kavbu}, {sisku}, {rivbi}.,gismu,hunt,kat,kalt,kalte,,
column38: kamju,$x_{1}$ is a column/pillar of material $x_{2}$.,Spine (= {bogykamju}), vertebra (= {kamjybo'u}).  See also {ckana}, {garna}, {sanli}, {slanu}.,gismu,column,kamj,kamju,,
column39: kamni,$x_{1}$ (mass) is a committee with task/purpose $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.,Board of directors/trustees/cabinet (= {trukamni}, {gritrukamni}). See also {bende}, {kagni}.,gismu,committee,kamn,kamni,,
column40: kampu,$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is common/general/universal among members of set $x_{2}$ (complete set).,Only fully universal sense applies; $x_1$ must be found in all members of $x_2$.  For the non-universal sense see {fadni} and {zilfadni}.  See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {fadni}, {cnano}, {tcaci}, {lakne}, {cmima}, {simxu}.,gismu,common,general,universal,kau,kamp,kampu,,
column41: kanba,$x_{1}$ is a goat/angora/[billy-goat/kid] of species/breed $x_{2}$.,See also {lanme}, {sunla}.,gismu,goat,kanb,kanba,,
column42: kancu,$x_{1}$ (agent) counts the number in set $x_{2}$ to be $x_{3}$ [number/count] counting [off] by units $x_{4}$.,($x_2$ is complete set); See also {kanji}, {satci}, {merli}.,gismu,count,kac,kanc,kancu,,
column43: kandi,$x_{1}$ is dim/dull/pale/non-intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.,In colors, indicates unsaturated, pastel, pale (though blabi can also indicate a kind of paleness).  See also {blabi}, {carmi}, {klina}, {linto}, {manku}, {murse}, {ruble}, {skari}, {milxe}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.,gismu,dim,kad,kand,kandi,,
column44: kanji,$x_{1}$ calculates/reckons/computes $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$.,See also {kancu}, {jdice}, {skami}.,gismu,calculate,kaj,kanj,kanji,,
column45: kanla,$x_{1}$ is a/the eye [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is ocular.,$x_1$ is optic.  See also {jvinu}, {kerlo}, {viska}, {kumte}.,gismu,eye,kal,kanl,kanla,,
column46: kanro,$x_{1}$ is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard $x_{2}$.,See also {bilma}, {mikce}.,gismu,healthy,well,ka'o,kanr,kanro,,
column47: kansa,$x_{1}$ is with/accompanies/is a companion of $x_{2}$, in state/condition/enterprise $x_{3}$ (event/state).,$x_1$ is together with/along with $x_2$. See also {kagni}, {jorne}, {gunma}, {girzu}, {lasna}.,gismu,with,kan,kans,kansa,ka'ai,
column48: kantu,$x_{1}$ is a quantum/ray/elementary particle/smallest measurable increment of property/activity $x_{2}$.,Quantum ray (= {bonka'u}).  (cf. {selci} for masses and most objects; {ratni}, {gradu}, {gusni}, {nejni}, {linji}),gismu,quantum,ka'u,kant,kantu,,
column49: kanxe,$x_{1}$ is a conjunction, stating that $x_{2}$ (du'u) and $x_{3}$ (du'u) are both true.,See also {vlina}.,gismu,conjunction,kax,kanx,kanxe,,
column50: karbi,$x_{1}$ [observer] compares $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ in property $x_{4}$ (ka), determining comparison $x_{5}$ (state).,See also {klani}, {mapti}, {sarxe}, {zmadu}, {mleca}, {dunli}.,gismu,compare,kab,karb,karbi,,
column51: karce,$x_{1}$ is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$,See also {carce}, {xislu}, {marce}, {sabnu}.,gismu,automobile,car,karc,karce,,
column52: karda,$x_{1}$ is a card [small nearly-2-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$.,($x_3$ shape default rectangular); See also {matci}, {tapla}, {plita}.,gismu,card,kard,karda,,
column53: kargu,$x_{1}$ (object/commodity/property/event) is costly/expensive/dear to $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.,$x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {poskargu} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {vamji}, {dirba}, {vajni}, {jdima}, {pleji}, {canja}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jemna}, {sfasa}, {vecnu}.,gismu,costly,karg,kargu,,
column54: karli,$x_{1}$ is a collar/ring/belt/band around/surrounding $x_{2}$ made of material $x_{3}$.,Also sphincter.  See also {sruri}, {djine}.,gismu,collar,karl,karli,,
column55: karni,$x_{1}$ is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] with content $x_{2}$ published by $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$.,$x_2$ may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list.  See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.,gismu,journal,press,karn,karni,,
column56: katna,$x_{1}$ (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides $x_{2}$ (object) into pieces $x_{3}$.,For $x_1$ force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= {ka'argau}, {ka'arzu'e}).  (cf. {kakpa}, {sraku} for cutting into without division; {plixa}, {dakfu}, {jinci}, {porpi}, {spofu}, {tunta}, {xrani}, {fatri}, {fendi}, {balre}, {dilcu}),gismu,cut,ka'a,katn,katna,,
column57: kavbu,$x_{1}$ captures/catches/apprehends/seizes/nabs $x_{2}$ with trap/restraint $x_{3}$.,Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}).  See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.,gismu,capture,catch,kav,kavb,kavbu,,
column58: kecti,$x_{1}$ (person) pities/feels sorry for $x_{2}$ (person) about $x_{3}$ (abstraction).,See also {cinmo}, {xendo}.,gismu,pity,kec,ke'i,kect,kecti,,
column59: kelci,$x_{1}$ [agent] plays with plaything/toy $x_{2}$.,Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}).  See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.,gismu,play,kel,kei,kelc,kelci,,
column60: kelvo,$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.,See also {gradu}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {kilto}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}.,gismu,kelvin,ke'o,kelv,kelvo,,
column61: kenra,$x_{1}$ is a cancer [malignant disease] in $x_{2}$.,See also {bilma}, {mikce}, {spita}.,gismu,cancer,ken,kenr,kenra,,
column62: kensa,$x_{1}$ is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region $x_{2}$.,See also {canlu}, {munje}, {terdi}, {tsani}.,gismu,outer space,space,kes,kens,kensa,,
column63: kerfa,$x_{1}$ is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of $x_{2}$ at body location $x_{3}$.,See also {skapi}, {sunla}, {pimlu}.,gismu,hair,kre,kerf,kerfa,,
column64: kerlo,$x_{1}$ is a/the ear [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].,(adjective:) $x_1$ is aural.  See also {kanla}, {savru}, {smaji}, {tirna}, {ractu}.,gismu,ear,ker,kerl,kerlo,,
column65: ketco,$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {merko}, {xispo}, {brazo}, {gento}, {spano}.,gismu,South American,ket,tco,ketc,ketco,,
column66: kevna,$x_{1}$ is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is concave within $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is hollow at locus $x_{1}$.,Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}).  See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.,gismu,cavity,hole,kev,ke'a,kevn,kevna,,
column67: kicne,$x_{1}$ cushions $x_{2}$ with material $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a cushion/pillow/pad [for $x_{2}$] of padding material $x_{3}$.,See also {ckana}, {matci}.,gismu,cushion,kic,ki'e,kicn,kicne,,
column68: kijno,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of oxygen (O); [metaphor: supporting life/combustion].,See also {jelca}, {vacri}, {vasxu}.,gismu,oxygen,kij,kijn,kijno,,
column69: klina,$x_{1}$ (object/medium) is clear/transparent/without obstacle to in-the-clear $x_{2}$ [transmission].,Also lucid; $x_2$ remains apparent/lucid/clear (figurative use for 'understandable' is discouraged, better expressed as = {filseljmi} or {filsmu}).  (cf. {kandi}, {zunti} - {nalzu'i} is better for 'unhindered'),gismu,clear,direct,kli,klin,klina,,
column70: kliru,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of halogen of type $x_{2}$ [chlorine, fluorine, iodine, etc.].,Also bromine; default chlorine. See also {xukmi}.,gismu,chlorine,klir,kliru,,
column71: kliti,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of clay [moist, clammy dirt] of composition including $x_{2}$.,See also {dertu}, {pesxu}, {staku}.,gismu,clay,kit,klit,kliti,,
column72: klupe,$x_{1}$ is a screw [fastener] for purpose $x_{2}$, threads [pitch, material] $x_{3}$, frame [size, material] $x_{4}$.,Also bolt.  See also {korcu}, {sarlu}, {tutci}.,gismu,screw,lup,lu'e,klup,klupe,,
column73: kluza,$x_{1}$ (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on $x_{2}$ (obj.) at locus $x_{3}$.,See also {tagji}, {trati}, {rinju}.,gismu,loose,luz,kluz,kluza,,
column74: kobli,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain $x_{2}$.,See also {stagi}.,gismu,cabbage,kob,ko'i,kobl,kobli,,
column75: kojna,$x_{1}$ is a corner/point/at-least-3-dimensional [solid] angle [shape/form] in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.,Also apex; a corner exists on three dimensions but need not be limited to points; it suggests a discontinuity in slope in some direction; i.e. in some planar cross-section.  See also {jipno}, {konju}, {bliku}, {fanmo}, {jganu}, {krasi}.,gismu,corner,koj,ko'a,kojn,kojna,,
column76: kolme,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bitumen from source $x_{2}$.,See also {tabno}, {tarla}.,gismu,coal,kol,ko'e,kolm,kolme,,
column77: komcu,$x_{1}$ is a comb [many-needled shape] of material $x_{2}$ with tines/needles $x_{3}$.,See also {julne}, {forca}, {burcu}.,gismu,comb,kom,komc,komcu,,
column78: konju,$x_{1}$ is a cone [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$ with vertex $x_{3}$.,Also ellipse, ellipsoid (= {konclupa}).  See also {jesni}, {djine}, {sovda}, {kojna}, {jganu}.,gismu,cone,kon,ko'u,konj,konju,,
column79: korbi,$x_{1}$ is an edge/margin/border/curb/boundary of $x_{2}$ next-to/bordering-on $x_{3}$.,See also cmavo list {koi}, {greku}, {mlana}, {jimte}, {ctebi}, {bartu}.,gismu,edge,kor,koi,korb,korbi,koi,se koi,te koi,
column80: korcu,(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is bent/crooked/not straight or direct/[twisted]/folded.,See also {cinje}, {klupe}, {kruvi}, {polje}, {sarlu}, {sirji}, {bargu}, {genxu}.,gismu,bent,crooked,kro,korc,korcu,,
column81: korka,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cork/bark from tree/species $x_{2}$; [material].,See also {tricu}, {calku}, {skapi}, {stagi}.,gismu,cork,kok,kork,korka,,
column82: kosta,$x_{1}$ is a coat/jacket/sweater/cloak/[cape/shawl/pullover] [extra outer garment] of material $x_{2}$.,See also {pastu}, {sunla}, {taxfu}.,gismu,coat,jacket,kos,kost,kosta,,
column83: kramu,$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ local area unit(s) [non-metric] (default 1) by standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.,(additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}.,gismu,acre,kram,kramu,,
column84: krasi,$x_{1}$ (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of $x_{2}$ (object/event/process).,Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) $x_1$ is initial.  See also {fanmo}, cmavo list {ra'i}, {sabji}, {cfari}, {jipno}, {traji}, {kojna}, {genja}, {jicmu}, {sitna}, {jinto}.,gismu,origin,source,kra,kras,krasi,ra'i,se ra'i,
column85: krati,$x_{1}$ represents/is an agent/proxy/stands-in for [absent] $x_{2}$ in matter(s)/function(s) $x_{3}$.,Also: on behalf of.  See also cmavo list {ka'i}, {jansu}, {catni}, {vipsi}, {pulji}.,gismu,represent,ka'i,krat,krati,ka'i,se ka'i,te ka'i,
column86: krefu,$x_{1}$ (event) is the $x_{3}$'rd recurrence/repetition of $x_{2}$ (abstract); $x_{2}$ happens again in [form] $x_{1}$.,Also case, another, instance, different, other, time, occasion.  See also {fukpi}, {rapli}, {cafne}, {fasnu}, {xruti}.,gismu,recur,ref,ke'u,kref,krefu,,
column87: krici,$x_{1}$ believes [regardless of evidence/proof] belief/creed $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true/assumed about subject $x_{3}$.,"without evidence" refers to objective external evidence; also gives credence, has conviction.  See also {jinvi}, {djuno}, {censa}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {makfa}, {malsi}, {senpi}, {birti}.,gismu,believe,faith,kri,kric,krici,,
column88: krili,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of crystal of composition $x_{2}$ in form/arrangement $x_{3}$.,$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {jemna}, {bisli}.,gismu,crystal,kril,krili,,
column89: krinu,$x_{1}$ (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting $x_{2}$ (event/state).,See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.,gismu,reason,rin,ki'u,krin,krinu,ki'u,se ki'u,ki'u nai,se ki'u nai,
column90: krixa,$x_{1}$ cries out/yells/howls sound $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a crier.,See also {klaku}, {bacru}.,gismu,cry out,kix,ki'a,krix,krixa,,
column92: kruji,$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition $x_{2}$.,[$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.,gismu,cream,ruj,kruj,kruji,,
column93: kruvi,$x_{1}$ is a curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.,(adjective:) $x_1$ is curved; ($x_4$ as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend).  See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.,gismu,curve,ruv,kru,kruv,kruvi,,
column94: kubli,$x_{1}$ is a cube/regular polyhedron/polygon of dimensions $x_{2}$ (def. 3), surfaces/sides $x_{3}$ (def. 6).,(cf. {kurfa} - needed for 'cube', {bliku} for a physical object; {tanbo}, {tapla}, {tarmi}),gismu,cube,kub,kubl,kubli,,
column95: kucli,$x_{1}$ is curious/wonders about/is interested in/[inquisitive about] $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).,Inquisitive (= {retkucli}).  See also {manci}, {sisku}, se {cinri}.,gismu,curious,kucl,kucli,,
column96: kufra,$x_{1}$ feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property(ies) $x_{2}$.,See also {cinmo}.,gismu,comfort,kuf,kufr,kufra,,
column97: kukte,$x_{1}$ is delicious/tasty/delightful to observer/sense $x_{2}$ [person, or sensory activity].,$x_1$ is a delicacy.  See also {gusta}, {ralci}, {vrusi}, {cpina}.,gismu,delicious,kuk,kukt,kukte,,
column98: kulnu,$x_{1}$ [mass of ideas, customs, skills, arts] is culture of nation/ethos $x_{2}$ (mass); $x_{1}$ is ethnic.,(note that $x_2$ is NOT individual; culture is what is shared among people and is not an individual trait).  See also cmavo list {ka'u}, cmavo list {ku'u}, {natmi}, {cecmu}.,gismu,culture,klu,kuln,kulnu,ku'u,se ku'u,
column99: kumfa,$x_{1}$ is a room of/in structure $x_{2}$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).,Also chamber.  See also {bitmu}, {canlu}, {zdani}.,gismu,room,kum,ku'a,kumf,kumfa,,
column100: kumte,$x_{1}$ is a camel/llama/alpaca/vicuna/dromedary of species/breed $x_{2}$.,Llama (= {tcokumte}), Bactrian camel (= {zdokumte}); Arabian camel/dromedary (= {rabykumte}).  See also {sunla}, {kanla}, {xirma}, {xasli}.,gismu,camel,kumt,kumte,,
column101: kunra,$x_{1}$ is/contains/is made from a mineral/ore of type/metal $x_{2}$ mined from location/lode/mine $x_{3}$.,See also {jinme}, {bisli}, {rokci}, {jemna}.,gismu,mineral,kun,kunr,kunra,,
column102: kunti,$x_{1}$ [container] is empty/vacant of $x_{2}$ [material]; $x_{1}$ is hollow.,Also vacuum (= kunti be roda/so'ada).  See also {culno}, {tisna}, {claxu}, {canlu}, {kevna}, {setca}.,gismu,empty,vacant,kut,kunt,kunti,,
column103: kurfa,$x_{1}$ is a right-angled shape/form defined by set of vertices $x_{2}$, dimensions $x_{3}$ (default 2).,Also rectangle, square, rectilinear; square (= {kubykurfa}, {pitkubykurfa}), cube (= {kurkubli}), rectangle (= {clakurfa}), rhombus/diamond (= {sa'orkurfa}, {sa'orpitkubli}).  See also {bliku}, {kubli}, {tapla}, {salpo}, {tarmi}.,gismu,square,kur,kurf,kurfa,,
column104: kurji,$x_{1}$ takes-care-of/looks after/attends to/provides for/is caretaker for $x_{2}$ (object/event/person).,Also tends, cares for, keeps; $x_1$ is a keeper/custodian of $x_2$.  See also {jundi}, {cinri}, {prami}, {raktu}, {zgana}.,gismu,take care of,kuj,ku'i,kurj,kurji,,
column105: kurki,$x_{1}$ is bitter/acrid/sharply disagreeable to observer/sense $x_{2}$.,See also {titla}, {slari}.,gismu,bitter,kurk,kurki,,
column106: kuspe,$x_{1}$ ranges/extends/spans/persists/reaches across/over interval/gap/area/scope/extent/range $x_{2}$.,Also continues.  See also {ranji}, {renvi}, {tcena}, {bancu}, {cripu}, {ragve}, {vorme}, {canko}, {bitmu}, {sirji}, {jbini}, {jimte}, {preja}.,gismu,range,reach,kup,ku'e,kusp,kuspe,,
column107: kusru,$x_{1}$ (person) is cruel/mean/unkind to victim $x_{2}$.,See also {xendo}, {jursa}.,gismu,cruel,kus,kusr,kusru,,
column108: labno,$x_{1}$ is a wolf/lupine of species/breed $x_{2}$.,See also {gerku}.,gismu,wolf,labn,labno,,
column109: lacpu,$x_{1}$ pulls/tugs/draws/drags $x_{2}$ by handle/at locus $x_{3}$.,Gravity (= ka {maicpu}, {maircpukai}).  See also {catke}, {sakci}, {cokcu}.,gismu,pull,lap,cpu,lacp,lacpu,,
column110: lacri,$x_{1}$ relies/depends/counts on/trusts $x_{2}$ to bring about/ensure/maintain $x_{3}$ (event/state).,See also {minde}, {nitcu}, {tinbe}.,gismu,depend,dependent,rely,lac,lacr,lacri,,
column111: lanka,$x_{1}$ is a basket with contents $x_{2}$, woven from material $x_{3}$.,See also {vasru}, {baktu}.,gismu,basket,lank,lanka,,
column113: lanme,$x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.,See also {kanba}, {sunla}.,gismu,sheep,lan,lanm,lanme,,
column114: lante,$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.,See also {botpi}, {baktu}, {tinci}.,gismu,can,lant,lante,,
column115: lanxe,$x_{1}$ is in balance/equilibrium under forces $x_{2}$ (mass).,(cf. {midju}, {nutli}; {fapro} for balancing/opposing forces, {nutli}),gismu,balance,lax,lanx,lanxe,,
column116: lanzu,$x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.,Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ ({selylanzu} for reordered places); relative (= {lazmi'u} - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu).  See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.,gismu,family,laz,lanz,lanzu,,
column117: larcu,$x_{1}$ (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill $x_{2}$ (idea/activity).,(adjective:) $x_1$ is artistic.  See also {finti}, {zbasu}, {stati}.,gismu,art,lar,larc,larcu,,
column118: lasna,$x_{1}$ (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ with fastener $x_{4}$.,No implication that result is considered a single object; although $x_2$ and $x_3$ may be reversible, $x_3$ may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which $x_2$ becomes attached. See also {jorne}, {fenso}, {jgena}, {batke}, {dinko}, {kansa}.,gismu,fasten,fix,la'a,lasn,lasna,,
column119: lastu,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including $x_{2}$.,(adjective:) $x_1$ is brazen).  See also {jinme}, {ransu}, {tunka}.,gismu,brass,last,lastu,,
column120: latmo,$x_{1}$ reflects Latin/Roman/Romance culture/empire/language in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {ropno}, {fraso}, {spano}, {xispo}, {itlo}, {gomsi}.,gismu,Latin,la'o,latm,latmo,,
column121: latna,$x_{1}$ is a lotus, plant/flower/herb of species/strain $x_{2}$ symbolizing $x_{3}$ to culture/religion $x_{4}$.,See also {budjo}, {censa}, {lijda}, {spati}.,gismu,lotus,latn,latna,,
column122: makcu,$x_{1}$ is mature/ripe/fully-grown/adult in development-quality $x_{2}$ (ka).,See also {cifnu}, {ninmu}, {verba}, {banro}, {farvi}, {nanmu}.,gismu,mature,ma'u,makc,makcu,,
column123: makfa,$x_{1}$ is magic/supernatural/sorcery/witchcraft/wizardry to $x_{2}$, performed by person/force/deity $x_{3}$.,See also {krici}, {manci}.,gismu,magic,maf,makf,makfa,,
column124: maksi,$x_{1}$ is magnetic [adjective] producing magnetic field $x_{2}$.,See also {dikca}, {trina}, {xlura}.,gismu,magnet,mak,maks,maksi,,
column125: malsi,$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.,$x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}).  See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.,gismu,temple,mas,mals,malsi,,
column126: mamta,$x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].,See also {patfu}, {sovda}, {rirni}, {rorci}, {tarbi}, {famti}, {bersa}, {jbena}.,gismu,mother,mam,mamt,mamta,,
column128: manfo,$x_{1}$ (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property $x_{2}$ (ka).,See also {prane}, {curve}, {ranji}, {vitno}, {stodi}, {dikni}, {sampu}, {traji}.,gismu,uniform,manf,manfo,,
column129: manku,$x_{1}$ is dark/lacking in illumination.,(cf. {blabi}, {gusni}, {ctino}; use {kandi} or {xekri} with colors, {ctino}),gismu,dark,man,mank,manku,,
column130: manri,$x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.,($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.,gismu,reference,mar,manr,manri,ma'i,se ma'i,te ma'i,
column131: mansa,$x_{1}$ satisfies evaluator $x_{2}$ in property (ka)/state $x_{3}$.,See also {pajni}.,gismu,satisfy,mans,mansa,,
column132: manti,$x_{1}$ is an ant of species/breed $x_{2}$.,See also {cinki}, {jalra}.,gismu,ant,mant,manti,,
column133: mapku,$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.,See also {taxfu}, {stedu}, {drudi}.,gismu,cap,map,mapk,mapku,,
column134: mapni,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].,See also {bukpu}.,gismu,cotton,mapn,mapni,,
column135: mapti,$x_{1}$ fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$.,See also {satci}, {tugni}, {sarxe}, {drani}, {tarmi}, {ckini}, {mintu}.,gismu,fit,match,proper,mat,mapt,mapti,,
column136: marbi,$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.,See also {bandu}, {ckape}, {snura}, {drudi}, {sepli}, {bitmu}, {gacri}.,gismu,shelter,mra,marb,marbi,,
column137: marce,$x_{1}$ is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying $x_{2}$ in/on surface/medium $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.,See also {klama}, {matra}, {bevri}, {bloti}, {carce}, {karce}, {sabnu}, {skiji}.,gismu,vehicle,ma'e,marc,marce,,
column138: marde,$x_{1}$ are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of $x_{2}$ (ind./mass) about situation $x_{3}$.,$x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}).  See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.,gismu,morals,mad,mard,marde,,
column139: margu,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].,See also {jinme}.,gismu,mercury,mag,marg,margu,,
column140: marji,$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.,Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material.  See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.,gismu,material,matter,maj,mai,marj,marji,ma'e,se ma'e,te ma'e,
column141: marna,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain $x_{2}$.,See also {skori}, {tanko}, {sigja}, {xukmi}.,gismu,hemp,marn,marna,,
column142: marxa,$x_{1}$ [force] mashes/crushes/squashes/smashes $x_{2}$ into pulp/mash/crumbs/deformed mass $x_{3}$.,See also {daspo}, {pesxu}, {zalvi}, {bapli}.,gismu,mash,max,marx,marxa,,
column143: masno,$x_{1}$ is slow/sluggish at doing/being/bringing about $x_{2}$ (event/state).,See also {sutra}.,gismu,slow,sno,masn,masno,,
column144: masti,$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ months in duration (default is 1 month) by month standard $x_{3}$.,This month (= {cabma'i}); next month (= {bavla'ima'i}); last month (= {prula'ima'i}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {nanca}.,gismu,month,ma'i,mast,masti,,
column145: matci,$x_{1}$ is a mat/pad/mattress/pallet [flat, soft, dense form] of material $x_{2}$.,Also mattress = ({kicymatci}).  See also {kicne}, {tapla}, {karda}, {ckana}.,gismu,mat,matc,matci,,
column146: matli,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of linen/flax [type of fabric/material].,See also {bukpu}.,gismu,linen,matl,matli,,
column147: matne,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains butter/oleo/margarine/shortening from source $x_{2}$.,(adjective:) $x_1$ is buttery; an edible fat, solid but spreadable at normal temperatures; dairy butter (= {ladmatne}).  See also {grasu}, {kruji}.,gismu,butter,matn,matne,,
column148: matra,$x_{1}$ is a motor/engine, driving/propelling/providing power to $x_{2}$.,See also {marce}, {minji}, {carce}.,gismu,engine,motor,matr,matra,,
column149: mavji,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of oats [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.,See also {gurni}.,gismu,oats,mav,mavj,mavji,,
column150: maxri,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of wheat [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.,See also {gurni}.,gismu,wheat,xri,maxr,maxri,,
column151: mebri,$x_{1}$ is a/the brow/forehead [projecting flat/smooth head/body-part] of $x_{2}$.,See also {stedu}, {flira}.,gismu,brow,forehead,meb,mebr,mebri,,

column2: a'a cu'i,attitudinal:
a'a nai,attitudinal:

bangu,$x_{1}$ is a/the language/dialect used by $x_{2}$ to express/communicate $x_{3}$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).,Also tongue.  See also {tance}, {cusku}, {ve} {tavla}, {valsi}, {gerna}, {jufra}, {natmi}, {slaka}.,gismu,language,ban,bau,bang,bangu,bau,se bau,te bau,
column3: banli,$x_{1}$ is great/grand in property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.,Indicates a subjective greatness, as compared to the objective standard implied for {barda}; (synonyms, possibly requiring tanru:) extraordinary, illustrious, magnificent, impressive, awesome, grandiose, august, inspiring, special, majestic, distinguished, eminent, splendor, stately, imposing (all generally {zabna}); terrible ({mabla}).  See also {barda}, {nobli}, {se} {sinma}, {pluja}, {misno}, {vajni}, {fasnu}, {cizra}, {traji}, {mutce}, {se} {manci}.,gismu,great,bal,ba'i,banl,banli,,
column4: banro,$x_{1}$ grows/expands [an increasing development] to size/into form $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.,Also rising, developing; $x_1$ gets bigger/enlarges/increases.  See also {farvi}, {zenba}, {jmina}, {barda}, {makcu}, {ferti}.,gismu,grow,ba'o,banr,banro,,
column5: banxa,$x_{1}$ is a bank owned by/in banking system $x_{2}$ for banking function(s) $x_{3}$ (event).,See also {sorcu}, {zarci}, {canja}, {kagni}.,gismu,bank,bax,banx,banxa,,
column6: banzu,$x_{1}$ (object) suffices/is enough/sufficient for purpose $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.,See also {dukse}, {claxu}, {nitcu}, {ricfu}, {curmi}.,gismu,enough,suffice,sufficient,baz,banz,banzu,,
column7: bapli,$x_{1}$ [force] (ka) forces/compels event $x_{2}$ to occur; $x_{1}$ determines property $x_{2}$ to manifest.,Also constrains; requires success, unlike the physics term (better expressed by {danre}).  See also {fanta}, {rinju}, {jimte}, {jitro}, {rinka}, {krinu}, {zukte}, {randa}, {danre}, cmavo list {bai}, {marxa}, {tinsa}, {xarnu}.,gismu,effective,force,bap,bai,bapl,bapli,bai,se bai,
column8: barda,$x_{1}$ is big/large in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.,See also {banli}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {plana}, {cmalu}, {rotsu}, {banro}, {xanto}.,gismu,big,large,bra,bard,barda,,
column9: bargu,$x_{1}$ arches/curves over/around $x_{2}$ and is made of $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is an arch over/around $x_{2}$ of material $x_{3}$.,Also arc; $x_2$ need not be an object, but may be a point or volume.  See also {cripu}, {kruvi}, {korcu}, {condi}.,gismu,arch,bag,barg,bargu,,
column10: barja,$x_{1}$ is a tavern/bar/pub serving $x_{2}$ to audience/patrons $x_{3}$.,See also {gusta}, {birje}, {jikru}, {sanmi}, {vanju}, {xotli}, {ckafi}, {se} {pinxe}.,gismu,bar,barj,barja,,
column11: barna,$x_{1}$(s) is a/are mark(s)/spot(s) on $x_{2}$ of material $x_{3}$.,{ba'armo'a} for a pattern of marks.  See also {sinxa}, {pixra}, {se} {ciska}, {se} {prina}.,gismu,mark,spot,ba'a,barn,barna,,
column12: bartu,$x_{1}$ is on the outside of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is exterior to $x_{2}$.,See also {jibni}, {nenri}, {sruri}, {lamji}, {korbi}, {calku}, {vasru}.,gismu,out,bar,bart,bartu,,
column13: basna,$x_{1}$ emphasizes/accentuates/gives emphasis/stress/accent to $x_{2}$ by (action) $x_{3}$.,Also: say forcefully. See also {pandi}.,gismu,emphasize,basn,basna,,
column14: basti,$x_{1}$ replaces/substitutes for/instead of $x_{2}$ in circumstance $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a replacement/substitute.,See also cmavo list {ba'i}, {binra}.,gismu,replace,bas,bast,basti,ba'i,se ba'i,
column15: batci,$x_{1}$ bites/pinches $x_{2}$ on/at specific locus $x_{3}$ with $x_{4}$.,Bite through (= {ka'arbatci}, {batygre}); pinch (= {cinzybatci}).  See also {denci}, {jgalu}, {guska}, {citka}.,gismu,bite,bat,batc,batci,,
column16: batke,$x_{1}$ is a button/knob/[handle] on/for item $x_{2}$, with purpose $x_{3}$, made of material $x_{4}$.,See also {jadni}, {balji}, {punji}, {jgari}, {lasna}.,gismu,button,batk,batke,,
column17: bavmi,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of barley [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.,See also {gurni}.,gismu,barley,bavm,bavmi,,
column18: baxso,$x_{1}$ reflects Malay-Indonesian common language/culture in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {meljo}, {bindo}.,gismu,Malay-Indonesian,baxs,baxso,,
column19: bebna,$x_{1}$ is foolish/silly in event/action/property [folly] (ka) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a fool.,See also {fenki}, {xajmi}, {prije}, {fliba}.,gismu,foolish,beb,bebn,bebna,,
column20: bemro,$x_{1}$ reflects North American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {merko}, {kadno}, {xispo}, {mexno}.,gismu,North American,bem,be'o,bemr,bemro,,
column21: bende,$x_{1}$ is a crew/team/gang/squad/band of persons $x_{2}$ directed/led by $x_{3}$ organized for purpose $x_{4}$.,($x_1$ is a mass; $x_2$ is a set completely specified); Also orchestra (= {zgibe'e}, {balzgibe'e}), outfit; $x_3$ conductor; business, not necessarily incorporated (= {cajbe'e}, {venbe'e}).  See also {gunma}, {girzu}, {dansu}, {jatna}, {jitro}, {kagni}, {kamni}, {minde}, {ralju}, {cecmu}, {gidva}.,gismu,association,band,club,crew,team,bed,be'e,bend,bende,,
column22: bengo,$x_{1}$ reflects Bengali/Bangladesh culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {xindo}.,gismu,Bengali,beg,beng,bengo,,
column23: benji,$x_{1}$ transfers/sends/transmits $x_{2}$ to receiver $x_{3}$ from transmitter/origin $x_{4}$ via means/medium $x_{5}$.,[also possibly "sharing"; no (complete) alienation from origin is implied]; [$x_5$ carrier]; (cf. {muvdu}, {dunda}, {mrilu}, {nirna}, {xruti}, {cradi}, {tivni}, {preja}, cmavo list {be'i}, {bevri}, {mrilu}, {tcana}).,gismu,send,transfer,transmit,bej,be'i,benj,benji,be'i,se be'i,te be'i,ve be'i,xe be'i,
column24: bersa,$x_{1}$ is a son of mother/father/parents $x_{2}$ [not necessarily biological].,Also filial.  See also {verba}, {nanla}, {nakni}, {nanmu}, {patfu}, {mamta}, {bruna}, {rirni}, {rorci}, {panzi}, {tixnu}.,gismu,son,bes,be'a,bers,bersa,,
column25: berti,$x_{1}$ is to the north/northern side [right-hand-rule pole] of $x_{2}$ according to frame of reference $x_{3}$.,See also {snanu}, {stici}, {stuna}, {farna}.,gismu,north,ber,bert,berti,,
column26: besna,$x_{1}$ is a/the brain [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: intelligence, mental control].,Also cerebral.  See also {menli}, {stedu}, {rango}, {pensi}.,gismu,brain,ben,besn,besna,,
column27: betfu,$x_{1}$ is a/the abdomen/belly/lower trunk [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: midsection].,Also stomach (= {djaruntyrango}), digestive tract (= {befctirango}, {befctirangyci'e}).  See also {cutne}, {livga}, {canti}.,gismu,abdomen,bef,be'u,betf,betfu,,
column28: betri,$x_{1}$ is a tragedy/disaster/tragic for $x_{2}$.,See also {badri}, {xlali}, {morsi}, {binra}.,gismu,tragedy,bet,betr,betri,,
column29: bevri,$x_{1}$ carries/hauls/bears/transports cargo $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ from $x_{4}$ over path $x_{5}$; $x_{1}$ is a carrier/[porter].,Alienation from $x_2$ to $x_3$ is implied.  See also {marce}, {muvdu}, {benji}, {klama}.,gismu,carry,bev,bei,bevr,bevri,,
column30: bidju,$x_{1}$ is a bead/pebble [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.,See also {bolci}, {canre}, {lakse}, {dirgo}.,gismu,bead,bidj,bidju,,
column31: bifce,$x_{1}$ is a bee/wasp/hornet of species/breed $x_{2}$.,See also {cinki}, {sfani}, {lakse}.,gismu,bee,bic,bifc,bifce,,
column32: bikla,$x_{1}$ whips/lashes/snaps [a sudden violent motion].,See also {skori}, {darxi}.,gismu,whip,bik,bikl,bikla,,
column33: bilga,$x_{1}$ is bound/obliged to/has the duty to do/be $x_{2}$ in/by standard/agreement $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ must do $x_{2}$.,Also $x_3$ frame of reference.  See also {zifre}, {fuzme}.,gismu,must,obliged,big,bilg,bilga,,
column34: bilma,$x_{1}$ is ill/sick/diseased with symptoms $x_{2}$ from disease $x_{3}$.,See also {kanro}, {mikce}, {spita}, {senci}, {kafke}, {binra}.,gismu,ill,bi'a,bilm,bilma,,

column8: basfa,$x_1$ is an omnibus for carrying $x_2$ in medium $x_3$ propelled by $x_4$.,Cf. {sorprekarce}; {pavloibasfa} for single-decker, {relyloibasfa} for double-decker {jonbasfa} for articulated, {clajonbasfa} for bi-articulated, {dizbasfa} for low-floor, {drucaubasfa} for open top, {kumbasfa} for coach, {dicybasfa} for trolleybus.,experimental gismu,bus,omnibus,basfa,,
column9: bavza,$x_1$ will happen in $x_2$ length of time; $x_1$ will happen $x_2$ length of time after $x_3$,See {ba}, {za}, {bavjbi}, {bavda'o}, {puvza},experimental gismu,in,later,bavza,,
column10: bekpi,$x_1$ is the 'back', dorsum of body $x_2$,Opposite of ventral part of the body. Not necessarily should be a posterior part of the body. Determined by bilateral symmetry of the body. See also {vente}, {trixe}, {cutne}.,experimental gismu,back of the body,dorsum,bekpi,,
column11: benre,$x_1$ is the "beneficiary"/intended-recipient of $x_2$ (event/action), as intended by $x_3$ // $x_2$ is done for $x_1$,A "beneficiary" here is someone or something for which something is done, and this relation may be either beneficial or disadvantageous. Consider "I poisoned the cake for him" vs "I baked a cake for him" ("for him to eat" would be a purpose/goal). See also {be'ei}, {kosmu}, {terzu'e}, {selxau},experimental gismu,beneficiary,benre,be'ei,se be'ei,
column12: bergu,$x_1$ pertains to bear goo metaphysics in aspect $x_2$,,experimental gismu,bear goo,bergu,,
column13: besto,$x_1$ dons metaphorical asbestos suit $x_2$ to guard against flames $x_3$ on topic $x_4$ from $x_5$, who disagrees with post $x_6$ for reason $x_7$, not realizing that the post was meant to be sent to $x_8$ rather than all of mailing list $x_9$ (default jboste) where it was posted in response to email  $x_{10}$, whose author wishes selma'o  $x_{11}$ (default SE) were extended to concisely express place  $x_{12}$ of brivla  $x_{13}$ (default besto) which has place structure  $x_{14}$ and too many places because of sadistic whim  $x_{15}$ of brivla-maker  $x_{16}$, who also created brivla  $x_{17}$ which has place structure  $x_{18}$, and so winds up using too many of cmavo  $x_{19}$ (default zi'o) in order to make the brivla ( $x_{13}$) more usable by standard  $x_{20}$ and wishes they had never heard of the word besto for reason  $x_{21}$, not realizing for reason  $x_{22}$ that it was suggested sarcastically due to boredom  $x_{23}$ of person  $x_{24}$, who is proposing it against better judgement  $x_{25}$ because it is fun by standard  $x_{26}$, but still wishes it had as many places as  $x_{27}$ (default du) for reason  $x_{28}$, and feels like throwing in epistemology sumti  $x_{29}$, because he/she knows both that gismu  $x_{30}$ (default besto) has its place structure defined by run-on sentence  $x_{31}$ and that epistemology sumti are used in gismu  $x_{32}$ by epistemology  $x_{33}$, notwithstanding the fact that  $x_{34}$ actually has a use for besto places  $x_{35}$ (default 1) through  $x_{36}$ (default $x_7$) and wishes this weren't an extremely long and stupid joke, longer than joke  $x_{37}$ and stupider than joke  $x_{38}$ but still appreciated by  $x_{39}$ - a fact which says  $x_{40}$ about them in the opinion of  $x_{41}$ - but not seen as even remotely amusing by  $x_{42}$, who is aware that  $x_{43}$ has a use for the gismu besto because of  $x_{45}$,A joke gismu from http://mw.lojban.org/papri/besto . Place $x_{44}$ is absent for some reason.,experimental gismu,,besto,,
column14: firca,$x_1$ flirts with $x_2$ by doing $x_3$,See {cinse}, {pamta'a}, {cinjikca}, {mletritra}, {gletu},experimental gismu,flirt,firca,,
column15: fizbu,$x_1$ is excited/feels excitement about $x_2$ (event/property); $x_2$ excites $x_1$,See {ue'i}, {entuzi},experimental gismu,excite,excited,fizbu,,
column16: fizde,$x_1$ awaits for $x_2$ (event) with bated breath; $x_1$ waits for the occurrence of $x_2$ excitedly/restlessly; colloquially: $x_1$ just cannot wait for $x_2$ to happen; $x_1$ is eager for event $x_2$.,The colloquial definition is figurative: the waiting must and will be performed, but $x_1$ wants $x_2$ to happen as soon as possible/to just come already- for time to flow faster. This is how a child feels on Christmas Eve night for Christmas Day. Usually positive; the negative version is essentially "dread". There should be a sense of longing (but future-oriented), intensity, and/or aching for what $x_1$ vaguely expects to happen (independent of what actually does end up happening). See also: {fizbu} (which lacks the sense of waiting), {denpa} (which lacks the sense of excitement and which has too many terbri). Proposed rafsi: "-fiz-".,experimental gismu,await,cannot wait for,eager,with bated breath,fiz,fizde,,
column17: flese,$x_1$ is (a) philosophy/ideology (one sense) about/of/pertaining to topic/subfield (one sense) $x_2$ with subfield (different sense)/features/details/specifics/specific idea(s) $x_3$, with methodology $x_4$, followed/thought/considered by $x_5$ (thinker/philosopher/individual); philosophy $x_1$ is characterized by values/thoughts/opinions/ruminations $x_3$ about topic/subject $x_2$.,May also include code of conduct, ethical protocol, mode of thought, life-musings, etc.. x5 need not be an ardent supporter of the philosophy, although a certain degree of substance might be implied by the connection of being a philosophy (rather than a passing thought or idea) thereof; x5 does not need to be professional. Proposed short rafsi: -les-. See also: {pijyske}, {filsofiia}, {filsofo}, {marde}, {lijda}, {saske}, {jinvi}, {sidbo}, {pensi}, {prije}, {djuno}, {krici}, {menli}, {jijnu}, {senpi}, {birti}.,experimental gismu,philosophy,les,flese,,
column18: flipo,$x_1$ reflects Filipino culture/nationality/language/geography in aspect $x_2$,,experimental gismu,,flipo,,
column19: fuvla,$x_1$ is a loanword meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$, based on word $x_4$ in language $x_5$.,Cf. {fugvo},experimental gismu,borrowed word,loan,loan-word,fuvla,,
column20: galki,$x_1$ is a galaxy, of contents $x_2$ and other characteristics/parameters $x_3$; $x_1$ is galactic.,,experimental gismu,galaxy,galki,,
column21: ganda,$x_1$ is turned off / deactivated, not performing function $x_2$,Antonym of {katci}.,experimental gismu,deactivated,turned off,ganda,,
column22: kamro,*$moved to {karmo}$*,don't use this word,experimental gismu,,kamro,,
column23: kanpe,$x_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $x_2$ (event), expected likelihood $x_3$ (0-1, default {li} {so'a} i.e. near 1); $x_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $x_2$ (event) to be $x_3$.,The value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether kanpe means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although kanpe never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see {pacna}. kanpe with $x_3$ not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); not-necessarily desirous wish, not necessarily desirous hope. See also {ba'a}, {djica}, {pacna}, {lakne}, {cunso}.,experimental gismu,expect,see,kanpe,,
column24: kapsi,$x_1$ is a chili/bell pepper (Capsicum) of species/variety $x_2$,cf. {kapsiku}.,experimental gismu,chili,pepper,kapsi,,
column25: katci,$x_1$ is turned on / activated / operational for function $x_2$,Syn. {akti}. Turned off = {ganda}, to turn on (agentive) = {katcygau}, to turn off (agentive) = {gandygau}. Also see {tolpo'u}.,experimental gismu,turned on,katci,,
column26: katso,$x_1$ is a/the penis [body-part] of $x_2$,Italian "cazzo"; cf. {pinji}, {nakpinji},experimental gismu,,katso,,
column27: kavzi,$x_1$ is "quasi" in property (ka) $x_2$; $x_1$ is "similar but not quite"/analogical to/comparable to having property $x_2$; $x_1$ is a quasi-$x_2$.,Different from {simlu} in that {simlu} assumes that the seemingly present property is actually absent, and different from {simsa} in that {simsa} focuses on the similarity, whereas this word focuses on the difference.,experimental gismu,,kavzi,,
column28: kazmi,$x_1$ (li) is the cardinality of set $x_2$ (set),Exactly equivalent to {nilzilcmi} except in morphology. But cardinality is a pretty fundamental thing in mathematics (in some sense, even more fundamental than natural numbers), so it arguably deserves a gismu; this will also shorten many lujvo which should use a word for cardinality. The second terbri should technically be filled by a set, but other structures could probably be acceptable; these might include groups and other algebraic structures, multisets, lists, classes, vel sim. {ci'i} alone (without being followed by another (integer-representing) digit) indicates an infinite cardinality but not which one; beware the assumption of the Axiom of Choice or Generalized Continuum Hypothesis.,experimental gismu,cardinality,kazmi,,
column29: kebzo,$x_1$ reflects Quebec nationality/culture/geography in aspect $x_2$ (ka),,experimental gismu,Quebec,Quebecois,kebzo,,
column30: kekti,$x_{1}$ is $10^{(-30)}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).,See also: "{ketro}", "{ronti}", "{gocti}", etc.,experimental gismu,1E-30,quecto,kekti,,
column31: kelto,$x_1$ is represents Celtic culture in aspect $x_2$,Not necessarily confined to the British Isles. See also: {skoto}.,experimental gismu,Celt,Celtic,kelto,,
column32: kenka,$k_1$ is a quantity of cake/torte/tart/pie/flan made of/containing ingredients $k_2$, prepared according to method $k_3$.,Cf. {titnanba}, {jupypesxu}, {rutytisna},experimental gismu,cake,kenka,,
column33: kerni,$x_1$ (state/event/fact) is fair/just/righteous to $x_2$ according to $x_3$,According to $x_3$, the way $x_2$ is treated in $x_1$ is just (it is "as things should be"). See also {pajni}, {sarxe}, {vrude}, {vudypai}, {nutli}, {pairnu'i}. (Many of those words deal with some judge acting "fairly" or "justly" in some matter, which kerni does not. In fact, a "to'e kerni" (unfair) situation is not necessarily the result of evil, may be considered unfair to all parties, and may be nobody's fault.),experimental gismu,fair,just,righteous,kerni,,
column34: kesri,$x_1$ (property of $x_2$) is a stereotype of $x_2$ (object/set), held by $x_3$,Does not necessarily carry a negative connotation. Stereotypes are, basically, the characteristics that come to one's mind when they imagine a particular object, regardless of actual commonality. e.g. Many people stereotypically think of roses as red, even though there are plenty of roses that aren't red. See {sei'i}, {lemkai}, {le'e},experimental gismu,stereotype,kesri,,
column35: ketro,$x_{1}$ is $10^{30}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).,See also: "{kekti}", "{ronro}", "{gotro}", etc.,experimental gismu,1E30,quetta,ketro,,
column36: kibro,$x_1$ pertains to the internet/cyberspace in aspect $x_2$.,Proposed by xorxes. Short rafsi -kib-. Cf. {mujysamseltcana}.,experimental gismu,cyberspace,internet,kib,kibro,,
column37: kloje,$x_1$ (set/space) is closed under(/wrt) operator/relation $x_2$; $x_2$ has closure in $x_1$.,Identical to {klojere} but is a gismu (as it might be considered to be a fairly fundamental concept which is productive).,experimental gismu,closure,closure,kloje,,
column38: kokso,$x_1$ is a coconut of variety/cultivar $x_2$,See also {cidja}, {rutrkoko},experimental gismu,coconut,kokso,,
column39: konve,$x_1$ (set/shape) is convex in sense $x_2$.,A function cannot really be convex (its epigraph can be though). This word is the gismu form of "{konvexi}".,experimental gismu,convex,konve,,
column40: korvo,$s_1$ is a crow/raven of species $s_2$.,See {cipnrkorvo} for a non-experimental version of this word.,experimental gismu,crow,raven,korvo,,
column41: kosmu,$x_1$ (abstraction) is a purpose/use of $x_2$ (object or event), attributed by $x_3$,Place structure has been inverted from the original version to match {krinu}. Syn. {erpi}. See {ko'au}, {terpli}, {terzu'e}, {terfi'i},experimental gismu,purpose,purpose,kosmu,ko'au,se ko'au,
column42: krali,$x_1$ (NU) is a legal/moral entitlement of $x_2$ (individual/mass) by standard $x_3$. $x_2$ is a legal person.,Normative principles, variously construed as legal, social, or moral freedoms or entitlements. {rarkrali} for "natural rights and {flakrali} for "legal rights"; {xuskrali} for "claim rights" and {zifkrali} for "liberty rights"; {srakrali} for "positive rights" and {ri'urkrali}/{badykrali} for "negative rights"; {sepkrali} for "individual rights" and {gumkrali} for "group rights"; {selcemkrali} for "civil rights" and {seljeckrali} for "political rights"; {jiknykrali} for "economic rights", {jikykrali} for "social rights", and {klukrali} for "cultural rights"; {remkrali} for "human rights" and {dalkrali} for "animal rights"; perhaps {kralyxai} for "violate". Cf. {selfla}, {selzi'e}, {terzi'e}, {selzau}, {selpikta}.,experimental gismu,person,right,rights,krali,,
column43: kroxo,$x_1$ is the core/nub/essence/heart/true part of entity/body/building/thing $x_2$,Phonologically inspired from 'core', 'heart', and  (romaji: kokoro).,experimental gismu,core,essence,nub,kroxo,,
column44: kukru,$x_1$ is orthogonal/perpendicular/right/at right angle/rectified/square/normal to $x_2$, where they (are projected to) intersect orthogonally at locus/on set $x_3$, otherwise being utterly distinct (and not even on the same axis/scale) in sense $x_4$,This definition approximately parallels that of {panra}. For geometric orthogonality, fill $x_4$ with "geometry". This can be applied to lines, planes, curves, manifolds, vectors (endowed with inner product), etc. $x_1$ and $x_2$ are necessarily orthogonal at only $x_3$ (but may be elsewhere, such as if they are hyperplanes). $x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetric terbri in this word under permutation. Also: "with negative reciprocal slope local to". This is a local property.,experimental gismu,normal,orthogonal,perpendicular,right angle,right-angle,square,kukru,,
column45: kurti,$x_1$ (proposition) is data/information being an example of deep formalization of subject $x_2$ gathered by method $x_3$ (proposition),See also {datni}, {lanli}, {tadni}, {saske}, {mekso}, {aigne}, {krtis}.,experimental gismu,,kurti,,
column46: lacni,$x_1$ is an eyewear used/worn by $x_2$ serving purpose $x_3$.,It is a frame worn in front of the eyes and bears or does not bear transparent/semi-transparent/non-transparent shields for visual correction, eye protection, fashion, or entertainment. The shields are not necessarily lenses. Cf. {le'otci} or {le'orlacni} for a corrective type, which may include {tidlacni} for reading glasses and {xrelacni} for bifocal and trifocal glasses; {badlacni} for a protective type, which may include {srulacni} for goggles and {solylacni} for sunglasses; {jadlacni} for fashion glasses, which may include {rekmeclacni} for rimless glasses and solylacni; {mincimdylacni} for 3D glasses.,experimental gismu,eyeglasses,eyewear,glasses,goggle,spectacle,lacni,,
column47: landa,$x_1$ is the ISO-named country (or subdivision thereof) of people $x_2$ with ISO-name $x_3$, according to rule/specification $x_4$,See also: {gugde}, {jviso}.,experimental gismu,country,landa,,
column48: lanru,$x_1$ is a lantern/flashlight/portable light source illuminating $x_2$, in style/with properties $x_3$,Any small, portable light source designed to be carried; see {lamdu}, {fagri}, {gusni}.  It may be a garden decoration, so it may not even emit light, or light is metaphoric; see {jadni}.,experimental gismu,flashlight,garden lantern,lantern,lanru,,
column49: larva,$x_1$ is an organism $x_2$ at its larva stage of development,See also {sovda}, {altrici}, {inmago},experimental gismu,larva,larva,,
column50: majvu,$x_1$ is a microrganism, virus, protein, spore, pathogen, or other such substance which causes or is intimately associated with disease(s)/symptoms $x_2$.,See also: "{bilma}", "{jurme}", "{vidru}", "{prejume}".,experimental gismu,pathogen,majvu,,
column52: mango,$x_1$ is a mango [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$.,{rutrmango} is the non-experimental synonym of mango. {ricrmango} for mango tree.,experimental gismu,mango,mango,,
column53: manva,x1 is ten thousand [10000; $10^4$] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3,Cf. {grake}, {mitre}, {snidu}, {stero}, {delno}, {molro}, {kelvo}, {xampo}, {gradu}, {litce}, {merli}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {kilto}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}.,experimental gismu,10,000,manva,,
column54: mapra,$x_1$ is a quantity of fluff of composition/structure/characterization/substance $x_2$; $x_1$ is fluffy/airy/soft/fuzzy in texture,Visual and tactile. Most likely is malleable, but this word has no such implications inherently; porousness or foaminess is likewise not implied. Might also include "cushiony", "cotton-like", "wool-like"; a fractal nature might be present.  For fuzziness: not necessarily hairy or furry, but must be soft; not bristly (which implies stiffness and hardness).  See also: {ranti}, {rufsu}, {xutla}, {panje}, {dilnu}, {mapni}, {sunla}, {fonmo}, {jduli}, {pesxu}, {marji}.,experimental gismu,airy,cushiony,fluff,fluffy,fuzzy,soft,mapra,,
column56: matxe,$x_1$ is magnetism/magnetization (or magnetic charge or magnetic current; or part of a magnetic dipole) in/on/of/produced by/evinced by/associated with $x_2$ (monopole or a dipole, taken in whole or just as a single side/part/pole thereof) of polarity/quantity $x_3$ (default: positive, which indicates magnetic-south in English).,If the signum of $x_3$ is positive, then the charge being referred to is what English speakers call "magnetic-south (pole)"; if it is negative, then the referent is what English speakers call "magnetic-north (pole)". This definition is modelled on that of "{dikca}", which it is intended to parallel. If one does not prefer this gismu, one probably can use "{maktcaxe}" as an equivalent/synonym, but that word uses another experimental gismu ("{tcaxe}") in its veljvo. Replaces "{matce}" due to {gimkamsmikezypro}.,experimental gismu,magnetic-north,magnetic-south,magnetization,matxe,,
column57: bangyklesi,$x_1$ is a dialect of language $x_2$,See {klesi} {lo} {bangu},lujvo,,,,
column58: banjikske,$s_1$ is sociolinguistics based on methodology $s_2$.,,lujvo,sociolinguistics,,,
column59: bankle,$x_1$ is a dialect of language $x_2$,See {banklemei}, {bangu},lujvo,dialect,,,
column60: banklemei,$x_1$ is a language with dialects $x_2$ (full set),A narrower term than {bangu}, doesn't denote dialects. See also {bankle},lujvo,,,,
column61: banmenske,$s_1$ is psycholinguistics based on methodology $s_2$.,Cf. {banjikske}, {banpliske}.,lujvo,psycholinguistics,,,
column62: banpliske,$s_1$ is pragmatics based on methodology $s_2$.,The science of how language interacts with the world. Cf. {banjikske}, {banmenske}.,lujvo,pragmatics,,,
column63: banra'a,$s1$ pertains to language of $s2$=$b2$,Cultural gismu replacement lujvo for languages: From gismu {bangu} and {srana},lujvo,of language,,,
column65: banvoksle,$s_1$ (phone/speech sounds; specifically is linguistic and vocal) is a phoneme in/of segment of utterance/speech stream $s_2$=$v_1$ in language $b_1$ of speaker $v_2$=$b_2$ in order to communicate/express $b_3$ (si'o/du'u; not quote(?)), produced with body-parts/tools $x_6$ at loci/in position/manner (of articulation) $x_7$,Must be vocal. x2 is a recognized/represented by (belongs to equivalence class of) phoneme x1. Contrast with: {bancocysle} (which is nonvocal). Recognition of a phoneme as linguistically distinct is language-dependent; b1 is a language which includes/recognizes said phoneme (and which realizes/recognizes/categorizes/divides phones s2 into the equivalence class of that phoneme). x6 and x7 are not predictable from the veljvo.,lujvo,phoneme,,,
column66: banvokyvelganzu,$x_1$ is a phonotactic rule pertaining to/organizing sound(s) $x_2$ into $x_3$ in/pertaining to language $x_4$ proposed/applied by $x_5$,,lujvo,phonotactic,,,
column67: banxre,$x_1$ is a code-switched mixture of languages $x_2$, used by $x_3$,See {bangu}, {mixre},lujvo,code switch,,,
column68: ba'orzu'e,$z_1$ grows $b_1$ for purpose/goal $z_3$ to size/form $b_2$ from $b_3$.,Cf. {tsiju}, {spati}, {cange}.,lujvo,grow,,,
column69: ba'ostu,$s_1$ is a nursery where $b_1$ grows to size/form $b_2$ from $b_3$.,Cf. {ba'orzu'e}, {cange}, {spati}, {tsiju}.,lujvo,nursery,,,
column70: baple'i,$p_1$ pays bribe $p_2$ to $p_3$ for favor/services $p_4$=$b_2$.,Not necessarily with a negative connotation.,lujvo,baksheesh,bribe,,,
column71: bapse'u,$b_2$=$s_1$ is a slave to $b_1$=$s_2$ in manner/service $s_3$.,Synonymous to {selbaise'u}. See {bapli}, {selfu}.,lujvo,slave,,,
column73: barfa'e,$f_1$ is inside-out, with part(s) $b_1$ currently on the outside.,,lujvo,inside out,wrong-side-out,,,
column74: barfa'u,$b_1$=$f_1$ falls outside of $b_2$ from (inside of) $f_3$,See also {bartu}, {farlu},lujvo,fall outside of,,,
column75: barfle,$x_1$ is a stream of $x_2$ flowing out of $x_3$.,,lujvo,flow out,,,
column76: barga'e,$x_1$ (observer/perceiver) senses external stimulus $x_2$ via means $x_3$ (sense/sensor) under conditions $x_4$; $x_3$ is a sense organ/exteroperceptor used to observe $x_2$ which is outside the observer $x_1$ under conditions $x_4$.,,lujvo,exteroperceive,exteroperceptor,,,
column77: barjygu'a,$g_1$ is a bartender at bar $b_1$, serving $b_2$ to audience/patrons $b_3$.,Cf. {barjyse'u}.,lujvo,barkeep,barkeeper,barman,bartender,,,
column78: barjyja'a,$j_1$ is a bar/caf manager/owner of bar/caf $j_2$=$b_1$.,Cf. {barjyse'u}, {barjygu'a}.,lujvo,bar manager,caf manager,,,
column79: barjyse'u,$s_1$ is a bartender at bar $b_1$, serving $b_2$ to audience/patrons $b_3$=$s_2$.,Cf. {barjygu'a}, {djabeipre}.,lujvo,barkeep,barkeeper,barman,bartender,,,
column80: barkalri,$x_1$ is an exit/outlet/way out of $x_2$ for $x_3$.,Cf. {li'avro}.,lujvo,exit,outlet,,,
column81: barkalyle'o,$l_1$=$b_1$ is a monocle/pair of (eye)glasses/spectacles allowing the clear sight of $l_2$ (light) by $k_2$ (wearer).,Cf. {lenjo}, {kanla}, {bartu}, {le'otci}, {vistci}.,lujvo,eyeglasses,glasses,monocle,specs,spectacles,,,
column82: barkla,$x_1$=$k_1$ exits/goes out/outside from $x_2$=$k_3$=$b_1$ with route $x_3$=$k_4$ with transportation method $x_5$.,Omitted: x5 = klama2 (destination) = bartu1 (something external).  Cf. {bartu}, {klama}, {zevykla}, {barli'a}.,lujvo,exit,to exit,,,
column83: barklagau,$g_1$ ejects $k_1$ from $b_2$=$k_3$ via $k_4$ using means $k_5$.,Cf. {bartu}, {klama}, {gasnu}.,lujvo,eject,force outside,take outside,,,
column85: barli'a,$x_1$=$c_1$ leaves/exits/goes outside of $x_2$=$c_2$=$b_2$ via route $x_3$=$c_3$.,Cf. {barkla}.,lujvo,exit,to exit,,,
column86: barme'e,$c_1$ is an exonym of/for $c_2$, used/given by $c_3$.,An exonym is a name externally given to something or someone, especially a place, ethnic group or language. It is the opposite of an endonym, a self-given or internal name ({sezme'e} or {nerme'e}). For instance, "" is an exonym for the U.S.A., and "Navajo" is an exonym for the Din people.,lujvo,exonym,,,
column87: barterzga,$x_1$ is a sense organ used to observe $x_2$ which is outside the observer $x_3$ under conditions $x_4$.,,lujvo,exteroperceptor,,,
column88: baskle,$x_1$ is a replacement-dialect replacing words $x_2$ (sequence) with words $x_3$ (sequence) in language $x_4$,,lujvo,ce ki tau jau,,,
column89: basklepli,$x_1$ uses $x_2$ (zo quote) as a replacement for $x_3$ (zo quote) in language $x_4$,,lujvo,,,,
column90: basme'e,$b_1$=$c_1$ is a pseudonym of $c_2$ to/used-by namer/name-user $c_3$ (person).,Cf. {cmebasti}.,lujvo,pseudonym,,,
column91: basxarfri,$x_1$ vicariously experiences $x_2$ (ka/nu/li'i), imagining themself in place of $x_3$,See {basti}, {xanri}, {lifri},lujvo,vicariously experience,,,
column92: basygau,$g_1$ (agent) replaces/substitutes $b_1$ for/instead of $b_2$ in circumstance $b_3$.,,lujvo,replace,substitute,,,
column93: basysi'u,$x_1$ (plurality/set) replace/trade places with one another in circumstance $x_2$.,Cf. {basti}, {simxu}. Similar in meaning to {simbasti}, but merges $basti_1$ and $basti_2$ together.,lujvo,replace one another,trade places,,,
column94: basyvla,$v_1$=$b_1$ is an anaphora/pronoun/pro-word in language $v_2$ replacing word $b_2$ under conditions $b_3$.,,lujvo,anaphora,pronoun,pro-word,,,
column95: basyzumfau,$x_1$=$f_1$ is an act/event of replacement, with $x_2$=$b_1$ replacing/substituting for $x_3$=$b_2$.,Use {zumbasfau} instead.,lujvo,exchange,replacement,swap,switcheroo,,,
column96: batfendi,$b_1$=$f_1$ (agent) bites apart $b_2$=$f_2$ into sections/partitions $f_3$ with bite locus $b_3$.,,lujvo,bite apart,,,
column97: batkakpa,$x_1$=$b_1$=$k_1$ takes bite $x_2$=$b_3$=$k_2$ out of $x_3$=$b_2$=$k_3$ using teeth/implement $x_4$=$b_4$=$k_4$,,lujvo,take bite,,,
column98: batkyci'a,$c_1$ writes $c_2$ on medium $c_3$ with keyboard $c_4$.,Cf. {lercu'aca'a}.,lujvo,type,,,
column99: batkyfoi,$x1$=$b2$=$f1$ is a keyboard for purpose $x2$=$b3$ of material $x3$=$b4$,,lujvo,keyboard,,,
column100: batkyuidje,$b_1$=$u_1$ is a button in user interface $b_2$=$u_2$ with purpose $b_3$.,From {batke} + {uidje}. Synonymous to {batke zei uidje}.,lujvo,button,,,
column101: batmai,$m_1$=$b_1$ is chewing gum of type/composition $m_2$ in shape/form $m_3$.,Cf. {batci}, {marji}.,lujvo,chewing gum,gum,,,
column102: baucmu,$c_1$ is the basis of language $c_2$=$b_1$ used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).,,lujvo,language basis,,,
column103: baucre,$c_1$ is a language expert of language $c_2$=$b_1$.,Cf. {sorbaucre}.,lujvo,language expert,,,
column104: baukle,$k_1$ is a language type/category/subgroup/subset (linguistic taxon) within languages $b_1$=$k_2$, with typological features $k_3$.,,lujvo,language class,linguistic taxon,taxon,,,
column105: baupli,$x_1$ uses language $x_2$ for purpose $x_3$.,Cf. {bangu}, {pilno}.,lujvo,say,speak,talk,to speak a language,,,
column107: ba'urnoi,$n_1$=$b_2$ is a spoken/uttered message about subject $n_2$ uttered by $n_3$=$b_1$ to intended audience $n_4$.,,lujvo,spoken message,,,
column108: ba'urslefrica,$x_1$ (sound) is phonemically distinguished from $x_2$ (sound) in language $x_3$,From {ba'urvlasle} and {frica},lujvo,phonemic,,,
column109: ba'urtadji,$t_1$ is $b_1$'s pronunciation of utterance $b_2$ under conditions $t_3$.,,lujvo,accent,pronunciation,,,
column110: ba'urvlasle,$s_1$=$b_2$ is a phoneme/most basic phonological subunit of word, meaning/causing $v_2$ in language $v_3$.,See also phone (={ba'usle}) and morpheme (={genvlasle}).,lujvo,phoneme,,,
column111: bauske,$s_1$ is linguistics based on methodology $s_2$.,Cf. {banpliske}, {banjikske}, {banmenske}.,lujvo,linguistics,,,
column112: ba'usku,$s_1$=$b_1$ (agent) says $s_2$=$b_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $s_3$ through expressive medium $s_4$.,Unlike {cusku}, which can refer to other forms of expression, ba'usku refers only to talking. Cf. {tavla}.,lujvo,say,,,
column113: ba'usle,$s_1$ (phone/speech sounds) is a segment of utterance/speech stream $s_2$=$b_2$.,Cf. {tavla}, {lerpoi}.,lujvo,phone,segment,speech sound,,,
column114: bausmu,$x_1$ is the meaning of linguistic expression $x_2$ in language $x_3$ according to interpreter $x_4$,See also {smuni}, {bangu}.,lujvo,meaning,,,
column115: bauspi,$s_1$ is a split piece of language $b_1$=$s_2$.,Poetic compound.,lujvo,,,,
column116: bavdji,$d_1$ desires/wants/wishes for future $d_2$ (event/state) for purpose $d_3$ with desired future point $b_1$. $d_1$ aspires.,b1 refers to the point in time when the aspiring individual wants the desire to come true; not the time they expect it to come true.,lujvo,aspire,,,
column117: bavgaupei,$g_1$=$p_1$ thinks about/considers/ponders/reflects upon doing $b_1$=$g_2$=$p_2$ (nu) after $b_2$ (nu),I found that there was no good, single word for "thinking about doing ... after ...". (See {balvi}, {gasnu}, and {pensi}),lujvo,thinking about doing,,,
column118: bavji'i,$x_1$ predicts that $x_2$ (du'u) is true in/about future time/place $x_3$ on grounds $x_4$.,From {balvi} {jinvi}. Nearly synonymous with {la'erji'i}, {bavykri}. Related words: {kanpe}, {bavyxusra}, {bavyske}, {cfabalvi}, {tembalvi}, {selbalvi}, {ba'alvi}, {datru}, {temci}, {purci}, {cabna}, {uenai}, {ba'a}, {ba}.,lujvo,anticipate,expect,forecast,foresee,foretell,predict,,,
column119: bavla'i,$b_1$=$l_1$ is next after $b_2$=$l_2$ in sequence $l_3$.,Cf. {prula'i}.,lujvo,following,next,,,
column120: bavla'ima'i,$m_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is the next month; $m_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is the month following $b_2$=$l_2$, month standard $m_3$.,Cf. {prula'ima'i}, {cabma'i}.,lujvo,month after,next month,,,
column121: bavlamcerni,$c_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is tomorrow morning; $c_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is the morning after $b_2$=$l_2$ at location $c_3$.,Morning (={cerni}), this morning (={cabdeicerni}), yesterday morning (={prulamcerni}).,lujvo,tomorrow morning,,,
column122: bavlamcte,$n_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is the night after $b_2$=$l_2$ at location $n_3$.,{cabycte} is tonight, whether or not it is currently night yet. {bavlamcte} is tomorrow night, even if {cabycte} is still in the future. Cf. {nicte}, {prulamcte}, {bavlamdei}.,lujvo,tomorrow night,,,
column123: bavlamdei,$d_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is tomorrow; $d_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is the day following $b_2$=$l_2$, day standard $d_3$.,Cf. {prulamdei}, {bavlamcte}.,lujvo,next day,tomorrow,,,
column124: bavlamjeftu,$j_1$=$b_1$ is the week directly after $b_2$ by standard $j_3$.,Cf. {prulamjeftu}, {cabjeftu}.,lujvo,next week,week after,,,
column125: bavlamke'u,$x_1$ is the next/following time that $x_2$ happens.,Cf. {balvi}, {lamji}, {krefu}, {bavlamdei}.,lujvo,next time,,,
column126: bavlamna'a,$n_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is next year; $n_1$=$b_1$=$l_1$ is the year following $b_2$=$l_2$ by year standard $n_3$.,Cf. {prulamna'a}, {cabna'a}.,lujvo,next year,year after,,,
column127: bavlamvanci,$v_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is tomorrow evening; $v_1$=$l_1$=$b_1$ is the evening after $b_2$=$l_2$ at location $v_3$.,Evening (={vanci}), this evening (={cabvanci}), yesterday evening (={prulamvanci}).,lujvo,next evening,tomorrow evening,,,
column128: bavmojnalka'e,$k_1$ is unable to/incapable of remembering future $k_2$ under conditions $k_3$. $k_1$ has anterograde amnesia/memory loss.,Second place describes scope of loss. Cf. {mojnalka'e} {prumojnalka'e},lujvo,anterograde amnesia,,,
column129: bavrai,$x_1$ is/are the latest, most forward in time among $x_2$,smudukti zo {prurai},lujvo,latest,,,
column130: bavyfa'a,$x_1$ is futureward/to the futureward side/in the future of $x_2$ in frame of reference/according to observer or vantage point $x_3$.,$x_1$ and $x_2$ probably should always be events ("{nu}"). This word is close to equivalent to "{balvi}"; a reasonable proposal would be to combine the two words, in analogy with spacial direction brivla; many, if not all, of the available glosses of one probably are shared with the other; minor connotational differences may exist. It means "more recent/more recent side (of event)" if $x_1$ is in the past. In a conceptual universe in which time is not oriented or in which there are multiple time dimensions, or perhaps if time is behaving exotically (such as with time-travel), $x_3$ can also be a "which faces" sumti slot, as in "{zunle}".,lujvo,after,forward in time,futureward,in the future of,more recent,to the future,toward the future,,,
column131: bavyfarvi,$f_1$ ages / passes through time into future form $f_2 = b_1$ from current / past / earlier form $f_3 = b_2$ through stages $f_4$.,Made from {balvi} + {farvi}. Cf. {citno}, {nilnalci'o}.,lujvo,ages,aging,,,
column134: bavyse'i,$x_1$ is the future self/identity of $x_2$; $x_1$ is $x_2$ in the future.,From {balvi} {sevzi}. $x_2$ is usually a person. Compare {cabyse'i}, {pruse'i}.,lujvo,future identity,future self,,,
column135: bavyske,$s_1$ is futurology/future studies of/about ideas of the future $b_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.,Science about the future, not to be confused with science in the future.,lujvo,future studies,futurology,,,
column136: bavyspe,$s_1$ is the fianc(e)/betrothed of $s_2$ under law/custom/tradition/system/convention $s_3$.,Cf. {pruspe}.,lujvo,affianced,bespoken,betrothed,bride-to-be,engaged,fianc,fiance,groom-to-be,,,
column137: bavyxusra,$x_1$ asserts/prophesies that $x_2$=$b_1$ is true about the future of $b_2$.,Compare to {bavji'i}, {bavykri}, which both deal with thought predictions rather than predictions in speech/writing.,lujvo,foretell,prophesy,prophesy,,,
column138: baxseljibri,$x_1$=$s_1$ is a bank clerk of a bank $x_2$=$b_1$=$s_2$ owned by/in banking system $x_3$=$b_2$ for banking function(s) $x_4$=$b_3$ (event).,{banxa} {se} {jibri},lujvo,bank clerk,,,

column23: bi'ei,number/digit: $2^{(2*5/3)} = 8*(2^{(1/3)})$.,Culturally important. This is the base for the so-called 'binary' prefixes ("kibi-", "mebi-", etc.). By switching to this base, "{ki'o}"/"{kilto}" might (in some Lojban dialects) refer to one thousand twenty-four (id est: 'kibi'); if we denote this number by "$b$" (for "binary" and "base"), then "ki'o"/"kilto" would (in those dialects) refer to $b^3 = (2^{(2*5/3)})^{3} = 2^{(2*5)} = 1024$ (in decimal notation); likewise for any other standard 'binary' prefix (ones which refer to a numeric coefficient of form $2^{(2*5n)}$ for nonzero integer $n$). In any case, "{bi'ei zei kilto}" would probably refer to such a value.,experimental cmavo,binary Metric base,binary prefix base,,,,PA

See also {jenmi} for a military force, {sonci}, {ganzu}, {pulji}.,gismu,military,bil,biln,bilni,,

See also {bandu}, {cirko}, {betri}, {basti}, {bilma}.,gismu,insure,binr,binra,,

column26: firnalselsau,$s_2$ is face-blind, recognizing people by $s_3$ which is not the face, by standard $s_4$,,lujvo,face-blind,prosopagnosic,,,
column27: firti'oxra,$p_1$ is a silhouette of $f_1$ made by $p_3$ in medium $p_4$.,,lujvo,silhouette,,,
column28: firxunfra,$x_1$ blushes due to stimulus $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$,,lujvo,blush,,,
column29: fislytsa,$x_1$ (force) is physically strong in aspect $x_2$ by standard $x_3$,{fisli}, {tsali}. Specifically refers to the physical aspect of {tsali}. Syn. {jikfytsa},lujvo,strong,,,
column30: fitytoltu'i,$x_1$ rejects $x_2$ (offer, suggestion, proposal) from $x_3$.,,lujvo,reject,,,

column32: flacau,$c_1$=$f_3$ [lacks law]/[is lawless with regard to] law(s) $f_1$ specifying $f_2$ (state/event) under conditions $f_4$ by lawgiver(s) $f_5$; $c_1$=$f_3$ is lawless.,Cf. {flalu}, {claxu}.,lujvo,lawless,,,
column33: flacfatrugri,$g_1$=$t_1$ is the Lower House/House of Representatives/House of Commons for territory $t_2$ with members $g_3$=$f_5$.,Cf. {flalu}, {cfari}, {turni}, {girzu}, {flazautrugri}, {truci'e}, {zuktruci'e}, {flatruci'e}, {pairtruci'e}, {vajraifla}.,lujvo,House of Commons,House of Representatives,Lower House,,,
column34: flaci'e,$f_1$ is the legal system concerning topic $f_2$ in society $f_3$,cf. {flalu}, {ciste}. Refers to "the law" as an entity, i.e. the legal system. Also used in compounds describing specific areas of law, such as lanzu flaci'e (family law) or zekri flaci'e (criminal law).,lujvo,law,,,
column35: fladju,$x_1$ is a lawyer,,lujvo,lawyer,,,

column37: flamingo,$x_1$ is a flamingo (Phoenicopterus roseus) of variety $x_2$,,lujvo,,,,

column41: flapro,$fa_1$ rebels against/opposes law $fl_1$, which specifies $fl_2$ (state/event) for community $fl_3$ under conditions $fl_4$ by lawgiver(s) $fl_5$.,,lujvo,rebel,rebellious,,,
