column43: flatruci'e,$c_1$=$t_1$=$f_5$ is the legislative branch of the government of people/territory/domain/subjects $t_2$.,Cf. {flalu}, {turni}, {ciste}, {truci'e}, {zuktruci'e}, {pairtruci'e}, {flacfatrugri}, {flazautrugri}, {vajraifla}.,lujvo,congress,legislative branch,parliament,,,
column44: fi'u zei re zei cinse,$c_1$ is demisexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.,,zei-lujvo,demisexual,,,
column45: fitnese,$x_1$ does fitness training $x_2$ (property of $x_1$) in order to $x_3$ (event),See also {zajba}, {atlete}, {sportivo}, {cilre}, {crezenzu'e}.,fu'ivla,,fitnese,,
column47: fi'urgau,$g_1$ [person/agent] confuses $c_1$ (event/state) for $c_2$ [observer] due to [confusing] property $c_3$ (ka).,,lujvo,baffle,bewilder,confuse,,,
column48: fladra,$x_1$ is lawful, legal according to law $x_2$,,lujvo,lawful,legal,,,
column49: flanaltinbe,$t_1$ is an outlaw not following the law $t_2$ made by $t_3$.,,lujvo,outlaw,,,
column50: flaselgu'e,$g_2$ is a/are citizen(s) of country $g_1$ according to law $f_1$ specifying $f_2$ (state/event) for community $f_3$.,From {flalu}, {gugde}. Cf. {flaxa'u}.,lujvo,citizen,,,
column51: flaxa'u,$x_1$ is a/are legal resident(s) of location/country $x_2$ according to law $f_1$ specifying $f_2$ (state/event) for community $f_3$.,From {flalu}, {xabju}. Cf. {flaselgu'e}.,lujvo,legal resident,resident,,,
column52: flazautrugri,$g_1$=$t_1$ is the Upper House/Senate/House of Lords for territory $t_2$ with members $g_3$=$f_5$=$z_3$.,Cf. {flalu}, {zanru}, {turni}, {girzu}, {flacfatrugri}, {truci'e}, {zuktruci'e}, {flatruci'e}, {pairtruci'e}, {vajraifla}.,lujvo,House of Lords,Senate,Upper House,,,
column53: fleca'e,$x_1$ washes $x_2$ away and is a current/flow/river of/in $x_3$.,See also {flecu} {catke}.,lujvo,,,,
column55: flefa'u,$x_1$ is a fluid or fluid-like pouring to $x_2$ from $x_3$.,,lujvo,,,,
column56: fletrogusmi'i,$x_1$ is a traffic light,See also {klafle},lujvo,traffic light,,,
column57: fletu'u,$x_1$=$t_1$ is a pipe/tube/hose carrying fluid $x_2$=$f_2$=$t_3$ towards $x_3$=$f_3$ from $x_4$=$f_4$ (direction/source),Fluid is any flowable matter (gas, liquid, slurry, powder etc.). Cf. {jaurflevau}, {datnyfle}, {blutu'u}, {tubnu}, {pambe}, {litki}, {gapci}, {bumru}, {danmo}, {purmo}, {pulce}, {sligu}.,lujvo,fluid pipe,hose,pipe,tube,,,
column58: flixru,$x_1$ bounces $x_2$ back to $x_3$ from $x_4$ because of failure $x_5$.,,lujvo,bounce,,,
column59: flizu'e,$x_1$=$z_1$=$f_1$ does $x_2$=$z_2$ to achieve goal $x_3$=$z_3$=$f_2$ which $x_1$ fails to achieve.,,lujvo,try,,,
column60: flubisli,$b_1$=$f_1$ is an iceberg floating on $f_2$ (water, sea etc.).,,lujvo,iceberg,ice shelf,,,
column62: fluplu,$x_1$ is a floating island of material/properties $x_2$ floating on $x_3$.,This is possibly the funniest word in the entirety of Lojban.  See also {fulta} {daplu}.,lujvo,floating island,,,
column64: fomke'acirla,$c_1$ is a quantity/contains Swiss cheese/cheese with holes from source $c_2$.,Cf. {xelveto}, {xelvetik}, {ladru}.,lujvo,swiss cheese,,,
column65: fompralitki,$x_1$ is an effervescent liquid of composition $x_2$, releasing gas $x_3$,See {litki}, {fonmo}, {cupra}, {tabrelkijno},lujvo,effervescent,fizzy,,,
column66: fomvanju,$v_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of sparkling wine from fruit/grapes $v_2$.,Cf. {fonmo}, {vanju}, {risyvanju}, {xalka}, {jikru}, {birje}, {uiski}, {campania}, {vo'otka}, {koinka}.,lujvo,champagne,sparkling wine,,,
column67: fomymledi,$x_1$ is yeast of species $x_2$ growing on $x_3$.,see also {nanba}, {birje}, {vanju},lujvo,yeast,,,
column68: fonjo'e,$x_1$ calls $x_2$ on the phone.,See {fonxa}, {jorne}.,lujvo,call on the phone,,,
column69: fonjudri,$j_1$ is a telephone number of $j_2$.,,lujvo,phone number,telephone number,,,
column70: fonselrango,$rango_2$ is a smartphone with embedded phone $rango_1$, which performs function $rango_3$,See also {smartefono}.,lujvo,,,,
column71: fonskami,$s_1$=$f_1$ is a smartphone for purpose $s_2$ attached to system/network $f_2$,Synonym of samfonxa,lujvo,smartphone,,,
column72: fonta'a,$t_1$ talks on the phone to $t_2$ about $t_3$ in language $t_4$.,,lujvo,phone,talk on the phone,telephone,,,
column73: fonynoi,$n_1$ is an answering machine/voice mail message about $n_2$ from $n_3$ to $n_4$.,,lujvo,answering machine message,voice mail message,,,
column75: fregau,$g_1$ (person/agent) fertilises $g_2$=$f_1$ for supporting the growth/development of $x_3$=$f_2$.,,lujvo,fertilise,,,
column77: fricaute'a,$x_1$=$t_1$ feels FOMO ("fear of missing out") about $x_2$=$t_2$; $x_1$=$t_1$ is scared of missing out on event/experience/information $x_2$=$t_2$,Cf. {fricau} {terpa},lujvo,FOMO,,,
column78: fridjisku,$c_1$=$d_1$ expresses wish to audience $c_3$=$l_1$ that he/she/it/they experience $l_2$, via expressive medium $c_4$,,lujvo,experience,express,wish,,,
column79: frigau,$x_1$ makes $x_2$ undergo experience $x_3$; $x_1$ treats $x_2$ in manner $x_3$.,,lujvo,treat,,,
column81: frikyxasli,$f_1$=$x_1$ is an African wild ass [Equus africanus] of subspecies/breed $x_2$.,,lujvo,African wild ass,,,
column82: frimo'i,$x_1$ remembers experience $x_2$ (li'i),Synonymous with {vedli}. See also {lifri}, {morji}.,lujvo,remember,remember experience,,,
column83: frinyna'u,$n_1$ is a rational/fractional number.,{frinu} {namcu}. See also {tolfrinyna'u}, {xarna'u}, {tolxarna'u}, {mrena'u}, {lujna'u},lujvo,fractional number,rational number,,,
column84: friske,$s_1$ is phenomenology of/about (aspect of) phenomena/perception/conscious experience $s_2$ (subject matter), with methodology $s_3$.,Synonymous with {selfriske}. Not limited to the 'phenomenologist' tradition in Western philosophy.,lujvo,phenomenology,phenomenology,phenomenology,,,
column85: frufra,$fru_1$=$fra_1$ frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to $fra_3$.,,lujvo,frown at,grimace at,,,
column86: fu'esku,$c_1$ blames/holds responsible/accuses $f_1$ for action/state $f_2$ from authority $f_3$ to audience $c_3$ with expression medium  $c_4$.,Cf. {i'anai}.,lujvo,accuse,hold responsible,lay blame,to blame, to lay blame on,,,
column87: fu'ivla,$x_1$=$v_1$=$f_1$ is a loanword meaning $x_2$=$v_2$ in language $x_3$=$v_3$, based on word $x_4$=$f_2$ in language $x_5$.,Also officialy used to describe words in the Lojban morphological class allocated for use by {vonfu'ivla}. Due to not being {jbosarxe} {zi'evla} is prefered by some. See also {pavyfu'ivla}, {relfu'ivla}, {cibyfu'ivla}, {vonfu'ivla}, {zi'evla}, {le'avla}.,lujvo,borrowed word,loan,loan-word,,,
column90: fuksnacpi,$c_1$=$s_2$ is a mockingbird of species $c_2$ which produces sound $s_1$ that is a copy of $f_2$.,Cf. {fukpi}, {sance}, {cipni}.,lujvo,mockingbird,,,
column91: fukspu,$f_1$=$s_1$ responds to $f_2$=$s_2$ with response $s_3$=$f_4$, which is roughly the same thing.,Responding with mimicry; this might mean repeating their words, or returning a favor with a similar favor, etc.,lujvo,,,,
column92: fuktra,$x_1$ mimics or imitates $x_2$ in doing $x_3$; $x_1$ copies $x_2$'s actions or behavior,,lujvo,imitate,mimic,,,
column93: fukygau,$g_1$ (agent) creates copy $f_1$ of $f_2$ in form/medium $f_3$ by method $f_4$ (event).,See also: {fukpi}, {gasnu}.,lujvo,to copy,,,
column94: fuky'utka,$x_1$ is a copy/clone of a copy/clone of ... a copy/clone of $x_2$ through intermediate steps $x_3$ (ce'o).,$x_2$ is not necessarily the original.,lujvo,iterative cloning,iterative copying,,,
column95: fukyvlarafsi,$r_1$ is the rafsi prefix used in stage-3 fu'ivla $v_1$=$f_1$, rafsi based on word $r_2$.,rafsi prefix is a term specific to Lojban and refers to the initial part of a stage-3 fu'ivla which is a rafsi. $x_2$ is the word in which the rafsi is used, $x_3$ is the word from which the rafsi has been derived. See also: {cibyfu'ivla}, {fu'ivla}, {rafsi}.,lujvo,rafsi prefix,,,
column96: fukyzifpo'e,$f_1$=$z_1$=$p_1$ holds the copyright for copying $f_2$=$p_2$ under law $p_3$.,"Copyright" itself might be "si'o fukzifypo'e". If you are actually translating something with a copyright notice, you should leave the notice in the original language.,lujvo,copyright,,,
column97: fultapla,$t_1$=$f_1$ is a raft of material $t_2$ shape $t_3$ floating on $f_2$.,Cf. {bloti}, {greblo}.,lujvo,raft,,,
column98: funjdi,$j_1$ decides/makes a decision $j_2$ (du'u) about $j_3$, whose outcome is determined by luck.,Cf. {funca}, {jdice}.,lujvo,decision, lucky,lucky decision,,,
column100: furfipsanso,$sa_1$ is fish sauce for use with $sa_2$, containing ingredients including $sa_3$.,Cf. {kukfusra}, {tsapi}, {silna}, {sobysanso}.,lujvo,fish sauce,,,
column101: furjargasta,$x_1$=$g1$=$j1$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains stainless steel,see also: {fusra}, {jdari}, {gasta},lujvo,stainless,,,
column102: furso'epesxu,$f_1$=$p_1$ is fermented bean paste of soybeans $s_1$=$p_2$.,Fermented bean paste is a category of fermented foods typically made from ground soybeans, which are indigenous to the cuisines of East and Southeast Asia, such as miso.,lujvo,fermented soy bean paste,,,
column104: furtirse,$t_1$=$f_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of rust.,Cf. {fusra}, {tirse}.,lujvo,rust,,,
column105: fuzma'u,$x_1$ is old enough to have responsibility $x_2$, according to standard $x_3$,See {flama'u}, {kralyma'u},lujvo,old enough,,,
column106: fuzrai,$t_1$=$f1$ is a director/trustee on the board of directors/trustees of $f_2$.,Cf. {traji}, {fuzme}, {fuzraikamni}, {kagnytruralju}, {kagnyja'a}.,lujvo,director,Director,trustee,,,
column107: fuzraikamni,$k_1$=$t_1$=$f_1$ is the board of directors/trustees of  $k_3$.,Cf. {fuzme}, {traji}, {kamni}, {fuzrai}, {trokamni}.,lujvo,board,board of directors,Board of Directors,board of trustees,,,
column109: ga'abru,$b_1$ is a broom with bristles $b_2$ with long handle $g_1$.,,lujvo,broom,,,
column110: ga'arboijvi,$j_1$ plays baseball against $j_2$ in competition $j_3$ for prize/title $j_4$.,Cf. {grana}, {bolci}, {jivna}, {ga'arboiterjvi}, {kriketi}, {krokete}.,lujvo,baseball,play baseball,,,
column111: ga'arcimcko,$co_1$ is a mop/swab/swob for soaking up $ci_1$=$co_2$ with long handle $g_1$.,,lujvo,mop,,,
column112: ga'ardansu,$d_1$ (individual, mass) pole dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$ using pole $g_1$.,,lujvo,pole dance,,,
column113: ga'argreku,$x_1$ is a truss for supporting $x_2$,from {grana} + {greku},lujvo,truss,,,
column114: ga'argrekycripu,$x_1$ is truss bridge a over/across $x_2$ between $x_3$ and $x_4$,from {ga'argreku} + {cripu},lujvo,truss bridge,,,
column115: ga'arkembisladru,$x_1$ is a popsicle with ice cream $x_2$=$b_1$=$l_1$ and stick $x_3$=$g_1$.,,lujvo,popsicle,,,
column116: ga'arpatlu,$x_1$ is a french-fried potato of variety/cultivar $x_2$ cooked in fat/oil $x_3$,,lujvo,chip,french fry,fry,,,
column117: ga'avro,$v_1$ is a grate between $v_2$ and $v_3$ of material $g_2$=$x_4$.,,lujvo,grate,grating,,,
column118: gacybo'i,$b_1$ is a gas cylinder [closable container for gas] made of material $b_3$ with lid $b_4$.,,lujvo,gas cylinder,,,
column119: gacydunja,$x_1$=$d_1$=$g_2$ desublimates from the gaseous state at temperature $x_2$=$d_2$=$g_3$ with pressure $x_3$=$d_3$.,The process of this is called deposition or desublimation in English. From {gapci} {dunja}; refers to a direct change of the state of matter from gaseous to solid. Cf. {ligyfebvi}.,lujvo,deposit,desublimate,,,
column120: ga'ezga,$g_1$=$z_1$ perceives $z_2$ to have quality $g_2$ by means/sense $g_3$=$z_3$ under conditions $g_4$=$z_4$,,lujvo,perceive quality of,,,
column121: gaftercu'a,$x_1 = cuxna_3$ (set) is the collection of options/settings that can be chosen by user $x_2 = cuxna_1$ ~ $galfi_1$ for purpose $x_3$.,cuxna2 is deleted; galfi1 was raised from an event abstraction to a person agent; the third sumti slot of this word is not predictable from veljvo (but is inspired by galfi2). x3 is the interface feature which the choices modify; for example, x3 can be the sound amplitude ('loudness') feature/setting on a speaker and x1 is a set of values for that feature (according to some scale) which can be achieved by the speaker output.,lujvo,settings,,,
column122: gafygau,$x_1$ (agent) causes $x_2$ (event) to modify/alter/change/transform/convert $x_3$ into $x_4$,This is a {jvajvo}: {galfi} {zei} {gasnu}. Included in the dictionary because it's referenced in the notes for {galfi}.,lujvo,,,,
column123: gafyzmico,$x_1$=$z_1$=$g_1$ is a zmico that modifies the terbri default specification of a brivla, producing result $x_2$=$z_2$=$g_3$ at level/with construct-orientation $x_3$=$z_3$ with discourse duration $x_4$=$z_4$ in language $x_5$=$z_5$; $x_1$ is a default specification modifier that produces output re-specification $x_2$,{zmico} is an experimental gismu. See also: {zmico}, {sumyzmico},lujvo,default specification modifier,,,
column124: gaimra,$m_1$=$g_1$ is a cover/[lid/top] for sheltering $m_2$=$g_2$ from danger/threat $m_3$.,Cf. {santa}, {calku}.,lujvo,protective cover,,,
column125: gairbevma'e,$m_1$ is a van for carrying $m_2$=$b_2$ to $b_3$ from $b_4$ over path $b_5$,from {gacri} + {bevma'e},lujvo,van,,,
column128: gairvau,$v_1$ is a chest containing $v_2$=$g_2$ with lid $g_1$.,,lujvo,chest,,,
column131: galcpare,$x_1$=$c_1$ climbs/[goes up/ascends] upwards on wall/fence/mountain/boulder/obstacle $x_2$=$c_2$ using $x_3$=$c_4$ [limbs/tools/equipment] towards top/summit $x_4$=$g_1$ from base/floor/baseline/standard height $x_5$=$g_3$.,From {galtu} {cpare}. Narrows down {cpare} to only mean climbing and upwards, against the gravitational pull (the frame or reference). For surface of x2, see/use {sefta}.,lujvo,climb,,,
column132: galgau,$gas_1$ elevates/raises $gal_1$ by height reference $gal_2$ and height standard $gal_3$.,,lujvo,elevate,raise,,,
column133: galjdika,$x1$=$g1$=$j1$ sinks/descends in frame of reference $x2$=$g2$ by amount $x3$=$j3$,,lujvo,sink,,,
column134: galji'o,$g_1$=$j_1$ is the peak/summit of $j_2$ at location $j_3$ in frame of reference $g_2$,From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {galtu}, {jipno},lujvo,summit,,,
column135: galmu'u,$m_1$ rises to $m_2$=$g_1$ from origin $m_3$=$g_3$ via path $m_4$.,Cf. {muvdu}, {galtu}, {klama}, {gapru}, {sa'irbi'o}, {tolfa'u}.,lujvo,come up,rise,,,
column136: galraipau,$p_1$=$g_1$=$t_1$ is the top (uppermost part) of $p_2$.,Cf. {galtu}, {gapru}.,lujvo,top,,,
column137: galto'a,$x_1$ is a harmonic/overtone of $x_2$; $x_1$ is otonal with respect to $x_2$.,x1 and x2 can be frequencies, or pitch classes, or intervals. See also: {dzito'a}.,lujvo,,,,
column139: galxejbo'u,$b_1$ is a/the maxilla bone performing function $b_2$ in body of $b_3$.,,lujvo,maxilla,upper mandible,upper maxilla,,,
column140: galxyfe'a,$f_1$=$g_1$ is a/the pharynx [body-part] of $g_2$.,Similar to pharanx (gr. cleft, chasm). Nasopharynx (={zbigalxyfe'a}), oropharynx (={molgalxyfe'a}), laryngopharynx/hypopharynx (={galxyferni'a}). See also {moldruji'o}, {galxe} and {fenra}.,lujvo,pharynx,,,
column141: galxypunli,$g_1$=$p_1$ is the Adam's apple (laryngeal prominence) of $g_2$=$p_2$.,Cf. {galxe}, {punli}.,lujvo,Adam's apple,laryngeal prominence,,,
column142: gamseti'yra'a,$x_1$ synaesthetizes qualia $x_2$ with qualia $x_3$ (but not necessarily the inverse) under conditions $x_4$.,$x_2$ and $x_3$ are specific qualia (so, orangeness and spiceyness would work; but color and taste would not work). {ganseti} {srana}.,lujvo,synaesthesia,synaesthetize,,,
column143: gamyma'i,$x_1$ is December/twelfth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.,Note: Based on experimental rafsi for {gai} (gam). Use with caution. Alternative: {pavrelma'i},lujvo,December,,,
column144: gamymei,$x_1$ is a dozen of $x_2$ counting by dimension/aspect $x_3$,From {gai} + {mei}. See {kamre},lujvo,dozen,,,
column145: gancai,$x_1$=$c_1$=$g_1$ is vast in dimension $x_2$=$g_2$ to observer $x_3$=$c_3$=$g_3$,,lujvo,,,,
column146: gancladakyxa'i,$xa_1$=$d_1$=$c_1$ is a broadsword for use against $xa_2$=$d_2$ by $xa_3$ with blade of material $d_3$, long by standard $c_3$, broad by standard $g_3$.,Cf. {cladakyxa'i}.,lujvo,broadsword,,,
column147: gancuktai,$t_1$ is an ellipse (geometric form)  of object/abstraction/manifestation $t_2$ (object/abstract) wide in dimension $x_3$=$g_2$.,Cf. {sovda}, {bolci}.,lujvo,ellipse,,,
column148: ga'e zei lerfu,$x_1$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a capital/capitalised/upper-shift letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_2$ representing $x_3$.,See also {lerfu}, {ga'e}, {to'a zei lerfu}.,zei-lujvo,capital letter,,,
column149: ga'elfu,$x_1$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a capital/capitalised/upper-shift letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_2$ representing $x_3$.,Syn. {ga'e zei lerfu}. See also {lerfu}, {ga'e}, {to'alfu}.,fu'ivla,capital letter,ga'elfu,,
column150: ga'elto'a,$x_1$ (ka) is the case (uppercase or lowercase) of letter $x_2$ in orthography $x_3$,See {ga'elfu}, {to'alfu},fu'ivla,case,ga'elto'a,,
column151: galprurci,$x_1$ (text, image, page element) is supra/aforementioned/previous/earlier/preceding/above/toward the top of the page/screen (flat and primarily two-dimensional display) relative to $x_2$ (text, image, page element) on page/screen/in work $x_3$ according to cultural convention $x_4$.,Because text is usually read horizontally, this word could mean "to the left of" (for left-to-right writing) or "to the right of" (for right-to-left writing), as assessed on each given line; additionally, any horizontal direction within the plane of the display can contribute a nonzero component, so long as $x_1$ is also topward of $x_2$. For texts/writing systems which begin at the bottom of a page (according to physical orientation), then this word refers to that direction instead of the physical top of the page. In other words, this word always is oriented back along the writing/display which, by cultural convention, the user should have already consumed. Can refer to distinct prior pages. Essentially, the entire document is imagined as being displayed upon a single, arbitrarily-long, ordered screen which is wide enough to display at most a single word/character or element per line throughout; in this configuration, $x_1$ precedes and is perforce 'above' $x_2$. See also: "{balvidzita}" (opposite), "{galprurci zei farna}".,fu'ivla,aforementioned,earlier in text,supra,top of page,galprurci,,
column152: gambaru,$x_1$ works hard / strives / endures / does their best at / gives their all in doing $x_2$ (activity), to achieve goal $x_3$,Especially in the face of difficulty; "keeping up the fight". The place structure is like {gunka} or {zukte}.,fu'ivla,do one's best,gambaru,,
column153: gamgata,$x_1$ is a kumquat of species/variety $x_2$.,see also {nimre},fu'ivla,kumquat,gamgata,,
column154: ganbaru,$x_1$ works hard / strives / endures / does their best at / gives their all in doing $x_2$ (activity), to achieve goal $x_3$,Especially in the face of difficulty; "keeping up the fight". The place structure is like {gunka} or {zukte}.,fu'ivla,do one's best,ganbaru,,
column155: ganfauke,if $x_1$ is true, $x_2$ happens, then repeats as long as $x_1$ is true,See {ifle}, {faubganke}, {goilka'i}, {goilgau}, {goilbi'o}, {efku},fu'ivla,while loop,ganfauke,,
column156: ga'au,digit/number: EulerMascheroni constant, usually denoted by lowercase gamma (); approximately 0.5772156649 (in decimal).,The difference in the limit as n becomes arbitrarily large between/of: the sum of (1/k) for all strictly positive integers k < (n+1), and the natural logarithm of n.,experimental cmavo,EulerMascheroni constant,EulerMascheroni gamma,gamma (number),,,,PA5
column157: ga'ei,abstractor: sensation / qualia abstractor; $x_1$ is the sensation / qualia associated with objects with property [bridi, bound to ce'u], via sense $x_2$, as sensed by $x_3$,Semantically linked to {ganseti}. {lo} {ga'ei} ({ce'u}) {xunre} = {lo} {ganseti} {be} {lo} {ka} ({ce'u}) {xunre}. Is one proposed way of dealing with abstractions of colors ({zilska}) and other "elemental" sense experiences. Proposed rafsi: -gel-,experimental cmavo,qualia abstractor,sensation abstractor,gel,,,NU

column5: ganlo,$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$ (something being blocked).,As a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane. $x_{3}$ is blocked by $x_{1}$. $x_{2}$ is inaccessible. See also {kalri}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}, {zunti}.,gismu,closed,ga'o,ganl,ganlo,,
column6: ganra,$x_{1}$ is broad/wide in dimension $x_{2}$ [2nd most significant dimension] by standard $x_{3}$.,See also {clani}, {jarki}, {rotsu}, {condi}, {barda}, {gutci}, {minli}.,gismu,broad,wide,gan,ganr,ganra,,
column7: ganse,$x_{1}$ [observer] senses/detects/notices stimulus $x_{2}$ (object/nu) by means $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.,$x_1$ is sensitive to $x_2$; also feels, spots, perceives, makes out, discerns/recognizes (but only implying reaction without necessarily any significant mental processing); note that the emphasis is on a property which stimulates $x_1$ and is detected (sanji is passive about the sensing, and is not limited to sensory input, as well as presuming some kind of discernment/recognition, while not being concerned with the means of detection); $x_3$ sense/sensory channel.  See also {pencu}, {sanji}, {viska}, {sumne}, {tirna}, {zgana}, {canci}, {simlu}.,gismu,feel,perceive,sense,gas,ga'e,gans,ganse,gau'e,
column8: ganti,$x_{1}$ is a/the testes/ovary/testicle/scrotum/balls/gonad/stamen/pistil [body-part] of $x_{2}$, gender $x_{3}$.,Egg/sperm/pollen/gamete producing/bearing organ.  See also {plibu}, {sovda}, {pinji}, {gutra}, {mabla}.,gismu,gonad,gant,ganti,,
column9: ganxo,$x_{1}$ is a/the anus/anal orifice/asshole/arsehole [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: exit, waste exit].,Also asshole/ass/arsehole; (adjective:) $x_1$ is anal.  See also {zargu}, {kalci}, {mabla}, {rinci}.,gismu,anus,asshole,gax,ganx,ganxo,,
column10: ganzu,$x_{1}$ organizes $x_{2}$ [relative chaos] into $x_{3}$ [ordered/organized result] by system/principle(s) $x_{4}$.,$x_3$ is also a system; $x_4$ could be merely a function which inherently serves to dictate the organizational structure of $x_3$.  See also {ciste}, {morna}, {stura}, {bilni}, {cabra}.,gismu,arrange,organize,gaz,ganz,ganzu,,
column11: gapci,$x_{1}$ is gaseous/fumes/a gas/vapor of material/composition including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.,$x_3$ includes temperature and pressure.  See also {pambe}, {vacri}, {litki}, {sligu}, {danmo}, {bumru}, {cidro}, {flecu}.,gismu,gas,gac,gapc,gapci,,
column12: gapru,$x_{1}$ is directly/vertically above/upwards-from $x_{2}$ in gravity/frame of reference $x_{3}$.,See also {tsani}, {galtu}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {gacri}, {dizlo}, {farna}.,gismu,above,gap,gapr,gapru,,
column13: garna,$x_{1}$ is a rail/railing/bar [tool] supporting/restraining $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.,See also {kamju}, {grana}, {tutci}.,gismu,bar,rail,railing,gar,garn,garna,,

column19: ganvi,$x_1$ is the sensory media content of type/stimulating sense/containing experience information $x_2$ of recording/broadcast/media $x_3$ displayed/produced by medium/device $x_4$.,Generalizes/encompasses both of {vidvi} and {snavi} (where $x_2$ is visual/video or audio, respectively), so-called '4D' experiences (which have jostling/kinetoceptive and olfactory stimuli), the feelies from Huxley's /Brave New World/, and other stuff.,experimental gismu,media content,media sensory content,sensory content,ganvi,,

column1: wide refers to the wavelength of a note low in frequency, as well as the characteristics of an object which produces such a note. Alternative to existing word {cmato'a}, which is ambiguous due to the fact that "small" could refer to either the frequency in Hertz (i.e., low pitch) or the wavelength (i.e. high pitch).,lujvo,bass,low,low-pitched,,,
column2: gantre,$x_1$=$m_1$=$g_1$ measures $x_2$=$m_2$ meters in its second longest direction $x_3$=$m_3$=$g_2$ by measurement standard $x_4$=$m_4$.,x1 {ganra} is not asserted, which is why ganra3 is absent. Cf. {clatre}, {tsutre}.,lujvo,width,,,

column7: ga'onra'itsi,$t_1$=$g_1$=$r_1$ is an indehiscent fruit/seed-envelope (which remains closed/sealed and whole) of organism $t_2$ with potential to produce/containing/enclosing offspring $t_3$=$g_3$ preventing passage to $g_2$  (default: external environment),r2 is assumed to be indefinite (indehiscent fruit must be processed/stimulated by active external means in order to release their seeds). There is no reason for the 'fruit' to necessarily be of a plant, although it probably will be.,lujvo,indehiscent,,,
column8: ga'orce'omosysna,$s_1$ is an affricate consonant with place of articulation $g_1$=$m_2$=$m_3$ and phonation $x_3$.,cf. {zunsna}. Since this is a long lujvo, this word may possibly be reduced to {ce'osna} in fast speech and/or informal writing.,lujvo,affricate,,,

column10: ga'orgau,$gas_1$ shuts $gan_1$, preventing passage/access to $gan_2$ by $gan_3$.,Cf. {ganlo}, {pluta}, {klama}, {klina}, {stela}.,lujvo,close,shut,,,

column17: garbi'u,$b_1$=$g_1$ is a fence separating $b_2$=$g_2$ and $b_3$=$g_2$ (unordered) of/in structure $b_4$.,Cf. {garna}, {bitmu}.,lujvo,fence,,,
column18: gasfrili,$x_1$ is obvious/easy to notice for $x_2$,Additional sumti slots are probably needed. See also {jmifrili}.,lujvo,obvious,,,
column19: gaskre,$k_1$=$g_3$ is a/are the whisker(s)/sensory hair(s) /vibrissa(e) attached to $k_2$=$g_1$ at body part $k_3$ for the detection of stimuli $g_2$ under conditions $g_4$.,Cf. {ganse}, {kerfa}, {zbikre}, {runkre}.,lujvo,hair,vibrissa,whisker,,,
column20: gasmlu,$x1$=$s1$ feels $x2$=$g2$ to $x3$=$g1$=$s3$ under conditions $x4$=$g4$=$s4$,,lujvo,feels,,,
column21: gasnirna,$n_1$ is a sensory neuron which carry input stimulus property $g_2$ (ka) to brain, of observer $g_1$=$n_2$,,lujvo,sensory neuron,,,
column22: gaspu'a,$x_1$ (thing/nu) feels sensory-good / is a pleasant stimulus to $x_2$,,lujvo,good feeling,,,
column23: gastcica,$x_1$ (event) is an illusion that deceives/tricks $x_2$ into sensing $x_3$ using sense $x_4$ under conditions x5,Use jai gastcica for objects; {ganse} {tcica}; {prugastcica}, {narprugastcica}.,lujvo,illusion,,,
column24: gasyju'o,$x_1$=$j_1$ witnesses/testifies $x_2$=$j_2$ (du'u) about $x_3$=$j_3$ by epistemology $x_4$=$j_4$,from {ganse}+{djuno},lujvo,testify,witness,,,
column25: gasyjvemu'utcini,$x_1$ is the sensori-motor stage as experienced by child $x_2$,1st stage in Jean Piaget's 4 stages of cognitive development. Between 0-2 years, a child discovers the difference between themselves and their environment. At that point, they will use their senses to learn.,lujvo,child,sensori-motor stage,,,
column26: gaupli,$x_1$ uses $x_2$ for bringing about $x_3$ (event),See also {pilno}, {gasnu}.,lujvo,use,,,
column27: gaurki'u,$x_1$=$k_1$ is person/agent $x_2$=$g_1$'s reason/motivation/purpose for doing/bringing about $x_3$=$g_2$=$k_2$.,From {gasnu} {krinu}. $x_1$ is by default known by $x_2$ at some level of consciousness; {nalsanji} {gaurki'u} may be used for when an agent's reasons for an act are truly unconscious.,lujvo,motivation,purpose,reason,reason,,,
column28: gaurtcini,$t_1$ is an opportunity for $t_2$=$g_1$ to do $g_2$.,Cf. {tcini}, {gasnu}, {funca}.,lujvo,chance,occasion,opportunity,,,
column29: gaurzu'e,$x_1$ volitionally brings about $x_2$ (event) for purpose/goal $x_3$ (event),See also {zukte}, {gasnu}, {djijevgau}.,lujvo,bring about volitionally,,,

column33: ganseti,$x_1$ is the sensation/qualia (abstract) associated with objects with property $x_2$ (ka), via sense $x_3$ (ka), as sensed by $x_4$,{lo} {ganseti} {be} {lo} {ka} ({ce'u}) {xunre} = 'the color red', {lo} {ganseti} {be} {lo} {ka} ({ce'u}) {sudga} = 'the sensation/feeling of dryness'. $x_3$ is the involved sense, e.g. {lo} {ka} {viska} for sight; this can often be left unspecified. See also {ga'ei}, {ganse}, {li'i}, {li'imdu}, {gansetifri},fu'ivla,qualia,sensation,ganseti,,
column34: gansetifri,$x_1$ feels sensation / qualia $x_2$ via sense $x_3$ (ka) // {ka'e gansetifri} = $x_1$ is sentient (able to feel subjective conscious experiences),$x_2$ is a {ganseti}-type. Proposed gismu form: {gelse}, with rafsi -ges- and -ge'e-. See {lifri}, {ganse}.,fu'ivla,feel,ge'e,gansetifri,,
column35: gapnifa,$x_1$ is upside-down,Shortening of {gapnitfa'e}.,fu'ivla,upside-down,gapnifa,,
column36: garpata,$x_1$ is a tick of family/genus $x_2$,See also {jukni}, {ankabuta}, {iksodida}.,fu'ivla,tick,garpata,,
column37: gasldudmoka,$x_1$ sees what $x_2$ did there, namely $x_3$,,fu'ivla,,gasldudmoka,,
column38: gasnce,$x_1$ is a voiced velar stop sound produced by $x_2$.,Derived from and synonymous with {gy zei sance}. The odd morphological form serves to place the most salient consonant in the stressed syllable.,fu'ivla,G sound,voiced velar plosive,voiced velar stop,voiced velar stop sound,gasnce,,
column39: gauncri,$x_1$ is a surjective function from $x_2$ (domain) to $x_3$ (codomain).,Every element of the codomain has at least one preimage under $x_1$. See also: "{ficystoraunju}".,fu'ivla,onto,onto function,surjection,surjective function,gauncri,,
column40: ga'oi,evidential: I disagree with you vehemently, but offer no substantive counterarguments/information pulled from my ass,Approximately the same as '{.ie} {nai} {le'o} {ju'a}'. See {ga'i},experimental cmavo,,,,,UI2
column41: gau'a,mekso (no-more-than-4-ary) operator: Gaussian function $f(x, a, b, c) = c e^{-((x-a)^2 / (2*b^2))}$.,Parameter 'a' is the SECOND operand; x is the first. Defaults: $c = 1/ \sqrt{2 \pi \sigma}$ (normalized), $a = \mu$ (the arithmetic average of the data set), $b = \sigma$ (the standard deviation of the data set). Moreover, by context, $\mu = 0$ (the average is 0) or $\sigma = 1$ (the standard deviation is 1) might be assumed by default.,experimental cmavo,bell curve,Gaussian,Gaussian function,normal,normal distribution,,,,VUhU
column42: ga'u'au,mekso n-ary operator: append contravariant (upper) indices to tensor,Terminated by {te'oi'oi}. Takes ordered input (A, X_1, X_2, , X_(n-1)), where A is a tensor and X_i is an index with an understood (or elsewhere defined) ordered domain. It appends/assigns X_i to be the ith contravariant index of A, which is usually designated as a superscript in the ith position to the right of A. See also: {ni'a'au}. It is probable that Einstein summation notation will be conventionally in effect.,experimental cmavo,append contravariant index,,,,GAhUhAU

column74: gerdja,$c_1$ is dog food for dogs $c_2$=$g_1$.,See also pet food (={dalpe'odja}) and animal feed (={da'udja}).,lujvo,dog food,,,

column78: gerske,$s_1$ (mass of facts) is cynology/science about dogs $g_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.,,lujvo,cynology,,,
column79: geryre'u,$r_1$ is dog meat from species/breed $r_2$=$g_2$.,from {gerku} + {rectu},lujvo,dog meat,,,

column81: gerzgu,$r_1$ is a dog rose (Rosa canina) of species/strain $r_2$.,,lujvo,dog rose,,,

column85: gexnivji,$n_1$ crochets $n_2$ from yarn $n_3$ using crochet hooks $g_1$,g2 is dropped as being non germaine to this lujvo,lujvo,crochet,,,

column87: gaznatu,$x_1$ is a quantity of natural gas, a mixture of methane with smaller amounts of ethane, propane, butane, other gaseous hydrocarbons and petroleum deposits,See also {kolme}, {kolgapci}, {ctile}, {livla}.,fu'ivla,,gaznatu,,
column89: ge'enmo,$x_1$ (agent) feels an unspecified or unknown emotion about $x_2$ (event),From {ge'e}, {cinmo}. See {co'e},fu'ivla,unknown emotion,unspecified emotion,ge'enmo,,
column90: gejrdauko,$x_1$ is a carrot of variety $x_2$.,See also {najgenja}, {rulsantyspa}, {spatrdauko}, {spatrxapio}.,fu'ivla,carrot,gejrdauko,,
column91: geknimi,$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'gek-sentence' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.,Inner structure of the rule: gek subsentence gik subsentence tail-terms tag? | KE # gek-sentence /KEhE#/ | NA # gek-sentence. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.,fu'ivla,,geknimi,,
column92: genjrdauko,$x_1$ is a carrot; $x_1$ is a root [body-part] of plant/species $x_2$ of genus Daucus,,fu'ivla,Carrot,genjrdauko,,
column93: genjrtensai,$x_1$ is a beetroot (root); $x_1$ is the root portion of the beetroot plant $x_2$ (scientific name: Beta vulgaris subsp. vulgaris var. conditiva).,See also: {spatrtensai}.,fu'ivla,beetroot,genjrtensai,,
column94: genrkasu,$x_1$ is the declined form of base noun $x_2$ according to case $x_3$ in language $x_4$.,The x2 is not necessarily a 'base' noun, and could be any form of the same noun. See also {sumtcita}, {selbri},fu'ivla,case,genrkasu,,
column95: gensima,$x_1$ (text) is a temporary name for $x_2$ (text, object, event) chosen in such a way that it is not used for naming anything else within the current scope,Also called 'gensym'. To express gensymmed {da} usually {da}{xi}{rau} is used. See {cmene}, {zasni},fu'ivla,a gensym,a gensymmed name,gensima,,
column96: gentufa,$x_1$ parses text $x_2$ using grammar $x_3$,zi'evla version of {genturfa'i}. See {gerna}, {gensu'a}, {gendra},fu'ivla,,gentufa,,
column97: gerkene,$x_1$ is pickle-/cucumber-shaped,Should be three-dimensional and enclose a volume. The shape is approximately cylindrical: there is an approximately linear, non-closed axis and any cross-section that is perpendicular thereto should be approximately circular (or trivial). The ends should be  rounded and can be tapered; the should not be sharp. The shape is fairly smooth. If the axis is linear, the shape should be convex. The axis should, at most, form a shape like a parenthesis "("; there should not be multiple changes in the sign of curvature. The diameter of the perpendicular cross-section should be largest toward the middle of the axis; the length of the axis should be rather larger than this diametric length.,fu'ivla,cucumber-shaped,gerkene,,
column98: gerkrtciuaua,$x_1$ is a Chihuahua of breed/variety $x_2$.,stage-3 form of {tciuaua}. See also: {gerku},fu'ivla,Chihuahua,gerkrtciuaua,,
column99: gerkuuono,$x_1$ is a dhole (Cuon alpinus) of subspecies/breed $x_2$,See {labno}, {gerku},fu'ivla,dhole,gerkuuono,,
column101: ge'ai,metasyntactic variable prenex,Explicitly marks variables, e.g. ko'a ko'e, lerfu-strings, and/or brodV (must be converted into sumti using {me'ei}) as being metasyntactic: i.e. having no specific meaning or referent and merely used to demonstrate syntax or hypothetical scenarios. Automatically unassigns these variables from any previous assignment. e.g. (me'ei broda me'ei brode ko'a ko'e fo'a fo'e ge'ai). See {ge'ei}, {ce'ai}, {ke'au}, {zo'u}, {da'o},experimental cmavo,metasyntactic prenex,,,,ZOhU
column102: ge'ei,metasyntactic variable marker,Explicitly marks the preceding variable, e.g. ko'a ko'e, lerfu-strings, and/or {broda} series as being metasyntactic: i.e. having no specific meaning or referent and merely used to demonstrate syntax or hypothetical scenarios. Automatically unassigns the variable from any previous assignment. May also be used for pronouns like {mi} or {do} or {dei}. This is useful to refer to {mi} as a 'first-person pronoun' rather than the actual speaker themself, for example, when giving the definition of {mi'o}: '{mi} {ge'ei} {jo'u} {do} {ge'ei}', makes it clear that the speaker doesn't literally mean the speaker and the listener, but are using {mi} and {do} metasyntactically. Similarly, one might define {mi} as '{lo} {cusku} {be} {dei} {ge'ei}'. See {ge'ai}, {da'o},experimental cmavo,metasyntactic variable marker,,,,UI3a
column103: gei'au,mekso 7-ary operator: for input $(X_1 = z, X_2 = (a_i)_i, X_3 = (b_j)_j, X_4 = p, X_5 = q, X_6 = h_1, X_7 = h_2)$, this word/function outputs/yields $\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} (((\prod_{i = 1}^{p} ($ne'o'o$(a_i,n,1,h_1)))/(\prod_{j = 1}^{q} ($ne'o'o$(b_j,n,1,h_2)))) z^n/(n!))$; by default, $X_6 = 1 = X_7$ unless explicitly specified otherwise.,See "{ne'o'o}" (Pochhammer symbol); however, for the purposes of this definition and regardless of the definition(s) provided at "ne'o'o", here ne'e'o$(Y_1, Y_2, Y_3, Y_4) = \prod_{k = 0}^{Y_2 - 1} (Y_1 + (-1)^{(1 - Y_3)} Y_4 k)$ by local definition; ne'o'o$(Y_1, Y_2, Y_3, Y_4) = 1$ for all $Y_2 < 1$, regardless of the other inputs $Y_m$ (so long as they belong to the domain); by default, $Y_4 = 1$ unless explicitly defined otherwise. For the main definition: $z$ is a complex number, and $(a_i)_i$ and $(b_j)_j$ are (pre)defined sequences (id est: functions with domains being exactly the set of exactly all positive integers) such that, for all positive integer indices $i$ and $j$ respectively, their terms/outputs are complex numbers; both $(a_i)_i$ and $(b_j)_j$ are indexed starting at $1$; also, $p, q, h_1, h_2$ are positive integers; by default, $h_1 = 1 = h_2$ unless explicitly specified otherwise. $X_2$ and $X_3$ may require usage of "{mau'au}" and "{zai'ai}".,experimental cmavo,generalized hypergeometric function,hypergeometric function,,,,VUhU3
column105: gei'i'e,mekso unary operator: converts a string of digits which includes {pi} to the same string of digits without {pi}; if {pi} is not present in the original/input string, the output is identical,Probably can be generalized to handle {pi'e} and distinguish macro- from micro-digits. Notice that it produces a string of digits; the meaning of this string must be established by processing through JUhU or the like. The input must also be a string of digits (not a number). Useful for certain algorithms, such as an nth root algorithm.,experimental cmavo,delete radix point from digit string,,,,JOIhI
column106: ge'u'a,logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal always true (with gi).,Created to complete the scope of truth tables to include TTTT and FFFF, despite being described as relatively useless. Etymology: g + jetnu + A.,experimental cmavo,Always True,,,,GA
column107: ge'u'i,elidable terminator for connective modifiers,Terminates {noi'i}.,experimental cmavo,connective modifier terminator,,,,GEhUhI
column108: gi'a'a,logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal always false (with gi).,Created to complete the scope of truth tables to include TTTT and FFFF, despite being described as relatively useless. Etymology: g + jitfa + A.,experimental cmavo,Always False,,,,GA
column109: gi'au,pro-sumti: refers to the proposition that is the left-hand side complement of the current logical connection.,Typically used in the right-hand side connectand for referring back to the content of the left-hand side connectand.,experimental cmavo,,,,,KOhA
column110: gi bu,pro-sumti: in the second half of a sumti forethought connective expression, refers to the first half.,For example, in "ge X gi lo co'e be gibu", gibu refers to X. In case of nesting, the innermost connective is targeted, unless a subscript specifies otherwise: in "ge X gi tu'a ga Y gi gibu", gibu refers to Y. "gibu xi re" may be used to refer to the second-innermost referent, X. See {nu bu}.,bu-letteral,,,,,BY*
column111: gidva,$x_{1}$ (person/object/event) guides/conducts/pilots/leads $x_{2}$ (active participants) in/at $x_{3}$ (event).,A guiding person advises/suggests/sets an example to be followed, but does not necessarily control/direct/manage actual execution of an event; an event may serve as a guide by setting a pattern/example to be emulated.  See also {jitro}, {ralju}, {sazri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {fukpi}, {morna}.,gismu,conduct,guide,lead,gid,gi'a,gidv,gidva,,
column112: gigdo,$x_{1}$ is a billion [British milliard] [$10^9$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).,See also {grake}, {mitre}, {snidu}, {stero}, {delno}, {molro}, {kelvo}, {xampo}, {gradu}. {litce}, {merli}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {kilto}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro},gismu,1E9,gig,gi'o,gigd,gigdo,,
column113: ginka,$x_{1}$ is a camp/encampment/temporary residence of $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.,See also {dinju}, {xabju}, {zdani}.,gismu,camp,gik,gink,ginka,,
column114: girzu,$x_{1}$ is group/cluster/team showing common property (ka) $x_{2}$ due to set $x_{3}$ linked by relations $x_{4}$.,Also collection, team, comprised of, comprising; members $x_3$ (a specification of the complete membership) comprise group $x_1$; cluster (= {kangri}).  See also {bende}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {gunma}, {panra}, {cabra}, {cecmu}, {kansa}, {klesi}, {lanzu}, {liste}, {vrici}.,gismu,group,gir,gri,girz,girzu,,
column115: gismu,$x_{1}$ is a (Lojban) root word expressing relation $x_{2}$ among argument roles $x_{3}$, with affix(es) $x_{4}$.,Gismu list, if physical object (= ({loi}) {gimste}); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new gismu to the gismu list = {gimpoi}, {gimselcmi}, {gimselste}).  See also {cmavo}, {cmene}, {lujvo}, {smuni}, {sumti}, {tanru}, {valsi}.,gismu,root word,gim,gi'u,gism,gismu,,
column116: glare,$x_{1}$ is hot/[warm] by standard $x_{2}$.,Warm (= {mligla}), feverish (= {bi'agla}).  See also {lenku}.,gismu,hot,gla,glar,glare,,
column118: gi'i,logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought conn question.,,cmavo,bridi conn ?,,,,GIhA
column121: gidyselsku,$x_1$ is the motto made by $x_2$ for $x_3$ via expressive medium $x_4$,from {gidva}+{selsku},lujvo,motto,,,
column122: gigbivysamsle,$se_1$ is (close to) a billion ($10^9$) of eight indivisible, most basic computer subunits of computer $se_2$; $se_1$ is a gigabyte,In binary a gigabyte is actually 1 073 741 824 bytes, but we can round off for brevity, and to parallel the metric units.,lujvo,gigabyte,,,
column123: gimkamsmikezypro,$x_1$  (word/quote; probably gismu) conflicts with $x_2$ (word/text; probably gismu) according to rules $x_3$ in language $x_4$.,Neither x1 nor x2 need be "official and accepted". A standard value for $x_3$ in the case of Lojban would be the traditional gismu creation algorithm's dissimilarity criteria. See also: "{vlapro}".,lujvo,conflict,gismu conflict,gismu similarity conflict,,,
column124: gimpro,$x_1$  (word/quote; probably gismu) conflicts with $x_2$ (word/text; probably gismu) according to rules $x_3$ in language $x_4$.,Shortened from {gimkamsmikezypro}. Neither x1 nor x2 need be "official and accepted".,lujvo,conflict,gismu conflict,,,
column125: gimrafrimni,$x_1$ is a rhythmic conjugation of word $x_2$, rhyming with word $x_3$ in language $x_4$, with changed final vowel/ending $x_5$.,This word refers to the uncommon practice of changing the last vowel of a brivla in order to have it rhyme with surrounding words in its spoken context.  This can only be done to gismu and lujvo ending in 5-letter rafsi. x2 should be the orthodox spelling of x1.  Use "{me'o} [vowel]" to describe x5. This word is a {se} {gimrafrimni}, and has the four rhythmic conjugations "{gimrafrimna}", "gimrafrimne", "gimrafrimno", and "gimrafrimnu".  See also {rimni} {abu} {ebu} {ibu} {obu} {ubu}.,lujvo,rhythmic conjugation,,,
column126: gimy'inda,$x_1$ (si'o) deserves a gismu $x_2$ by standard $x_3$ according to $x_4$, over the objections of $x_5$, even though it would conflict with gismu $x_6$ and $x_7$ is a perfectly good zi'evla,,lujvo,deserves a gismu,,,
column127: gincilnacnalfadni,$f_1$ (member) exhibits aneuploidy (atypical quantity of chromosome) of type/number $n_1$ in/with respect to chromosome $gc_1$ which is atypical of species/set $gc_3$=$f_3$,f2 is incorporated into x2=n1 and x3=gc1; the sumti filling in the last terbri may be a species or a set.,lujvo,aneuploidy,,,
column128: ginlanzu,$x_1$ (mass) is a biological/genetic/'blood' family with members including $x_2$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard/'blood' relations $x_3$.,Members of $x_1$ are blood relatives.,lujvo,biological family,blood relations,blood relative,genetic family,,,
column129: ginlazmi'u,$x_{1}$ is a genetic/biological/'blood' family member of $x_2$ via bonds/ties/standard/blood relations $x_3$.,,lujvo,biological relative,blood relative,blood relative,genetic relative,,,
column130: ginlazyfamti,$x_1$ is a biological/genetic-familial/'blood' aunt/uncle of $x_2$ by genetic-familial bond/tie/blood relation $x_3$; x1 is a genetically and familially associated member of $x_2$'s genetic/biological parent(s)'s generation.,No prefix "great-"s or "grand-"s may immediately precede this word in English translation. A {ginlazytunba} of $x_1$ must be a {ginlazrirni} of $x_2$.,lujvo,biological aunt,biological nephew,biological niece,biological sibling of biological parent,biological uncle,genetic aunt,genetic nephew,genetic niece,genetic uncle,,,
column131: ginlazytamne,$x_{1}$ is genetic-familial/'blood' cousin to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie $x_{3}$; [non-immediate family member, default same generation (zero-times removed)].,$x_1$ and $x_2$ share at least one common {ginlazdze}.,lujvo,blood cousin,cousin,genetic cousin,,,
column132: ginske,$x_1$ is genetics (gene studies) based on methodology $x_2$ (proposition),See also {cedyske},lujvo,,,,
column133: ginxu'i,$x_1$ is an instance of DNA/deoxyribonucleic acid (individual or mass) with purity $x_2$.,,lujvo,deoxyribonucleic acid,DNA,,,
column134: gismyjvo,$x_1$=$l_1$ is a compound word with the word $x_2$=$g_1$ appearing inside it, composed from the affixes $x_3$=$l_4$,Used when the syllables of a word appear in a compound word, made up from affixes. See {kibromge}.,lujvo,false compound,,,
column135: gitsko,$s_1$ is a string of instrument $j_1$.,,lujvo,string,,,
column136: glacitsi,$x_1$ is the warm period (season/interval) of year $x_2$ at location $x_3$.,This can be used generically in order to describe the warm half of the year on Earth (approximately the interval from the (local-vernal) equinox to the immediate next (local-autumnal) equinox such that the warmest solstice (local-Summer) is included); this meaning is what was meant by the English word "Summer" in the 1200's, for example.,lujvo,Summer,warm season,,,
column137: glajukpa,$j_1$ cooks (with heat) food-for-eating $j_2$ by recipe/method $j_3$ (process).,Cf. {jukpa}.,lujvo,cook,,,
column138: glamau,$g_1$=$z_1$ is hotter than $z_2$ by standard $g_2$ by amount $z_4$.,Cf. {glare} {zmadu},lujvo,hotter,,,
column139: glamretci,$t_1$ is a thermometer used for measuring temperature $m_2$=$g_1$ as $m_3$ units on scale $m_4$ with accuracy $m_5$,,lujvo,thermometer,,,
column140: glaske,$s_1$ (mass of facts) is the science of thermodymanics / science of / about heat / heating based on methodology $s_3$.,Made from {glare} and {saske}.  saske2 and all places of glare subsumed.,lujvo,thermodynamics,,,
column141: glatimdemricfoi,$f_1$ is a jungle with trees $t_1$.,See also rain forest (={cavricfoi}).,lujvo,jungle,,,
column142: fy zei sance,$x_1$ is a voiceless labiodental fricative sound produced by $x_2$.,Synonym: {fasnce}.,zei-lujvo,F sound,voiceless labiodental fricative,voiceless labiodental fricative sound,,,

column159: fiprne'oceratodu,$f_1$ is a Queensland/Australian lungfish/Burnett salmon/barramunda (genus Neoceratodus)  of species $f_2$.,See also: lungfish (={fepryfi'e}).,fu'ivla,Australian lungfish,barramunda,Burnett salmon,Queensland lungfish,fiprne'oceratodu,,

column167: fiprtraktoste,$f_1$ is a gar/garpike (genus Atractosteus) of species $f_2$.,Three species: Alligator gar (A. spatula), Cuban gar (A. tristoechus), Tropical gar (A. tropicus).,fu'ivla,gar,garpike,fiprtraktoste,,
