column169: fipse'udoskafirinku,$f_1$ is a sturgeon (genus Pseudoscaphirhynchus) of species $f_2$.,,fu'ivla,sturgeon,fipse'udoskafirinku,,
column171: flaukse,$x_1$ is the vector flux (flow) of quantity/substance (count) $x_2$ through (geometric/imaginary) hypersurface/embedded manifold $x_3$ per unit hyperarea per unit time.,This is the transport phenomena sense of "flux": a density of flow, the maximal rate of flow of a subsramce or quantity ($x_2$) through a differential hypersurface. If the hypersurface $x_3$ is $n$-dimensional spatially and the dimensionality (units) of $x_2$ is $U$, then the dimensionality (units) of $x_1$ is $U$/(1 m$^{n}$ * s). Fairly similar to {nildenmi}. For the hypersurface integral of this quantity (with respect to the normal), use: {flaumji}. See also: {flecu}.,fu'ivla,flux,flaukse,,
column172: flaume,$x_1$ is a plum of variety $x_2$.,see also {persika}, {rutrprunu},fu'ivla,plum,flaume,,
column173: flaumji,$x_1$ is the scalar flux (total flow) of quantity/substance $x_2$ through bounding Jordan orientable manifold $x_3$ under conditions and conventions of definition $x_4$ (including actual orientation of $x_3$, signum of outflux, etc.),This is the hypersurface integral sense "flux". For the sense of the integrand which produces this meaning, use {flaukse}. See also: {flecu}, {nildenmi}.,fu'ivla,flux,flaumji,,
column174: fletola,$x_1$ (property of $x_3$) is the grammar of language $x_2$ for elidible construct $x_3$ that is assumed to fill its place even if elided,See also {gretera}, {gerna},fu'ivla,grammar of elidible constructs,fletola,,
column175: flundero,$x_1$ is a flounder of species $x_2$.,Cf. {mlafi'e}.,fu'ivla,flounder,flundero,,
column176: foinkana'o,$x_1$ represents/pertains to Canaan/Phoenician culture in property/aspect $x_2$,,fu'ivla,Phoenician,foinkana'o,,
column177: foldota,$x_1$ is a pangolin of species/breed $x_2$.,Cf. {mabru}, {manti}, {mudyctijalra}.,fu'ivla,pangolin,scaly anteater,trenggiling,foldota,,
column178: fo'orma,$x_1$ is a formal expression; $x_1$ is formal,,fu'ivla,formal,formal expression,fo'orma,,
column179: formato,$x_1$ is a format, layout of a publication or document $x_2$,See also {uencu}, {morna}, {tarmi},fu'ivla,format,formato,,
column180: formose,$x_1$ has a pleasing shape, is pleasant to look at by $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,formose,,
column181: fortepano,$x_1$ is a fortepiano,{klavile} is a more generic term,fu'ivla,fortepiano,fortepano,,
column182: fragari,$x_1$ is a strawberry of species/breed $x_2$.,Cf. {frambesi}, {grute}, {jbari}, {rozgu}.,fu'ivla,strawberry,fragari,,
column183: fraksino,$x_1$ is an ash of species/variety $x_2$.,,fu'ivla,ash,fraksino,,
column184: fraktali,$x_1$ is a fractal with properties $x_2$,Fractal is a geometric figure that repeats itself under several levels of magnification, and that shows self-similarity on all scales. See also {pixra}, {cartu}, {panra}, {ckilu},fu'ivla,fractal,fraktali,,
column185: frambesi,$x_1$ is a blackberry/raspberry/bramble of species $x_2$.,Cf. {fragari}, {grute}, {jbari}, {rozgu}.,fu'ivla,blackberry,bramble,raspberry,frambesi,,
column186: frangula,$x_1$ is a buckthorn of species/variety $x_2$.,,fu'ivla,buckthorn,frangula,,
column187: frankobolo,$x_1$ is a document used to prepay service $x_2$ like postage costs, tax, license fees; $x_1$ is a postage stamp used to pay service $x_2$,See also {mrilu}.,fu'ivla,postage stamp,frankobolo,,
column188: frasuje,$x_1$ reflects/relates to/pertains to Gothic (French-originating, High or Late Medieval, post-Romanesque pre-Renaissance) style/aesthetic/art/architecture/practice in aspect $x_2$,Probably not restricted to pieces from the original time period, as long as it relates to the style in some way. Does not refer to the various Goths peoples in a contemporaneous manner, nor to the 'emo/goth' style (dark clothes, etc.).,fu'ivla,Gothic,frasuje,,
column189: fredura,$x_1$ (text) is an example of witticism, quip about $x_2$ by $x_3$,See also {notci}, {xalbo},fu'ivla,,fredura,,
column190: fre'edi,$x_1$ is a quantity of dark matter/dark gravitation [unknown thing with gravitational consequences] with properties $x_2$,If scientists eventually figure out that dark matter is not a thing at all but, for example, the result of a mathematical correction to our present understanding of gravitation, this word may need to be redefined to something similar to "$x_1$ relates to dark matter/dark gravitation in manner/aspect $x_2$", or whatsoever is fitting, or it could be deleted all together.,fu'ivla,dark matter,fre'edi,,
column192: fretaimlunra,$x1$ pertains to the Fertile Crescent region/geography/nationality/culture/history in property/aspect $x2$,,fu'ivla,Fertile Crescent,fretaimlunra,,
column193: fri'ai,$x_1$ and $x_2$ are in relation $x_3$ with different things (i.e. not the same things).,See also: {unli}.,fu'ivla,,fri'ai,,
column194: frikadeli,$x_1$ is a boiled meatball (meal; a ball of minced or ground meat, boiled) consisting of $x_2$,{polpeta} is a more generic term. See also {tefteli}, {sanmi}, {rectu},fu'ivla,,frikadeli,,
column195: frikasi,$x_1$ is a fricassee, pieces of chicken or other meat stewed in gravy with e.g. carrots and onions and served with noodles or dumplings,,fu'ivla,,frikasi,,
column196: frisefa,$x_1$ experiencing $x_2$ is prevented by $x_3$; $x_1$ misses (one sense) $x_2$,See {lifri}, {fanta},fu'ivla,,frisefa,,
column197: friteri,$x_1$ is a friterie / baraque  frites / friture / frituur / frietkot / frietkraam serving fast food $x_2$ to $x_3$.,A particular type of fast food restaurant, selling fries and usually a variety of other deep-fried snacks and sauces, as found in Belgium, the Netherlands and Northern France. The place structure models {gusta}.,fu'ivla,friterie,friteri,,
column198: fru'austumu,$x_1$ is a frustum/cone/cylinder/pyramid made of material $x_2$ with larger base $x_3$ and at-most-as-large base $x_4$, with other characteristics $x_5$.,$x_4$ cannot be larger in hyperarea than $x_3$. A cone and a pyramid are degenerate frusta with exactly one base ($x_4$) being exactly a point (the apex); a line segment is a doubly-degenerate frustum with $x_3$ (and therefore $x_4$) being a point. The bases should typically be approximately parallel to one another; they need not be perpendicular to their axis. Except possibly when at least one base is a point, they will be (apprpximately) geometrically similar to one another (having the same cross-section along parallel planes wrt the axis, modulo scale/size, which will nonetheless be multiplied by a uniform factor in all 'dimensions'). A round base will produce, approximately, a circular cone or a (circular) cylinder.,fu'ivla,frustum,fru'austumu,,
column199: frufengalu,$x_1$ is a bandersnatch of species $x_2$,,fu'ivla,bandersnatch,frufengalu,,
column200: fulreto,$x_1$ is a ferret (Mustela putorius furo) of the breed $x_2$,See {ermine}, {mutsteila},fu'ivla,ferret,fulreto,,
column201: funduki,$x_1$ is a hazel (nut/tree) of species $x_2$,,fu'ivla,filbert,hazel,hazelnut,funduki,,
column202: funseia,$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'operator' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.,Inner structure of the rule: operator-1 (joik-jek operator-1 | joik stag? KE # operator /KEhE#/)*. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.,fu'ivla,,funseia,,
column203: funtiio,$x_1$ (plural of ordered pairs) is an exhaustive set (possibly infinite) of inputs/outputs defining a unary function which yields result $x_3$ when given input $x_2$; $x_1$($x_2$) = $x_3$,"f(x) = z" == "fy funtiio xy fi zy". "lo ro se {zilbri} be lo ka ce'u {sumji} ce'u li pa" is a way to extract the input/output set of the relation "f(x) = x1", so that you can use it as funtiio's x1. Using a la-name for referring to a function is also an option, for example "la .fankcyn. cu funtiio li re li ci". See also {fancu}, {fancuka}.,fu'ivla,function,funtiio,,
column204: furfuru,$x_1$ is dandruff in/on $x_2$ caused by $x_3$.,,fu'ivla,dandruff,furfuru,,
column205: furkula,$x_1$ is a furcula/wishbone/merrythought/fused clavicle (body part) of $x_2$.,,fu'ivla,furcula,wishbone,furkula,,
column207: girzrdau,$x_1$ is a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) running on blockchain $x_2$ founded for purpose $x_3$,See also: {girzu}, {kagni},fu'ivla,company,organization,girzrdau,,
column211: fi'oi,Right-scoping adverbial clause: encloses a bridi and turns it into an adverbial term; the antecedent (ke'a) of the enclosed bridi stands for the outer bridi {lo su'u no'a ku} (the bridi in which this fi'oi term appears), including all the other adverbial terms (tags...) within this bridi located on the right of this fi'oi term (rightward scope).,Terminator: fi'au.,experimental cmavo,right-scoping adverbial clause,,,,FIhOI
column212: fo'ai,Creates a predicate abstraction sumti out of a full bridi clause, binding all the necessary lambda variables to the ko'a-ko'u pronoun series. The number of bound variables must be indicated by appending {xi} followed by that number to the word {fo'ai}, unless only one variable (namely {fo'a}) is bound, in which case the {xi} marking is optional.,"lo ka ce'u ce'u ce'u broda (ku)" = "fo'ai xi ci fo'a fo'e fo'i broda (ku'au)". In the rare cases where more than five lambda variables are needed, fo'a xi PA might be used. See also ko'ai, ce'ai.,experimental cmavo,,,,,LOhOI
column213: foi'e,GOI attachment modifier: allows a cmavo of selma'o GOI (which must follow immediately) to be attached to a selbri,This word must (ignoring quotes, etc.) be preceded by a selbri (to which it immediately attaches, even in sumti) and must be followed by a member of selma'o GOI (ignoring erasure, etc.). All other semantics and syntax of the GOI construct remains the same, it just applies to the selbri immediately prior to this word, rather than a sumti. See also: {po'oi}.,experimental cmavo,GOI attachment modifier,,,,FOIhE
column214: foi'i,create a relation abstraction sumti out of a full bridi clause, binding the two lambda variables to the {fo'i} and {fo'u} pronouns.,,experimental cmavo,,,,
column215: fu'a'ai,digit/number: first Foias' constant; the unique value of $x_1$ such that $x_n$  ->  as n ->  for $x_{n+1}  = (1 + (1/( x_n )))^n$; such $x_1$ = 1.187,See also: {fu'a'au},experimental cmavo,first Foias' constant,,,,PA5
column216: fu'a'au,digit/number: second Foias constant; the value x for which $(1/x)(1 + (1/x))^x=1$ is true;  2.293,See also:  {fu'a'ai},experimental cmavo,second Foias constant,,,,PA5

column1: {fu'aunai} - unluckily.,Expresses fortune/misfortune of the speaker. Use {dai} to express fortune/misfortune of the listener. See also {funca}.,experimental cmavo,luckily,,,,UI3
column2: fu'ei,begin within-context quote.,Terminated by {fu'o}. Quoted text need not be grammatical on its own, but must be grammatical in context with the surrounding text.,experimental cmavo,quote,quote scope,,,,FUhE
column3: fu'ei'a,discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'a; used generally in quotations.,Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.,experimental cmavo,change to speaker 6,,,,UI
column4: fu'ei'e,discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'e; used generally in quotations.,Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.,experimental cmavo,change to speaker 7,,,,UI
column5: fu'ei'i,discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'i; used generally in quotations.,Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.,experimental cmavo,change to speaker 8,,,,UI
column6: fu'ei'o,discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'o; used generally in quotations.,Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.,experimental cmavo,change to speaker 9,,,,UI
column7: fu'ei'u,discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'u; used generally in quotations.,Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.,experimental cmavo,change to speaker 10,,,,UI
column8: fu'i nai,attitudinal modifier:

column2: fy'ai,digit/number: twenty-one (decimal 21).,,experimental cmavo,,,,,PA
column3: fy'oi,Number suffix initiating a subordinate clause representing a predicate whose arity is the suffixed number; the lambda variables representing the predicate slots are bound from the fo'a-fo'u series in their dictionary ordering; the number of bound variables is the same as the predicate arity.,For example, if the selected arity is two (re fy'oi), then only {fo'a} and {fo'e} are bound, and {fo'i} etc. are not bound. Terminator: {ku'au}.,experimental cmavo,,,,,KYhOI
column4: ga'ai,unary mekso operator: Lorentz-Einstein gamma factor $+1/((1-(|X|^2))^{(+1/2)})$ for input $X$.,Typically, input X can be a scalar (typically between -1 and 1, exclusive of both endpoints except in the limit) or a vector (or a similar mathematical object) with a signed magnitude belonging to the previously mentioned interval; in the former case, "|X|" in the definition refers to its absolute value; in the latter case, "|X|" in the definition refers to the nonnegative magnitude of said vector (or similar object). Typically, the output is a(n extended) real number no less than 1; whether or not positive-infinity exists in the codomain is a matter of convenience, convention, and context. This definition can be extended (such as for tachyons).,experimental cmavo,gamma factor,Lorentz factor,,,,VUhU
column5: gi'ei,afterthought abstraction wrapper,Accepts 'gi'ei LE NU', 'gi'ei NU' (elided LE defaults to {lo}), or 'gi'ei LOhOI'. Wraps the bridi before it within an abstraction. e.g. 'mi klama le zarci gi'ei-le-nu cabna lo nu do klama' = 'le nu mi klama le zarci cu cabna lo nu do klama'. Also see {xoi}, {jai'i}. Grammar note: The {gi'ei}-group acts like a specialized {vau}, grabbing a single bridi. If you are in a sub-bridi of the bridi you wish to convert, you need to close the sub-bridi with {vau}, or use {i'au} to return to the top bridi of the sentence.,experimental cmavo,afterthought abstraction wrapper,,,,GIhEI
column6: fiorso,$x_1$ is an aspect of / a part of The Force connecting / within $x_2$,No attempt at good fu'ivla making was harmed in the creation of this word.,obsolete fu'ivla,The Force,fiorso,,
column7: fiprge'otria,$f_1$ is a pouched/wide-mouthed lamprey (genus Geotria) of species $f_2$.,,obsolete fu'ivla,pouched lamprey,wide-mouthed lamprey,fiprge'otria,,
column8: fiprkaspiomizo,$f_1$ is a Caspian lamprey (genus Caspiomyzon ) of species $f_2$.,,obsolete fu'ivla,Caspian lamprey,fiprkaspiomizo,,
column9: fiprkti'omizo,$f_1$ is a lamprey (genus Ichthyomyzon) of species $f_2$.,,obsolete fu'ivla,lamprey,fiprkti'omizo,,
column10: fiprlatimeria,$f_1$ is a  West Indian Ocean or Indonesian coelacanth (genus Latimeria) of species $f_2$.,syn. {gombesa},obsolete fu'ivla,Indonesian coelacanth,West Indian Ocean coelacanth,fiprlatimeria,,
column11: fiprmia,$f_1$ is a bowfin (genus Amia) of species $f_2$.,,obsolete fu'ivla,bowfin,fiprmia,,
column12: fiprmordacia,$f_1$ is a southern topeyed lamprey (genus Mordacia) of species $f_2$.,,obsolete fu'ivla,southern topeyed lamprey,fiprmordacia,,
column13: fiprpoliodo,$f_1$ is an (American) paddlefish/spoonbill (genus Polyodon) of species $f_2$.,,obsolete fu'ivla,paddlefish,spoonbill,fiprpoliodo,,
column14: fiprpsefuru,$f_1$ is a Chinese paddlefish/swordfish (genus Psephurus) of species $f_2$.,,obsolete fu'ivla,Chinese paddlefish,Chinese swordfish,fiprpsefuru,,
column15: fiprpseudoskafirinku,$f_1$ is a sturgeon (genus Pseudoscaphirhynchus) of species $f_2$.,,obsolete fu'ivla,sturgeon,fiprpseudoskafirinku,,
column16: fiprtetrapleurodo,$f_1$ is a Mexican (brook) lamprey (genus Tetrapleurodon) of species $f_2$.,,obsolete fu'ivla,Mexican lamprey,fiprtetrapleurodo,,
column17: fortepiano,$x_1$ is a fortepiano,{klavile} is a more generic term,obsolete fu'ivla,fortepiano,fortepiano,,
column18: gi'e nai,logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought x but not y.,,cmavo-compound,bridi but not,,,,GIhA*
column19: gikfagri,$x_1$ is a campfire with fuel $x_2$ burning-in/reacting-with oxidizer $x_3$ at camp/encampment $x_4$.,See {ginka}, {fagri}, {mudyfagri}.,lujvo,campfire,,,
column20: gimrafrimna,$x_1$ is a rhythmic conjugation of word $x_2$, rhyming with word $x_3$ in language $x_4$, with changed final vowel/ending $x_5$.,This word refers to the uncommon practice of changing the last vowel of a brivla in order to have it rhyme with surrounding words in its spoken context.  This can only be done to gismu and lujvo ending in 5-letter rafsi. x2 should be the orthodox spelling of x1.  Use "{me'o} [vowel]" to describe x5. This word is an autonym, being a {gimrafrimna} of the word {gimrafrimni}.  See also {rimni} {abu} {ebu} {ibu} {obu} {ubu} {sezyskivla}.,lujvo,rhythmic conjugation,,,
column21: gimste,$x_1$ is a list of gismu,See {gismu} {liste},lujvo,gimste,list of gismu,,,
column22: gimyzevla,$x_1$ is a stage 3 fu'ivla/zi'evla meaning $x_2$, based on gismu/root word $x_3$ in language $x_4$,Synonymous to {cibyfu'ivla}.,lujvo,gismu-based zi'evla,stage 3 fu'ivla,stage 3 zi'evla,,,
column23: gincilta,$x_1$ is a chromosome containing gene/locus $x_2$ of species $x_3$.,Cf. {jgina}, {cilta}.,lujvo,chromosome,,,
column24: ginlazdze,$x_1$ is a genetic-familial/'blood' ancestor of $x_2$ by bond/tie/relation/of degree $x_3$.,$x_2$ must be the genetic offspring of $x_1$ or the genetic offspring of someone who is also a ginlazyseldze of $x_1$; trivially, one may consider $x_1$ to be a ginlazydze of themself ($x_1$), and possibly/probably others. See also: {kraune}, {kloje}, {tseingu}, {dzena}.  This is more specific than {seldze} ($x_3$ is much narrower). This word is equivalent to "{se} {ginlazyseldze}". This word allows familial peers as possibilities for $x_1$ and $x_2$, so this relationship is a subtype of {ginydze}.,lujvo,ancestor,blood ancestor,genetic ancestor,,,
column25: ginlazrirni,$x_1$ is the biological/full/genetic-familial/'blood' parent of $x_2$; $x_2$ is the biological offspring/direct and immediate genetic-familial descendant of $x_1$.,Step-parents are excluded, as are most other forms of parenting/rearing/raising/mentoring. Genetic clones may be included.,lujvo,ancestor,biological offspring,biological parent,blood parent,descendant,full parent,genetic offspring,genetic parent,immediate ancestor,immediate descendant,,,
column26: ginlazyseldze,$x_1$ is a genetic-familial/'blood' descendant of $x_2$ by bond/tie/relation/of degree $x_3$.,$x_1$ must be the genetic offspring of $x_2$ or the genetic offspring of someone who is also a ginlazyseldze of $x_2$; trivially, one may consider $x_2$ to be a ginlazydze of themself ($x_2$), and possibly/probably others. See also: {kraune}, {kloje}, {tseingu}, {dzena}.  This is more specific than {seldze} ($x_3$ is much narrower). This word is equivalent to "{se} {ginlazdze}".,lujvo,blood descendant,descendant,genetic descendant,,,
column27: ginlazytunba,$x_1$ is a genetic-familial/biological/'blood' sibling of $x_2$ by bond/tie/standard/shared genetic parent(s) $x_3$.,Half-siblings are included; step-siblings are excluded.,lujvo,biological sibling,blood sibling,full-sibling,genetic-familial,half-sibling,,,
column28: ginsle,$s_1$ is a chemical base (adenine/thymine/guanine/cytosine) within gene $j_1$=$s_2$.,,lujvo,chemical base,,,
column29: ginydze,$x_1$ is a genetic/biological ancestor (or familial peer thereof) of $x_2$ by relationship/to degree $x_3$ through/along graph-geodesic within their shared biological family.,There is a genetic/biological path of parent-child connections which connects $x_2$ to a familial peer of $x_1$ such that this said peer and $x_1$ are approximately of the same generation (such as siblings or cousins); $x_1$ must belong to the same genetic family as $x_2$ and the said peer. Very similar to "{rirny'utka}", except genetic/biological connection is implied every step along the way, and $x_1$ may actually be a familial peer of the same generation as the actual direct ancestor, rather than necessarily being that direct ancestor themself. Notice that any familial peer of $x_2$ is a potential substitute themself for $x_2$ in this definition, so a symmetry wrt the breadth of specification due to allowance of peers is indeed implied, but need be explicitly allowed by the definition in only one case. This word is broader than and includes {ginlazdze}; it allows for the possibility of horizontal gene transfer, artificial genetic manipulation, clonal relations, very large organisms (such as certain fungi and aspens) which appear to be multiple organisms, asexual reproduction, and possibly even tissue transplants (not all of which "{ginlazdze}" will include).,lujvo,biological ancestor,direct ancestor,genetic ancestor,indirect ancestor,,,
column30: gitytortci,$x_1$ is a capo for guitar/banjo/mandolin $x_2$.,,lujvo,capo,capodastro,,,
column31: glabi'a,$b_1$=$g_1$ is feverish/has a fever, from disease $b_3$, by standard $g_2$,from {glare} {bilma},lujvo,febrile,fever, have a,feverish,,,
column32: glajarpatxu,$x_1$=$p_1$ is a crucible for $x_2$=$p_2$, of material/properties $x_3$=$p_3$,from {glare}+{jdari}+{patxu},lujvo,crucible,,,
column33: glaladyckafi,$c_1$ is a quantity of caf au lait/latte/caf con leche/cappuccino/flat white/coffee with heated dairy [or similar] product/creamer/whitener $la_1$=$g_1$, addition warm by standard $g_2$.,See also: coffee with milk (={ladyckafi}), caf au lait (={ckafre'ole}), caff latte (={kafrlate}), caf con leche (={kafrlece}), cappuccino (={kafrkapucino}), flat white (={kafrsralo}), latte drinker (={pixrlate}).,lujvo,coffee,,,
column34: glamre,$m_1$ is a temperature measurer measuring the temperature of object $m_2$=$g_1$ as $m_3$ units on scale $m_4$ with accuracy $m_5$,,lujvo,temperature measurer,,,
column35: glanejni,$n_1$ is the heat of $n_3$=$g_1$.,Cf. {nejni}, {glare}.,lujvo,heat,,,
column36: glaterjukpa,$j_3$ is a cooking recipe for food-for-eating $j_2$ cooked by $j_1$.,Cf. {glajukpa}.,lujvo,cooking recipe,,,
column37: gik zei uanta,$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'gik' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.,Inner structure of the rule: GI NAI? #. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.,zei-lujvo,,,,
column38: gingamu,$x_1$ is a quantity/is made of gingham.,Shorter form of {bukrgingamu}.,fu'ivla,gingham,gingamu,,
column40: gi'e'u'a,logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought always true.,Created to complete the scope of truth tables to include TTTT and FFFF, despite being described as relatively useless. Etymology: gi'a + jetnu + A.,experimental cmavo,Always True,,,,GIhA
column41: gi'i'a'a,logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought always false.,Created to complete the scope of truth tables to include TTTT and FFFF, despite being described as relatively useless. Etymology: gi'a + jitfa + A.,experimental cmavo,Always False,,,,GIhA
column43: gi'o'i,pro-bridi: in the second half of a bridi forethought connective expression, refers to the first half.,For example: in "ga mi broda do gi ta na gi'o'i", gi'o'i refers to "(mi) broda do". In case of nesting, the innermost connective is targeted, unless a subscript specifies otherwise: in "ge mi broda gi ga do brode gi gi'o'i", gi'o'i refers to "do brode". "gi'o'i xi re" may be used to refer to the second-innermost referent, "mi broda".,experimental cmavo,,,,,GOhA
column44: gi'oi,This cmavo precedes a predicate (at least binary) and turns it into a forethought conjunction, which syntactically behaves like GA cmavo. The predicate indicates the relationship between the two connected propositions. Terminator: {te'u}.,This is the forethought version of {ji'oi}.,experimental cmavo,,,,,GIhOI
column45: gi'o nai,logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought exclusive or; Latin 'aut'.,,cmavo-compound,bridi xor,,,,GIhA*
column46: gleki,$x_{1}$ is happy/merry/glad/gleeful about $x_{2}$ (event/state).,Adversity (= {kamnalgei}).  See also {badri}, {cinmo}.,gismu,happy,gek,gei,glek,gleki,,
column47: gletu,$x_{1}$ copulates/mates/has coitus/sexual intercourse with $x_{2}$.,$x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetrical; mounts (= {cpanygle}). Note that the word "gletu" lacks the taboo associated with some of its English gloss words, or any of the various English slang uses. See also {cinse}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}, {mabla}, {speni}.,gismu,copulate,fuck,have sexual intercourse with,have sex with,let,gle,glet,gletu,,
column48: glico,$x_{1}$ is English/pertains to English-speaking culture in aspect $x_{2}$.,Generally assume broadest sense of 'English'; may refer to 'English', pertaining to the country/people/culture of England (normally requiring constraint = gligu'e, or simply redundancy = gligli-); British English, the norm language of the UK (= {gliglibau}).  (cf. {brito} which refers to the United Kingdom as a whole or to the British empire, {merko}, {sralo}, {kadno}, {skoto}),gismu,English,gic,gli,glic,glico,,
column49: gluta,$x_{1}$ is a mitten/glove [hand and lower arm garment] of material $x_{2}$.,Mitten (= {degycauglu}).  See also {taxfu}.,gismu,glove,glu,glut,gluta,,
column50: gocti,$x_{1}$ is $10^{-24}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).,See also {grake}, {mitre}, {snidu}, {stero}, {delno}, {molro}, {kelvo}, {xampo}, {gradu}. {litce}, {merli}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gotro}, {kilto}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro},gismu,1E-24,goc,goct,gocti,,
column51: gotro,$x_{1}$ is $10^{24}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).,See also {grake}, {mitre}, {snidu}, {stero}, {delno}, {molro}, {kelvo}, {xampo}, {gradu}. {litce}, {merli}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {kilto}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro},gismu,1E24,got,gotr,gotro,,
column52: gradu,$x_{1}$ [magnitude] is a unit/degree of/on scale/reference standard $x_{2}$ (si'o) measuring property $x_{3}$.,Also grade, level, point; $x_3$ dimension.  See also {ckilu}, {kantu}, {kelvo}, {merli}, {ranti}, {selci}.,gismu,degree,unit,rau,grad,gradu,,
column53: grake,$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ gram(s) [metric unit] in mass (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.,See also {junta}, {kilto}, {bunda}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {litce}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}.,gismu,gram,gra,grak,grake,,
column54: grana,$x_{1}$ is a rod/pole/staff/stick/cane [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.,See also {garna}.,gismu,cane,pole,rod,staff,stick,ga'a,gran,grana,,
column55: grasu,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains grease/fat/oil from source $x_{2}$.,See also {ctile}, {matne}, {plana}.,gismu,fat,grease,ras,gras,grasu,,
column56: greku,$x_{1}$ is a frame/structure/skeleton/outline supporting/load-bearing/determining the form of $x_{2}$.,See also {korbi}, {stura}, {tsina}, {bongu}.,gismu,frame,rek,grek,greku,,
column58: grute,$x_{1}$ is a fruit [body-part] of species $x_{2}$.,See also {badna}, {dembi}, {figre}, {guzme}, {narge}, {perli}, {pilka}, {plise}, {spati}, {stagi}, {tamca}, {tsiju}, {tarbi}, {panzi}, {rorci}, te {pruce}, {jbari}, {nimre}.,gismu,fruit,rut,grut,grute,,
column59: gubni,$x_{1}$ is public/un-hidden/open/jointly available to/owned by all among community $x_{2}$ (mass).,See also {sivni}.,gismu,public,gub,gubn,gubni,,
column60: gugde,$x_{1}$ is the country of peoples $x_{2}$ with land/territory $x_{3}$; (people/territory relationship).,Also sovereignty, domestic (as opposed to foreign), nation (when not referring to ethnos).  See also {turni}, {natmi}, {jecta}, {tumla}, {tutra}, {lanci}.,gismu,country,gug,gu'e,gugd,gugde,,
column61: gundi,$x_{1}$ is industry/industrial/systematic manufacturing activity producing $x_{2}$ by process/means $x_{3}$.,See also {cupra}, {fanri}, {rutni}, {zbasu}.,gismu,industry,gud,gund,gundi,,
column62: gunka,$x_{1}$ [person] labors/works on/at $x_{2}$ [activity] with goal/objective $x_{3}$.,Also: $x_1$ is a worker/laborer.  (cf. {sazri}, {gasnu}, {se} {jibri}; {zukte} - which need not be labor; physics term 'work' = {ni} {muvyselbai}, {briju}, {jibri}, {lazni}, {selfu}),gismu,work,gun,gu'a,gunk,gunka,,
column63: gunma,$x_{1}$ is a mass/team/aggregate/whole, together composed of components $x_{2}$, considered jointly.,A description in $x_1$ indicates of mass property(ies) displayed by the mass; masses may reveal properties not found in the individual set members that are massified, which themselves are not necessarily relevant to the mass property implicit in this bridi.  See also {bende}, {girzu}, {pagbu}, cmavo list {loi}, {lei}, {lai}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {kansa}, {tinci}, {mulgunma}.,gismu,jointly,mass,gum,gunm,gunma,,
column64: gunro,$x_{1}$ rolls/trundles on/against surface $x_{2}$ rotating on axis/axle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a roller.,See also {bolci}, {carna}, {jendu}, {slanu}.,gismu,roll,gur,gu'o,gunr,gunro,,
column65: gunse,$x_{1}$ is a goose/[gander] of species/breed $x_{2}$.,See also {cipni}.,gismu,goose,guns,gunse,,
column66: gunta,$x_{1}$ (person/mass) attacks/invades/commits aggression upon victim $x_{2}$ with goal/objective $x_{3}$.,See also {bradi}, {damba}, {darxi}, {jamna}, {jenca}, {jursa}.,gismu,attack,gut,gunt,gunta,,
column67: gurni,$x_{1}$ is grain/[British: corn]/cereal from plant/species $x_{2}$.,See also {bavmi}, {cunmi}, {mavji}, {maxri}, {molki}, {mraji}, {rismi}, {sobde}, {spati}, {zumri}, {nanba}, {sorgu}.,gismu,grain,gru,gurn,gurni,,
column68: guska,$x_{1}$ blade/scraper/erosive scrapes/erodes/abrades $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.,Abrade, abrasive (= {mosyguska}).  See also {balre}, {sraku}, {batci}, {canpa}, {mosra}.,gismu,scrape,guk,gusk,guska,,
column69: gusni,$x_1$ [energy] is light/illumination illuminating $x_2$ from light source $x_3$.,[$x_3$ illuminates/lights $x_2$ with light/illumination $x_1$; $x_2$ is lit/illuminated by illumination $x_1$ from source $x_3$ (= {selgu'i} for reordered places); light/lamp (= {tergu'i})](cf. {dirce}, {manku}, {solri}, {carmi}, {ctino}, {kantu}),gismu,illumine,light,gus,gu'i,gusn,gusni,,
column70: gusta,$x_{1}$ is a restaurant/cafe/diner serving type-of-food $x_{2}$ to audience $x_{3}$.,See also {barja}, {citka}, {kukte}, {sanmi}, {xotli}.,gismu,restaurant,gust,gusta,,
column71: gutci,$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) short local distance unit(s) [non-metric], standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.,Foot (= {jmagutci}); yard (= {cibjmagutci}), pace (= {tapygutci}), inch (= {degygutci}), cubit (= {birgutci}).  (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.,gismu,cubit,guc,gutc,gutci,,
column72: gutra,$x_{1}$ is a/the womb/uterus [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: nourishing, protective, giving birth].,See also {jbena}, {rorci}, {sovda}, {tarbi}, {ganti}, {mabla}.,gismu,womb,gutr,gutra,,
column73: go,logical connective: forethought all but tanru internal biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if(with gi).,,cmavo,fore iff,,,,GA
column74: go'a,pro-bridi: repeats a recent bridi (usually not the last 2).,,cmavo,recent bridi,,,,GOhA
column75: go'e,pro-bridi: repeats the next to last bridi.,,cmavo,penultimate bridi,,,,GOhA
column76: go'i,pro-bridi: preceding bridi; in answer to a yes/no question, repeats the claim, meaning yes.,,cmavo,last bridi,,,,GOhA
column77: goi,sumti assignment; used to define/assign ko'a/fo'a series pro-sumti; Latin 'sive'.,Note: Directionality of assignment may be ambiguous. {ca'e} on the "toward" side may be used to disambiguate.,cmavo,pro-sumti assign,,,,GOI
column78: go'o,pro-bridi: repeats a future bridi, normally the next one.,,cmavo,future bridi,,,,GOhA
column79: go'u,pro-bridi: repeats a remote past bridi.,,cmavo,earlier bridi,,,,GOhA
column80: gu,logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal whether-or-not (with gi).,,cmavo,fore whether,,,,GA
column81: gu'a,logical connective: tanru-internal forethought or (with gi).,,cmavo,fore tanru or,,,,GUhA
column82: gu'e,logical connective: tanru-internal forethought and (with gi).,,cmavo,fore tanru and,,,,GUhA
column83: gu'i,logical connective: tanru-internal forethought question (with gi).,,cmavo,fore tanru conn ?,,,,GUhA
column84: gu'o,logical connective: tanru-internal forethought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if (with gi).,,cmavo,fore tanru iff,,,,GUhA

column2: ii,attitudinal:

glife,$x_1$ is a glyph, elemental symbol within an agreed set of symbols, intended to represent character $x_2$,Glyphs are used for the purposes of writing, expressing thoughts, ideas and concepts. See also {lerfu},experimental gismu,glyph,glife,,
column3: glosa,$x_1$ is a gloss (brief explanatory note or translation) of $x_2$ (text),See also {lo} {ve} {ciksi}, {uenzi}, {traduki},experimental gismu,gloss,glosa,,
column4: grafu,$x_1$ is the graph on vertices/nodes $x_2$ (set) and edges $x_3$ (set of ordered or unordered 2-tuples of vertices in $x_2$) and with additional properties $x_4$.,A "web"/"network". An element of x2 is a "place" in a more generic/abstract/metaphoric sense than spatial; must be discrete. Thus, webpages, family diagrams, lattices, pages in a book, cities and roadways on a map, etc. constitute graphs. x1 also includes trees. Notice that both x2 and x3 are sets; a member of x3 is a 2-tuple, but the order matters iff x1 is oriented - in which case, the edge connects from the first node in the tuple to the second node in the tuple. x4 can include defining features, weights, etc. Equivalent to {grafetu} (which is merely the fu'ivla form of this word); very similar to {tcana}.,experimental gismu,edge of graph,graph,network,node,web,grafu,,
column5: grava,$x_1$ pertains/is related to/reflects (the) gravitational interaction [fundamental]/gravity in manner/with properties/in state/with realization $x_2$, coupling to $x_3$ in manner/with strength $x_4$,Proposed short rafsi: -gav-. See also: {jikfi}, {dicma}, {vubla}, {tsaba}, {xigzo}, {junta}.,experimental gismu,gravitation,gravity,gav,grava,,
column6: gumri,$x_1$ is a mushroom of species $x_2$.,Cf. {mledi}, {ledgrute},experimental gismu,mushroom,gumri,,
column7: glatrotci,$x_1$ is a heating regulator,,lujvo,heating regulator,,,
column8: glebre,$x_1$ is in heat/estrus/musth; $x_1$ is horny/randy.,zoi gy. musth .gy steci lo xanto,lujvo,estrus,heat,horny,musth,randy,,,
column9: gledji,$x_1$=$g_1$=$d_1$ desires sexual activity $x_3$=$d_2$ with participants $x_2$=$g_2$ for purpose $x_4$=$d_3$,Noralujv's definition was scary. cf. {djica} and {gletu},lujvo,to be horny,to want someone,to want something,,,
column10: glefantyta'u,$x_1$ is a chastity device, for preventing $x_2$ from having sex,X2 is an intended wearer, not necessarily an actual wearer, e.g. "lo glefantyta'u be lo {nakni}" is a male chastity device. See {gletu}, {fanta}, and {taxfu}.,lujvo,chastity,chastity device,,,
column11: glefi'a,$c_1$ is pornography/erotica about plot/theme/subject/under convention $c_2$ by author $c_3$.,,lujvo,erotica,porn,pornography,,,
column12: glefra,$f_1$ reacts with orgasm $f_2$  to stimulus $f_3$ under conditions $f_4$; $f_1$ orgasms.,Cf. {gletu}, {frati}.,lujvo,orgasm,,,
column13: glekansa,$x_1$ together with $x_2$ has sex with $x_3$,Broadly speaking, this refers to threesomes, especially the kind in which two people more or less independently are having sex with a third person at the same time. The x1 and x2 may or may not be having sex with each other (in the gletu sense). See {glesi'u},lujvo,threesome,,,
column14: glekansi'u,$x_1$ (group) has sex with $x_2$,This is {glekansa} extended to groups. Note that this doesn't really say whether the members of the x1 group are having sex with each other.,lujvo,gangbang,,,
column15: glekemprezumpo'e,$x_1$ is sex slavery, the ownership of people for sexual purposes, according to law/custom/system $x_2$.,Involves rape ({baigle}) in almost every conceivable case. Not necessarily by a formal system of slavery. Effectively synonymous with {cinkemprezumpo'e}. For chattel slavery in general, see {prezumpo'e}.,lujvo,sex slavery,,,
column16: glepanryborki'i,$x_1$ and $x_2$ both have had/are having (not necessarily simultaneously) sexual intercourse with $x_3$, with the relevant difference(s) between $x_1$ and $x_2$ being $x_4$.,The (rude) slang for this is "$x_1$ and "$x_2$ are Eskimo brothers (no genders assumed) with respect to common sexual partner $x_3$". See also: "{panryki'i}".,lujvo,Eskimo brother,sexual co-partners,,,
column17: glepe'o,$p_1$=$g_2$ is a sexual partner of $p_2$=$g_1$.,Cf. {gletu}, {pendo}, {pampe'o}, {cinse},lujvo,boyfriend,girlfriend,partner,sexual partner,,,
column18: glesezborvli,$x_1$=$v_1$ has sexual mastery of itself/is sexually empowered in aspect $x_2$=$v_2$ under conditions $x_3$=$v_3$,Contrasts with {glevli} in that the latter implies external orientation of dominion whereas this word implies solely self-oriented empowerment. A sex slave is te glevli and not glesezborvli.,lujvo,sexually empowered,sexual mastery of self,,,
column19: gletci,$t_1$ is a tool/toy/instrument used for sex.,Cf. {runpinji}, {desmi'i}.,lujvo,sex toy,,,
column20: gleve'u,$x_1$ is a prostitute offering his/her services to $x_2$ for $x_3$ (payment).,Cf. {vibna}, {pinji}, {xangle}, {molgle}, {gaxygle}.,lujvo,prostitute,,,
column21: glevilgau,$x_1$=$ga_1$ (agent) commits/agentively causes event/state/act of sexual violence $x_2$=$v_1$.,See also: {glevlile}, {glevilxaigau},lujvo,sexual assault,sexual violence,,,
column22: glevilxaigau,$x_1$=$ga_1$ (agent) brings about/performs act of sexually violent harm $x_2$=$ga_2$=$xr_1$=$v_1$ against victim $x_3$=$xr_2$=$gl_2$ in aspect $x_4$=$xr_3$ (ka) inflicting harm/result $x_5$=$xr_4$ (state),,lujvo,sexual assault,sexually harms,sexual violence,,,
column23: glevli,$x_1$=$v_1$=$g_1$ has the power to bring about sexual activity/event $x_2$=$v_2$ with $x_3$=$g_2$ under conditions $x_4$=$v_3$; $x_1$ is sexually powerful in aspect $x_2$,Mutual symmetry between g1 and g2 is partially lost since only g1 is necessarily endowed with sexual power (even though the act of sex is mutually symmetric between them). Generalized sexual power (as in: self-empowerment) should have x3 erased or {gleborsezvli}; this word implies have sexual power over another (upon/over whom some sort of sexual power may be exercised).,lujvo,sexual power,sexual power over another,,,
column24: glevlile,$x_1$=$v_1$ is an event/state/act of sexual violence.,See also: {glevilgau},lujvo,sexual assault,sexual violence,,,
column25: glibau,$g_1$=$b_1$ is the English language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).,Cf. {glico}, {bangu}, {bangenugu}, {gliglibau}, {merbau}, {xinglibau}, {kadnyglibau}, {sralybau}, {kisyglibau}, {nanfi'oglibau}, {bangrnaidjiria}.,lujvo,English,,,
column26: glige'a,$ge_1$ is English grammar for structure/text $ge_2$.,Cf. {jboge'a}.,lujvo,English grammar,,,
column27: gliglibau,$g_1$=$b_1$ is the British English language, used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).,Syn. {ritybau}. Cf. {bangenugu}, {merbau}, {glibau}.,lujvo,British English,,,
column28: gligu'e,$gu_1$ is England (country).,Cf. {glico}, {gugde}, {glibau}, {glige'a}, {ritygu'e}, {kotygu'e}.,lujvo,England,,,
column29: gligugde,$x_1$ is an England of peoples $x_2$ with territory $x_3$, being English in aspect $x_4$.,Made from {glico} + {gugde}.,lujvo,,,,
column30: glipre,$x_1$ is an English person / is a person that shows traits $x_2$ related to England / English culture.,,lujvo,Englishman,Englishwoman,,,
column31: glixi'o,$x_1$=$g_1$ is Anglican in aspect $x_2$=$g_2$.,Cf. {glico}, {xriso}, {patxi'o}, {la'orxi'o}, {sunxi'o}, {lijda}.,lujvo,Anglican,,,
column32: glupreselkei,$s_2$=$p_1$=$g_1$ is a hand-puppet operated by $s_1$ from material $g_2$,,lujvo,puppet,,,
column33: grafyjbi,$x_1$ (node in graph) is near $x_2$ (node in same connected graph component), such that they are path-connected, along path(s) $x_3$ (default: at least one pairwise graph geodesic, with no restriction on which paths are considered) according to edge weighings $x_4$ in connected graph component $x_5$, with nearness standard/satisfying other conditions $x_6$.,$x_1$ need not be distinct from $x_2$, but they must share a connected graph component (undefined otherwise or if no clear graph/connecting relationship exists). See also: "{toryrailu'a}".,lujvo,near in graph,,,
column34: grafyjbirai,$x_1$ (node in graph) is among the very nearest nodes to $x_2$ (node in same graph), such that they are path-connected, along path(s) or paths of type $x_3$ (default: directed graph geodesics from $x_2$ to candidate other nodes, such that each of these candidates (plus $x_1$) are pairwise distinct from $x_2$) according to edge weighings $x_4$ in connected graph component $x_5$, with nearness standard/satisfying other conditions $x_6$, the extreme $x_7$ (default: ka zmadu, implying most-near) being amongst set/range $x_8$ of candidate nodes.,Multiple nodes may be equally near to $x_2$ for a given geodesic distance; $x_1$ is such that the geodesic distance between it and $x_2$ is positive but otherwise minimal (however, this does not necessarily uniquely specify/define/designate $x_1$). $x_1$, $x_2$, and elements of/nodes in $x_3$, $x_5$, and $x_8$ must all share a single edge-connected graph component, namely $x_5$; this word's referent is undefined/errors out otherwise or if no clear graph/connecting relationship exists. Path type for $x_3$ should define/be defined by a restrictive characteristic. Default value of $x_7$ is "ka zmadu", meaning "the quality of being most-near to $x_2$ under the aforementioned conditions, in the same connected graph component, according to aforementioned measurement methods, etc.", as opposed to (for example) "ka mleca", which means "the quality of being the least-near/most-far from $x_2$ under the aforementioned conditions, in the same connected graph component, according to aforementioned measurement methods, etc.". $x_1$ and $x_2$ each are a candidate node for the purposes of this definition. The condition of pairwise distinctness between candidates from $x_2$ may be relaxed by specification of or removal of definitional default for $x_3$. See also: "{toryrailu'a}", "{grafyjbi}".,lujvo,most-recent,nearest in graph,nearest node in graph,,,
column35: gramykemjipselfa'u,$g_1$=$j_2$=$f_2$ is a singularity/black hole with point-like gravity well $f_4$=$j_1$ with mass of $g_2$ kilograms.,,lujvo,black hole,singularity,,,
column36: grebe'i,$b_1$ ferries $b_2$=$p_1$ to $b_3$=$p_3$ from $b_4$=$p_4$ over barrier/medium/portal $b_5$=$p_2$.,Cf. {greblo}, {blogre}.,lujvo,ferry,,,
column37: greblo,$b_1$ is a ferry boat for carrying $b_2$ over barrier/medium/portal $x_3$=$p_2$ to destination $x_4$=$p_3$ from origin $x_5$=$p_4$.,Cf. {grebe'i}, {blogre}.,lujvo,ferryboat,,,
column38: gregau,$g_1$ makes $x_2$=$p_1$ pass through $x_3$=$p_2$ to destination side $x_4$=$p_3$ from origin side $x_5$=$p_4$.,Cf. {pijne}, {fenra}, {canko}, {greke'a}.,lujvo,pass through,,,
column39: greke'a,$x_1$=$k_1$ is a hole in $x_2$=$k_2$=$p_2$ to/between $x_3$=$p_3$ from/and $x_4$=$p_4$ permitting passage by $x_5$=$p_1$.,{pagre} + {kevna}. Precisely, $x_2$ is the barrier, $x_3$ is the inside, and $x_4$ is the outside, if distinguishable; loosely, $x_2$ might be given as the object consisting of both the barrier and the inside.,lujvo,breach,hole,puncture,,,
column40: grekla,$x_1$=$p_1$=$k_1$ passes through portal/generically exits or enters via portal (entrance/exit) $x_2$=$p_2$ to destination side $x_3$=$p_3$=$k_2$ from origin side $x_4$=$p_4$=$k_3$ via route $x_5$=$k_4$ using means/vehicle $x_6$=$k_5$.,$x_5$, in its fullest possible description, must include $x_2$. This word emphasises movement or transportation, usually unidirectional for any given $x_1$ at any given time (not simultaneously bidirectional nor back-and-forth). It is meant to be a generic form of "{nerkla}" and "{barkla}", and is intended to approximate/analogize/extend their veljvo compositions. Aside from the aforementioned emphasis and intent, as well as the terbri, it is quite similar to "{pagre}" itself, although their might be further slight connotational differences (such as the means of passage through the barrier and the type of barrier involved, whether being able to remain on both sides of the barrier statically is within scope of definition (it might be for "pagre" but is not for this word, at least to any significant extent), etc.). $x_2$ is an exit or entrance when generic terminology is desired; a generic word for a portal or doorway (see: "{vorme}") technically is always equivalent, so long as the portal is open and functional, but we often conceptualize exits and entrances (whether unidirectional or bidirectional according to their designs) as being to or from the overall structure (such as a house or vehicle) and not merely internal to it (such as a bedroom or bathroom doorway in a house), and this word is intended to capture this implication more explicitly.,lujvo,enter or exit,exit or enter,pass through,,,
column42: gripau,$p_1$ is a subset of $g_1$.,Mentioned in 18.7 (cll 1.1).,lujvo,subset,,,
column43: gripi'i,$x_1$ is the product (combined multiplication result) of $x_2$ (plurality of the same type as $x_1$),$x_2$ may be {jo'u}/{joi}/{ce'o}/{ce}. See {pilji}, {grisumji},lujvo,product,,,
column44: grisumji,$x_1$ is the sum (combined addition result) of $x_2$ (plurality of the same type as $x_1$),$x_2$ may be {jo'u}/{joi}/{ce'o}/{ce}. See {si'i}, {sumji}, {gripi'i},lujvo,sum,,,
column45: gritezdybi'otei,$x_1 = t_1$ is the elapsed time required for decaying/diminishing/reducing/shrinking population $x_2 = g_1$ to decrease in number by a factor of exactly/approximately $1/e^{(x_3)}$ from that which is considered to be the initial population size, where $e$ is the natural exponential base and $x_3$ [li; default: 1] is a real number, according to standard/under condition/by model/in experiment $x_4$; $x_1$ is the one-$(e^{(x_3)})$-th-life of population/sample $x_2$; the (approximate) $(x_3)$-th one-e-th-ing/e-fold decrease(/increase) of population $x_2$ takes approximately $x_1$ (time).,The experimental gismu {tezda} is used in the veljvo of this word. Many of the veljvo terbri can be derived from those which are present. This word may refer to a duration that is statistical (for large samples, the average time required for half of the population to probably disappear/become invalid), ideal (guaranteed rather than statistical), or experimental (in a given trial, some number was recorded on a stopwatch when the count decreased by half). This word is analogous not only to half-life (default sense) but also to doubling time (if $x_3$ is filled by $-1$). See also: {grixabybi'otei}, {grixonbybi'otei}.,lujvo,e-fold decay time,e-th-life,mean lifetime,one-e-th-life,,,
column46: grixabybi'otei,$x_1 = t_1$ is the elapsed time required for decaying/diminishing/reducing/shrinking population $x_2 = g_1$ to decrease in number by a factor of exactly/approximately half according to standard/under condition/by model/in experiment $x_3$; $x_1$ is the half-life of population/sample $x_2$; the (approximate) halving of population $x_2$ takes approximately $x_1$ (dimensionful number: time).,Many of the veljvo terbri can be derived from those which are present. This word may refer to a duration that is statistical (for large samples, the average time required for half of the population to probably disappear/become invalid), ideal (guaranteed rather than statistical), or experimental (in a given trial, some number was recorded on a stopwatch when the count decreased by half). See also: {gritezdybi'otei}, {grixonbybi'otei}.,lujvo,half-life,,,
column47: grixonbybi'otei,$x_1 = t_1$ is the elapsed time required for decaying/diminishing/reducing/shrinking population $x_2 = g_1$ to decrease in number by a factor of exactly/approximately $1/(x_3)$ from that which is considered to be the initial population size, where $x_3$ [li; default: 1] is a positive real number, according to standard/under condition/by model/in experiment $x_4$; $x_1$ is the $(x_3^{(-1)})$-th-life of population/sample $x_2$; the (approximate) one-$x_3$-th-ing/$(x_3)$-fold decrease(/increase) of population $x_2$ takes approximately $x_1$ (time).,The experimental gismu {xonba} is used in the veljvo of this word. Many of the veljvo terbri of this word can be derived from those which are present. This word may refer to a duration that is statistical (for large samples, the average time required for half of the population to probably disappear/become invalid), ideal (guaranteed rather than statistical), or experimental (in a given trial, some number was recorded on a stopwatch when the count decreased by half). This word is analogous not only to half-life (and means it exactly if $x_3$ is filled by $2$) but also to doubling time (and means it exactly if $x_3$ is filled by $1/2$). See also: {grixabybi'otei}, {gritezdybi'otei}.,lujvo,doubling time,half-life,n-fold change time,nth-life,one-nth-life,one-third-life,tripling time,,,
column48: grumlo,$m_1$ is a grain mill [building] performing process $m_2$.,Cf. {molki}.,lujvo,corn mill,feed mill,feedmill,flour mill,grain mill,grist mill,gristmill,,,
column49: grupesxu,$p_1$ is dough made from grain $g_1$=$p_2$,,lujvo,dough,,,
column50: grupu'o,$p_1$ is flour made of grain plant/species $g_2$.,Cf. {grusko}, {tamxri}, {nanba}, {cmananba}, {titnanba}, {nabzba}.,lujvo,flour,,,
column51: grusko,$s_1$ is a noodle of grain species $g_2$.,Cf. {tamxri}, {grupu'o}.,lujvo,noodle,spaghetti,,,
column52: gruslanu,$x_1$ is a cylindric noodle of grain species $g_2$,See also {grusko}, {tamxri}, {grupu'o}. Also be aware that $x_1$ refers to only one single noodle, consider using {lei} for a bowl of noodles.,lujvo,cylindric noodle,grainish cylinder,,,
column53: grusri,$d_1$ is a noodle (ribbon-shaped) made of $d_2$=$g_1$,See also {grusko}, {grutu'u}, {grudakli}, {grubo'o},lujvo,noodle,,,
column54: grutersro,$t_1$ is a silo for grain/cereal $t_2$=$g_1$,c.f. {cagdaidi'u},lujvo,silo,,,
column55: gruxre,$x_1$ is muesli / mixed cereal dish including ingredients $x_2$.,Usually includes more than just cereals.,lujvo,muesli,,,
column57: gubgundi,$gun_1$=$gub_1$ is a/the public sector owned by community $gub_2$ (mass) providing/producing $gun_2$ by process $gun_3$,From {gubni} {gundi}.,lujvo,nationalized sector,public sector,,,
column58: gubnoi,$g_1$=$n_1$ is an advertisement about subject $n_2$ from author $n_3$ to audience $g_2$=$n_4$.,Cf. {gubni}, {notci}, {vecnu}.,lujvo,ad,advertisement,poster,,,
column59: gubycu'a,$c_1$ votes (in a public election) for $c_2$ among choices $c_3$ in electorate $g_2$.,,lujvo,vote,,,
column60: gubyka'iseltru,$s_1$=$k_3$=$g_1$ is a parliamentary republic with representatives $s_2$=$k_1$ representing community $g_2$=$k_2$ (mass),,lujvo,parliamentary republic,,,
column61: gubypanka,$p_1$=$g_1$ is a public square managed by/belonging to polity/community $p_2$.,Cf. {gubni}, {panka}, {zacpanka}, {zdipanka}, {fanrypanka}, {kagnypanka}.,lujvo,piazza,plaza,public square,,,
column62: gubyseltru,$s_1$=$g_1$ is a republic governed by people $s_2$=$g_2$,,lujvo,republic,,,
column63: gubysizykai,$s_1$=$g_1$ is the reputation of c1 for $c_2$ (ka) known/imagined by $s_2$=$g_2$ (mass),From {gubni} {si'o} {ckaji}.  In English, usually '$x_1$ is the reputation for $x_3$ that $x_2$ has with $x_4$'.,lujvo,fame,reputation,,,
column65: gubytcita,$t_1$=$g_1$ is a sign of $t_2$ showing information $t_3$ to community $g_2$,,lujvo,sign,,,
column66: gubyternoi,$n_3$ publishes about subject $n_2$ with message $n_1$=$g_1$ to intended audience $n_4$.,Cf. {ckupra}, {terkarni}, {kamgubgau}.,lujvo,make public,publicise,,,
column67: gubyxluselsku,$x_1$ (text/sedu'u) is propaganda disseminated by $x_2$ (agent) to audience/community $x_3$ to influence action/state $x_4$,Not necessarily negative; refers to any speech act meant to influence public opinion or behavior.,lujvo,propaganda,,,
column68: gugbandu,$b_1$ defends country $b_2$=$g_1$ from threat/peril/potential $b_3$.,Cf. {jamna}, {damba}, {jenmi}, {bilni}, {sonci}, {tutra}.,lujvo,country defense,defend a country,,,
column69: gugbinselnu'e,$n_2$ is a treaty between countries $n_1$=$n_3$,,lujvo,treaty,,,
column70: gugja'a,$j_1$ is the president of people $g_2$ in country $g_3$.,Cf. {gugde}, {jatna}, {balnoltru}, {vliraitru}, {viptru}, {truralju}, {trupauja'a}, {vajraifla}.,lujvo,president,,,
column71: gugja'anunsnu,$n_1$ is a summit between $j_1$=$c_1$ (heads of state/government) about topic/subject $c_2$.,x2 are usually presidents or prime ministers. x3 are points on an agenda (= snuselpla). Cf. {casnu}.,lujvo,summit,,,
column72: gugjonci'e,$c_1$ is a supranational union of member states $g_1$=$j_1$=$c_3$,,lujvo,supranational union,,,
column73: guglypevgri,$x_1$ is a Google Group for $x_2$ to discuss/talk about subject $x_3$,Syn. {guglyzamgri}. Place structure matches {snustu}.,lujvo,Google Group,,,
column74: guglyzamgri,$x_1$ is a Google Group for $x_2$ to discuss/talk about subject $x_3$,-zam- is the rafsi of {zai'e}, indicating a jargon word, and the divorce of {girzu} from its normal meaning. Place structure based off of {snustu}.,lujvo,Google Group,,,
column75: gugmu'u,$x_1$ migrates to country $x_2$ from country $x_3$ over path/route $x_4$.,,lujvo,emigrate,immigrate,migrate,,,
column76: gugragve,$r_1$ is abroad, located across national border $r_2$, relative to $r_3$ (default: the speaker).,From {gugde} + {ragve}. If /gv/ is ever declared a valid initial consonant sequence, this word will become a {valrtosmabru} (ill-formed word that breaks apart into a {cmavo} and a {lujvo}), and will need to be replaced by {gugdyragve}.,lujvo,abroad,in another country,located abroad,overseas,,,
column77: gugyka'i,$k_1$ is a diplomat/ambassador representing country $k_2$=$g_1$ in matter(s)/function(s) $k_3$.,Cf. {jansu}.,lujvo,ambassador,diplomat,,,
column78: gugypau,$p_1$ is a state/province/region (first-level administrative division) of country $p_2$=$g_1$.,Cf.{gugde}, {pagbu}.  A province or region can also be a second-level administrative division; for these use {gugypausle}.,lujvo,province,,,
column79: gugypausle,$s_1$ is a county/district/parish/province (second-level administrative division) of country $s_2$=$g_1$.,Cf. {gugde}, {pagbu}, {selci}. A province can also be a first-level administrative division; for this use {gugypau}, or optionally {vipygu'e} if it is in a country with a federal government.,lujvo,,,,
column82: gumcatra,$x_1$=$c_1$ (agent) massacres/commits genocide against $x_2$=$c_2$=$g_1$(mass of people) by action/method $x_3$=$c_3$,from {gunma} + {catra},lujvo,massacre,,,
column86: gumgu'e,$gun_1$=$gug_1$ is a federative state consisting of states/lands $gun_2$,,lujvo,federal state,federation,,,
column89: gunbre,$b_1$=$g_1$ is ready for work/labor $g_2$ with goal $g_3$.,Not neccessarily paid work. Cf. {jibybre}.,lujvo,,,,
column90: gunfrivei,$x_1$ is a rsum / cv / curriculum vita, summarizing $x_2$'s work experience, in medium $x_3$.,,lujvo,resume,,,
column91: gungunma,$gunm_1$ is a project consisting of tasks $gunk_2$ done by $gunk_1$ with goal/objective $gunk_3$.,Cf. {gunka}, {gunma}.,lujvo,project,,,
column92: gunrivzu'e,$x_1$=$z_1$=$r_1$=$g_1$ procrastinates/avoids doing work $x_2$=$r_2$=$g_2$ (ka), instead doing $x_3$=$r_3$ (ka).,I figured I'd FINALLY get around to defining this, only for it to be in order to delay doing homework. cf. {zukte}, {rivbi}, {gunka}, {dimna}, {funca}.,lujvo,procrastinate,,,
column93: guntrusi'o,$s_1$ is a communist ideology (default: Marxist-Leninist) as it applies to the governance of  people/territory/domain $t_2$ based on the works of thinker(s) $s_3$,From {gunka}, {turni}, {sidbo}. Cf. {trudjigri}, {ka'irtrusi'o}, {dzejdasratrusi'o}, {vricykricrutrusi'o}, {fairpaltrusi'o}, {natpamtrusi'o}, {tsarainaitrusi'o}.,lujvo,communism,Marxism,Marxist-Leninist ideology,,,
column94: gurgau,$x_1$=$ga_1$ rolls object $x_2$=$gu_1$ on/against surface $x_3$=$gu_2$, with axis/ axle of rotation $x_4$=$gu_3$.,See also {gunro}, {gasnu}, {cu'arkubli}.,lujvo,roll,roll,,,
column95: gurmu'a,$m_1$=$g_1$ is a jalousie for covering $m_2$, made of material $m_3$.,,lujvo,jalousie,,,
column96: gurmu'u,$x_1$ rolls (moves via rolling) to destination $x_2$ from origin $x_3$ over path $x_4$,See {gunro}, {muvdu},lujvo,roll,,,
column97: gusfarborcne,$g_1$=$f_2$=$c_1$ is light/illumination that is refracted by amount/degree $c_3$ from origin/frame of reference $f_3$ by refracting medium $c_4$,From {gusni} {farna} {bo} {cenba}.,lujvo,refraction,refracts,,,
column100: gusli'i,$x1$=$l1$ is a ray/beam/[line of light] illuminating $x2$=$g2$ from source $x3$=$g3$,,lujvo,beam,ray,,,
column101: gusminli,$x_1$ is $x_2$ (default 1) light year(s) by standard $x_3$.,Cf. {gusni}, {minli}, {solminli}, {tanminli}, {ki'otre}, {darno}.,lujvo,light year,,,
column102: gusminra,$m_1$=$g_2$ is shiny/gleaming/bright/reflective of light $g_1$=$m_2$ from source $g_3$,,lujvo,bright,gleaming,reflective,shiny,,,
column103: gusnunsla,$n_1$ is Diwali (Deepavali) celebrated by $s_1$ with activities $s_3$,from {gusni} {nu} {salci},lujvo,Deepavali,Diwali,,,
column105: gusybatke,$b_1$ is a light switch which is on $b_2$ and made from material $b_4$ and controlling the light source $g_3$.,In this definition all kinds of light switch is included, not only simple on/off switchs but also dimmers, for example. See also {gusni} and {batke}.,lujvo,light switch,,,
column107: gusycai,$x_{1}$ gleams/shines on to $x_{2}$, the light source being $x_{3}$.,Cf. {gusni}, {carmi}, {gusminra}.,lujvo,gleam,shine,,,
column108: gusycinki,$x_1$ is a lightning bug/glowworm/firefly of genus/species $x_2$.,,lujvo,firefly,glowworm,lightning bug,,,
column109: gusydicra,$d_1$ extinguishes light $g_1$ illuminating $g_2$, the light source being $g_3$.,Cf. {gusni}, {dicra}.,lujvo,douse a light,extinguish a light,put out a light,,,
column110: gusygutci,$x_1$ is $x_2$ (li; default: 1) light-seconds by standard $x_3$.,See also: "{gusminli}".,lujvo,light-second,,,
column111: gusyjinru,$x_1$ basks in light $x_2$.,(i.e. $x_1$ is oriented so that much of its surface is hit by light $x_2$.),lujvo,,,,
column113: gusyzi'u,$z_1$ is violet (distinct light-wave) [color adjective].,Created to distinguish between purple as a mental construct and violet as a place on the physical color spectrum. See {menzi'u}.,lujvo,violet,,,
column114: gutnerkla,$x_1$ (agent) invades $x_2$ (place) for objective $x_3$,$klama_3$ through $klama_5$ dropped for being usually irrelevant to this concept; if need be they can be replaced with {teka'a}/{veka'a}/{xeka'a} or {ra'i}/{pu'ai}/{sepi'o}. See {zernerkla}, {gunta}, {nerkla},lujvo,invade,,,
column115: gugyl zei zamgri,$x_1$ is a Google Group for $x_2$ to discuss/talk about subject $x_3$,Syn. {guglyzamgri}. Place structure matches {snustu}.,zei-lujvo,Google Group,,,
column116: gunro zei uidje,$u_1$ is a scrollbar in user interface $u_2$.,See also: Widget (={uidje}).,zei-lujvo,scroll bar,scrollbar,,,
column117: gu'irnilcarmrmagnitu,$x_1$ is emitted/reflected light that measures to be $x_2$ magnitudes in luminous brightness, on scale (si'o)/using reference value/under system/according to definition $x_3$, in logarithmic base $x_4$ (default: decimal (10)),Wavelength is specified in x1; it is improper to submit an object as the sumti for x1. The type of magnitude (absolute, apparent, etc.) must be specified by tanru or lujvo. x2 must be a pure number (dimensionless). x3 should specify a reference emission and the associated reference value in magnitudes, the meaning of a change by 1 magnitude, and the direction of increasing brightness (traditionally: toward negative infinity); magnitude is defined for all real numbers. See also: {cmagnitude}.,fu'ivla,magnitude,gu'irnilcarmrmagnitu,,
column118: gulrota,$x_1$ is a carrot of species / variety / cultivar $x_2$,See also {genja}.,fu'ivla,,gulrota,,
column119: gunmace,$x_1$ is a mass/group consisting of elements $x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$, etc.,See {gunma}, {joi}, {porsice}, {setmice}, {menrece},fu'ivla,group,gunmace,,
column120: guntrkamikaze,$x_1$ performs a kamikaze attack [suicidal attack] on $x_2$ with goal/objective $x_3$.,Broad sense, for any kind of suicidal attack. Cf. {gunta}, {nunrkamikaze}.,fu'ivla,perform kamikaze attack,guntrkamikaze,,
column121: gu'i'a'a,logical connective: tanru-internal forethought always false (with gi).,Created to complete the scope of truth tables to include TTTT and FFFF, despite being described as relatively useless. Etymology: gu'a + jitfa + A.,experimental cmavo,Always False,,,,GUhA
column122: gu'o nai,logical connective: tanru-internal forethought exclusive or (with gi); Latin 'aut'.,,cmavo-compound,fore tanru xor,,,,GUhA*
column123: guonJAuS,Canton,Based on the local Cantomese pronunciation. For the name based on the  Chinese Mandarin pronunciation see {guanJOUS}.,obsolete cmevla,Canton,Guangzhou,,,
column124: guzme,$x_{1}$ is a melon/squash [fruit/plant] of species/strain $x_{2}$.,See also {grute}.,gismu,melon,guz,zme,guzm,guzme,,
column125: gu'u,logical connective: tanru-internal forethought whether-or-not (with gi).,,cmavo,fore tanru whether,,,,GUhA
column127: i,sentence link/continuation; continuing sentences on same topic; normally elided for new speakers.,,cmavo,sentence link,,,,I

column7: itku'ilybau,$x_1$ is Ithkuil (language), used by $x_2$ to communicate $x_3$ (du'u/si'o),See {itku'ile}, {bangu},lujvo,Ithkuil,,,
column8: ja'arkemnatsydo'oborgu'e,$j_1$ is the Fhrer/leader of Nazi Germany, which is the country of peoples $g_2$ with land/territory $g_3$.,,lujvo,Fuhrer,Fhrer,,,
column9: gradrgu zei rinka zei sojnalsanji,$x_1$ experiences g-LoC / g-force-induced loss of consciousness.,,zei-lujvo,g-force-induced loss of consciousness,g-LOC,,,
column10: gregori zei nanca,$n_1$ is $n_2$ years in duration by the Gregorian calendar.,Cf. {detrgregori}, {gregori zei ctona'a}.,zei-lujvo,AD,BC,BCE,CE,,,
column11: greku zei uidje,$u_1$=$g_1$ is a frame enclosing widget(s) $g_2$ in user interface $u_2$,See {uidje}.,zei-lujvo,frame,,,
column12: gribatke zei uidje,$u_1$ is a radio button, part of radio button group $g_1$, in user interface $u_2$.,See also: {jetnu zei uidje}, {uidje}.,zei-lujvo,radio button,,,
column13: gu'ek zei uanta,$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'guhek' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.,Inner structure of the rule: SE? GUhA NAI? #. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.,zei-lujvo,,,,
column14: gy zei sance,$x_1$ is a voiced velar stop sound produced by $x_2$.,Synonym: {gasnce}.,zei-lujvo,G sound,voiced velar plosive,voiced velar stop,voiced velar stop sound,,,
column15: i bu zei sance,$x_1$ is a close front unrounded vowel sound produced by $x_2$.,Synonyms: {isnce}, {isna}.,zei-lujvo,close front unrounded vowel,close front unrounded vowel sound,high front unrounded vowel,I sound,,,
column16: i bu zei zunsna,$x_1$ is a voiced palatal approximant/glide sound produced by $x_2$.,{zi'evla} synonym: {iasnce}. Cf. {ibu zei sance}/{isnce}/{isna}, {ubu zei zunsna}, {zunsna}, {nalmosysna}.,zei-lujvo,voiced palatal approximant,voiced palatal approximant sound,voiced palatal glide,voiced palatal glide sound,,,
column17: iu zei tcitygau,$x_1=g_1=x_{iu}$ "likes"/"loves"/"hearts" (marks with a positive feedback label, e.g. on social media) content $x_2$=$t_2$.,,zei-lujvo,,,,
column18: glauka,$x_1$ is an owl of species $x_2$.,see also {cipni}, {cipnrstrigi}, {cipnrtito},fu'ivla,owl,glauka,,
column19: glaupa,$x_1$ gallops,See {bajra}, {xirma},fu'ivla,gallop,glaupa,,
column20: glefino,$x_1$ is a haddock of subspecies $x_2$,See also {fiprgado}, {merlanu}, {merluci}.,fu'ivla,haddock,glefino,,
column21: gleiba,$x_1$ would be happy to discover that $x_2$ is the case.,See also: {pacna}.,fu'ivla,,gleiba,,
column22: gleua,$x_1$ gives $x_2$ (li) fucks about $x_3$.,A smaller x2 means less caring. Use of vague numbers is obviously permitted. (Why not?) "Barely give a shit" (= "gleua li so'u") "Doesn't give a fuck" (= "gleua li no"). Numbers can be made to lujvo with this to create pseudo-words meaning "to give no fucks" (= "no zei gleua"). Of course, this word can be used positively (= "gleua li so'e") to mean something like "I care a great deal!",fu'ivla,fuck,gleua,,
column23: glexaso,$x_1$ have simultaneous mutual oral sex,Of course, you can write "glexaso" as "gle69".,fu'ivla,oral sex,sixty-nine,glexaso,,
column24: glibepefeke,$x_1$ pertains to BPFK English in aspect $x_2$,,fu'ivla,BPFK English,glibepefeke,,
column25: glokesi,$x_1$ is a glockenspiel with playing range $x_2$, of material $x_3$,See also {virbafo}, {skilofo}, {marmiba}.,fu'ivla,glockenspiel,glokesi,,
column26: glumamela,$x_1$ is hibiscus of species/variety $x_2$.,Cf. {karkade}; Tagalog "gumamela",fu'ivla,,glumamela,,
column27: goilbi'o,$x_1$ (goilka'i variable) changes value to now represent $x_2$,See {goilka'i}, {goilgau},fu'ivla,change value,goilbi'o,,
column28: goilgau,$x_1$ makes variable $x_2$ (text / virtual-text-object) represent $x_3$ ; $x_1$ assigns $x_3$ to $x_2$,$x_2$ = {goilka'i}1, $x_3$ = {goilka'i}2. See {snigau}, {smudu'a},fu'ivla,assign,goilgau,,
column29: goilka'i,$x_1$ (text / virtual-text-object) is a variable representing $x_2$,{goi} is a special case that makes, e.g. {zo} {ko'a}, a {goilka'i} of something. However the main use of this brivla is to allow {ko'a} itself, or something like {la .strin.}, to be a virtual "text" standing in for some object, while {la'e} is used to extract the referent from it. This allows propositions to be truth-conditional on what a variable represents at that point of time, rather than conditional on the referent itself. See {sumka'i}, {goilgau}, {goilbi'o}, {krati}.,fu'ivla,variable,goilka'i,,

column104: gu'ai,binary operator: left group action $g.x$,a.b = (a,b), where a is the group element and b is an element of the set. The type/description/label/name may be subscripted or denoted by function notation, as might be the group to which it belongs and/or the set upon which it acts (typically, the label should denote in the order: group, set, descriptor). column107: guanJOUS,Guangzhou,Based on the Chinese Mandarin pronunciation. For the name based on the  local Cantonese pronunciation see {guonJAUS}.,obsolete cmevla,Guangzhou,,,
column109: gubmace,$x_1$ is a public transit system serving $x_2$ and offering services $x_3$ (ka).,This is a zi'evla derived from the lujvo {gubma'eci'e}, from {gubni} {marce} and {ciste} (public vehicle system). The x2 can be used to specify a geographical region, a target demongraphic, etc. The x3 is used to specify properties enabled to passengers of the system, and can be used with {tu'a} to very broadly identify stations ({tcana}) in the network, types of vehicles (subways/trains/light rail {trene}, buses {sorpeka}, etc.), and concrete bus lines.,fu'ivla,bus network,public transit,subway,gubmace,,

column118: go'ai,last bridi (with its modifiers),Repeats the immediately preceding bridi as "{go'i}" does but with all of the modifiers made in the same, particularly negations/affirmations, excluding "{xu}". All referents remain the same unless they are explicitly changed or restated, or the word "{ra'o}" is used. If the previous bridi (say, a true-false question) were phrased in the negative, then this word would answer in the negative (whereas "go'i" would answer in the positive), and "{nago'ai}" would answer in the affirmative (whereas "nago'i" would answer in the negative). This word nontrivially couples with "{nei'ai}" in the case of the referent bridi being phrased negatively. Subscripting this word with an integer n causes the referent sentence to be earlier than the current bridi by exactly a count of n; n = 0 implies reference to the current bridi, n = +1 implies reference to the immediately preceding bridi (this is the default), n = -1 implies reference to the immediately subsequent bridi, n > 0 implies reference to some previously uttered bridi, n < 0 implies reference to some future bridi.,experimental cmavo,last bridi (with its modifiers),,,,GOhA
column119: go'au,marks the tagged sumti as being scope-wide within the immediate parent (text-wide by default) specified in the argument of the vocative,'{go'au} {do'u}' is an in-thought in-place way to specify global constants or variables as opposed to forethought ways.,experimental cmavo,global variable,,,,COI2
column120: goi'e,assign sentence or tu'e...tu'u group to sumti,Works like {cei'e}, but assigns the abstraction involving the associated sentence(s) to a sumti variable. E.g. (goi'e ko'a mi tavla do) assigns (lo su'u mi tavla do) to {ko'a}. Use {lu'e} on the assigned variable to refer to the text itself. See {goi}, {cei},experimental cmavo,assign sentence to sumti,,,,COI3
column121: go'i ra'o,pro-bridi: preceding bridi; repeats claim as true, updating for speaker/listener change.,,cmavo-compound,true for me too,,,,GOhA*
column122: go nai,logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal exclusive or (with gi); Latin 'aut'.,,cmavo-compound,fore xor,,,,GA*

column124: gordiio,$x_1$ is a loophole or 'thinking outside the box' solution to an intractable problem $x_2$; $x_1$ is disentangling 'impossible' knot; $x_2$ is solved by 'cutting the Gordian knot',See also {danfu}, {ermenefti}.,fu'ivla,,gordiio,,
column125: gorguni,$x_1$ is an orc of tribe/breed $x_2$,synonym {orxo},fu'ivla,orc,orch,gorguni,,
column126: gradrgu,$x_1$ measures to be equal to $x_2$ (li; default: 1) g of acceleration according to standard $x_3$ (default is as in notes).,Non-SI unit of acceleration. $x_1$ should be an acceleration (and not, for example, directly an object). $x_3$ is, by default, the local value of acceleration due to gravity on Earth's surface, and is conventionally defined to be exactly $9.80665$ m/s$^2$ as of 2023-02-28.,fu'ivla,g,g-force,the unit g,gradrgu,,
column127: grafetu,$x_1$ is the graph on vertices/nodes $x_2$ (set) and edges $x_3$ (set of ordered or unordered tuples of vertices in $x_2$) and with additional properties $x_4$.,A "web"/"network". An element of x2 is a "place" in a more generic/abstract/metaphoric sense than spatial; must be discrete. Thus, webpages, family diagrams, lattices, pages in a book, cities and roadways on a map, etc. constitute graphs. x1 also includes trees. Notice that both x2 and x3 are sets; an element of x3 is an ordered pair/2-tuple, but the order does not matter unless x1 is oriented, in which case the edge runs from the first node in the tuple to the second node in the tuple. x4 can include defining features, weights, etc. Equivalent to {grafu} (which is merely the gismu form of this word); very similar to {tcana}.,fu'ivla,edge of graph,graph,network,node,web,grafetu,,
column128: grafnseljimca,$x_1$ is a tree graph on nodes $x_2$ (set of points), with edges $x_3$ (set of ordered or unordered 2-tuples), with additional properties $x_4$.,A graph with no cycles. The classifier rafsi of this word comes from the experimental gismu "{grafu}".,fu'ivla,tree diagram,tree graph,grafnseljimca,,
column129: grafnseljimcnkipliiu,$x_1$ is a 'quipyew' tree graph with special node $x_2$, on nodes $x_3$ (set of points; includes $x_2$), with edges $x_4$ (set of ordered pairs of nodes), and with other properties $x_5$.,Such a graph is the essence of a biological family tree along (for example) the matrilineal line if one selects a special individual, reduces all other individuals in the tree according to their relation to the first while ignoring gender (so, the various other branches are folded along the ancestral line of the selected individual, which is taken to be the stem, and all overlapping nodes are made equivalent; in other words, all non-ancestral or non-self nodes of the selected indivodual, are contracted via siblinghood (all siblings are counted the same) at the leaves and then similar contractions sequentially occur up the tree); in other words, all non-self siblings are the same, all non-self parents are the same, all non-self ith cousins j-times removed are the same (for each i and j), all aunts and uncles are the same, all kth-great-grandparents are the same (for each k>1), all non-self children are the same, all lth-great-grandchildren are the same (for each l>1), etc. A quipyew tree graph (terminology invented by .krtisfranks.) is defined as follows: Define an ordered relation R on a collection of points (which will become $x_3$) such that R is ordered, nonreflexive for any point, nonsymmetric for any pair of points, nontransitive for any pair of ordered pairs of points (this requirement is guaranteed by the next condition), and generates a tree on the nodes (with the edges being ordered pairs of points which satisfy R). For any tree-generating ordered relation S: if x S y, then x is a parent of y and y is a child of x; if x S y and y S z, then x is an ancestor of z and z is a descendant of x; "x is a non-self parent of y" means that x S y and $x \neq y$, and likewise for the other relations just described when modified by the descriptor "non-self". A quipyew tree T is a directed tree graph generated by the reflexive closure of R, such that T is totally connected (in the symmetric closure of R), every node in the vertex set ($x_3$) of T has at most two non-self children and at most one non-self parent, and there exists exactly one special node $x_2$ (usually denoted "0") in the vertex set of T with the property that for any node n in the vertex set of T, n has two non-self children only if (but not necessarily if) n is a strict ancestor of $x_2$ according to the transitive closure of R. See also: {grafmseljimca}, {tseingu}, {takni}.,fu'ivla,quipyew tree graph,grafnseljimcnkipliiu,,

column139: graumrei,$x_1$ is $x_2$ (li; default: 1) dimensionless units on scale/by standard $x_3$.,This word follows the tradition of {grake} and {mitre} etc. except it is for the empty/trivial unit (something having dimensionality of '1'). This is not the same as the dimension itself, which is still {li} {pa}; just as the dimension of a quantity of meters is length/displacement.,fu'ivla,dimensionless unit,empty unit,trivial unit,graumrei,,
column140: gravnutnoia,$x_1$ is Newton's constant of universal gravitation/G/big G [approximately equal to: $6.6710^(11)$ $N(m/kg)^2$ ] expressed in units $x_2$ (default: unitless/dimensionless and equal to 1) in paradigm/system/metaphysics/universe $x_3$ (default: this, our actual, physical universe),See also: {plankexu}, {tcelerita}, {boltsemaku}, {avgadro}, {ocnerta}.,fu'ivla,6.6710^(11) N(m/kg)^2,big G,constant of universal gravitation,gravitational constant G,Newton's constant,gravnutnoia,,
