column149: grosela,$x_1$ is a currant of species/variety $x_2$,See {spati}, {jbari}, {grosela},fu'ivla,currant,grosela,,
column150: grosulari,$x_1$ is a gooseberry (Ribes uva-crispa, Ribes grossularia) of variety $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,grosulari,,
column151: grudjarati,$x_1$ pertains to Gujarati language in aspect $x_2$,,fu'ivla,Gujarati,grudjarati,,
column155: guzmrkukurbita,$x_1$ is a squash/pumpkin of species/strain $x_2$.,Cf. {guzme}, {clazme}, {tityzme}.,fu'ivla,pumpkin,squash,guzmrkukurbita,,
column156: guzmrmakuua,$x_1$ is Korean melon/Oriental melon/Cucumis melo var. Makuwa of type/variety $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,guzmrmakuua,,
column157: guzrmetuliferu,$x_1$ is a kiwano/African horned cucumber/jelly melon (Cucumis metuliferus) of subspecies/cultivar/type $x_2$,,fu'ivla,African horned cucumber,jelly melon,kiwano,guzrmetuliferu,,
column160: iamnaio,$x_1$ reflects/pertains to the Yamnaya people/culture in aspect $x_2$,,fu'ivla,Yamnaya,iamnaio,,
column161: iamsa,$x_1$ is a yam of species $x_2$,{samcu} is a more generic term,fu'ivla,,iamsa,,
column162: iancu,$x_1$ should or ought to do $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,iancu,,
column163: iangona,$x_1$ is kava of variety $x_2$,May refer to the plant, root, or drink. See also {spatrpiperi}.,fu'ivla,,iangona,,
column164: ianlaua,$x_1$ is $x_2$'s guide / mentor / boss / leader / ruler.,See {gidva}, {jatna}, {jitro}, {turni}.,fu'ivla,,ianlaua,,
column165: iarda,$x_1$ is measured in $x_2$ (default 1) yards (US customary unit),See {zmaile}, {sfu'utu}, {inci}, {gutci},fu'ivla,yard,iarda,,
column166: iartsagunbu,$x_1$ is a yartsa gunbu (Ophiocordyceps) of species/variety $x_2$,Commonly called Cordyceps, but genetic testing shows that it belongs to a different family.,fu'ivla,yartsa gunbu,iartsagunbu,,
column167: iasnce,$x_1$ is a voiced palatal approximant sound produced by $x_2$.,Synonym: {ibu zei zunsna}. Cf. {isnce}/{isna}/{ibu zei sance}, {uasnce}/{ubu zei zunsna}, {zunsna}, {nalmosysna},fu'ivla,voiced palatal approximant,voiced palatal approximant sound,voiced palatal glide,voiced palatal glide sound,iasnce,,
column168: ibli,If $x_1$ has the property $x_3$, then $x_2$ also has it; $x_1$ having property $x_3$ necessitates $x_2$ having that property,See {nibli}.,fu'ivla,,ibli,,
column169: ibri,$x_1$'s job/occupation is to satisfy property $x_2$.,Synonym: {seljibri}.,fu'ivla,,ibri,,
column170: icki,$x_1$ rearranges/shifts/shuffles the deck chairs on the Titanic/is bikeshedding, with action $x_2$, which is pointless by standard $x_3$ for fixing problem $x_4$.,To do something pointless when there are bigger problems, such as rearranging the deck chairs on the sinking Titanic or discussing what materials to build a bikeshed out of when approving plans for a nuclear power plant.,fu'ivla,bikeshedding,rearrange the deck chairs on the Titanic,shift the deck chairs on the Titanic,shuffle the deck chairs on the Titanic,icki,,
column171: icmo,$x_1$ moans expressing about $x_3$ emotions/cognitive [psychological] phenomena that can be otherwise expressed by indicators $x_2$ (text),See also {inmo}, {cmoni}. 'icmo li ii' is 'to shriek about'.,fu'ivla,,icmo,,
column172: icra,$x_1$ (event) interrupts/stops/halts, temporarily ceasing to happen or unfold.,,fu'ivla,,icra,,
column173: ictce,$x_{1}$ reflects the Prehistoric China culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.,,fu'ivla,Prehistoric China,ictce,,
column174: idra,$x_1$ is a hydra of species $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,idra,,
column176: ieinki,$x_1$ is a Yank(ee); $x_1$ displays Yankee culture/history in aspect $x_2$ according to $x_3$,Not necessarily pejorative, but probably fairly colloquial. It has the same semantic ambiguity as in English: it may refer to an American or something exhibiting American characteristics (especially a thoroughly patriotic American spirit), America as a colonial power, or a Unionist, or something pertaining/belonging to the northern states (or even more specifically, New England). See also: {merko}.,fu'ivla,Yankee,ieinki,,
column178: ientrau,$x_{1}$ reflects the Yuan Dynasty culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.,,fu'ivla,Yuan,Yuan Dynasty,ientrau,,
column179: ierbamate,$x_1$ is mat/yerba mate (plant) of cultivar $x_2$,Refers to the plant itself; for the drink prepared therefrom, use {ierbamate} {tcati}. See also {tcati}, {ckafi}, {spati}.,fu'ivla,mat,yerba mate,ierbamate,,
column180: ierbamatei,$x_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of yerba mat drink brewed from leaves $x_2$,,fu'ivla,mat,yerba mat,ierbamatei,,
column181: iagis,Yagi.,One of the inventors of the Yagi-Uda antenna; or the name of the antenna itself,cmevla,Yagi,,,
column186: gu'y,predicate modifier: convert x1 to a mereological sum composed of x1.,See also {unma}.,experimental cmavo,,,,,NAhE
column187: i'a'a,logical connective: sumti afterthought always false.,Created to complete the scope of truth tables to include TTTT and FFFF, despite being described as relatively useless. Etymology: jitfa + A.,experimental cmavo,Always False,,,,A

column2: i'a nai,attitudinal:
ia nai,attitudinal:

iaves,Yahweh.,see also {cev},cmevla,Yahweh,YHWH,,,
column3: i'au,reset bridi-level to zero,Auto-inserts all necessary terminators to reset to the top-level bridi of the sentence (i.e. everything that {i} would insert except the last {vau}). This is useful if you have opened multiple NU/NOI subclauses, and just want to close them all to add more sumti, terms, or a {xoi} clause to the main bridi without using a bunch of terminators. // May also be used with UI-cmavo. UI-cmavo placed immediately after {i'au} would scope over the entire sentence. This is useful for attaching attitudinals as afterthoughts, without having to close the entire sentence manually with the right number of {vau}s. See {ji'au}, {fu'e}, {fu'o}.,experimental cmavo,reset bridi-level to zero,,,,IhAU
column4: ia'u,attitudinal:

column1: {ia'unai} - distrust,Used to express trust (as in trustworthiness). Based on {lacri}.,experimental cmavo,trusting,,,,UI1
column2: iau,reset bridi-level to zero,Shortened variant of {i'au}.,experimental cmavo,,,,,IhAU
column3: i bu,letteral for i.,,bu-letteral,i,,,,BY*
column4: i'e cu'i,attitudinal:

column2: ie'e,attitudinal:

column1: {ie'enai} - unreasonable,Expresses the sentiment of, "I can get why it'd be this way", or "that seems like an understandable way to act/feel/behave".  (Or, with {nai}, its opposite: the feeling that some situation or behavior is totally unreasonable / senseless / irrational.),experimental cmavo,,,,,UI1
column2: ie'i,attitudinal:

column1: {ie'inai} - attraction,Expresses disgust (loathing, revulsion). Based on {rigni}, its opposite is {trina} (attraction, liking). To be used instead of the "disgust"/repulsion of {a'unai} for any kind of disgust whose opposite is not {cinri}, but trina.,experimental cmavo,disgust,,,,UI1
column2: i'e nai,attitudinal:
ie nai,attitudinal:

ietnu,$x_1$ is true, is the case.,,fu'ivla,true,ietnu,,
column3: ie'udji,$x_1$ reflects Jewish/Judean/Judahite religion/culture/ethnicity in aspect $x_2$,The translation depends on the historical period. See also {xebro}, {fraimi}, {ckenazi}, {sfaradi}, {cmoroni}.,fu'ivla,Jewish,Judahite,Judean,ie'udji,,
column4: ie'udjo,$x_1$ reflects Jewish/Judean/Judahite religion/culture/ethnicity in aspect $x_2$,,fu'ivla,Jewish,ie'udjo,,
column5: ifkakne,$x_1$ is passively $x_2$-able under conditions $x_3$; $x_1$ is such that event $x_2$ (nu) can happen to it; it is possible that  $x_1$ may undergo $x_2$,$x_1$ does not perform any action; rather it can have actions performed to it.,fu'ivla,-able,ifkakne,,
column6: ifle,if $x_1$ (proposition) is true then $x_2$ (event) happens else $x_3$ (event) happens,Alternatively, $x_2$ and $x_3$ may be propositions that are true rather than events that happen. See {ga}{nai}, {jetnu}, {va'o},fu'ivla,if-else construct,ifle,fi'ei,te fi'ei,
column7: ifletnu,If $x_1$ (proposition) is true, then $x_2$ (proposition) is logically guaranteed to be true too, and $x_1$ is indeed true.,Valid and sound.,fu'ivla,modus ponens statement,satisfied IF,sound IF,ifletnu,,
column8: ifti,$x_1$ is near and can be pointed to (or described as being pointed to) by the speaker,See {ti}, {afta}, {uftu}, {degja'o},fu'ivla,,ifti,,
column9: iglu,$x_1$ is an igloo,See also {dinju}, {bisli}, {bangiku'u}, {bangikutu}, {bangiku'e},fu'ivla,igloo,iglu,,
column10: igvana,$x_1$ is an iguana of species $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,igvana,,
column11: iicmo,$x_1$ screams/shrieks in fear with sound $x_2$,See {ii}, {cmoni}, {terpa},fu'ivla,scream,shriek,iicmo,,
column12: iitfa,$x_1$ is false.,,fu'ivla,false,iitfa,,
column13: iizme,$x_1$ is a doctrine/theory/system/philosophy/practice/action/habit/mindset/ism characterized by belief/tendency/action/idea $x_2$ (abstraction), and incidentally is practiced by $x_3$ (and possibly others).,Not necessarily derogatory. "Materialism" (any sense) is a type of ism as much as racism, whataboutism, or Trumpism is. This word is meant to be a calque of the English word "ism". Closely related to ".{ismo}".,fu'ivla,ism,iizme,,
column14: i'izva,$x_1$ hang out doing $x_2$ (ka),The property x2 is a property of the individuals in x1 that are hanging out. This word suggests that the activity involves casual socializing among the members of x1.,fu'ivla,hang out,i'izva,,
column15: iklkitu,$x_1$ secondary-clicks (right-clicks, presses and holds) $x_2$ (UI element),See {iklki}, {uidje},fu'ivla,,iklkitu,,
column16: ilkai,$x_1$ (number) is what $x_2$ (string) represents,Predicate version of {li},fu'ivla,,ilkai,,
column17: ilka'u,$x_1$ (plural) is such that $x_2$ (number) of its members satisfy the property $x_3$,Possibly synonymous with {zilkancu}. See also {kaidza}, {kampu}, {nartolkau}, {kancu}.,fu'ivla,counting quantification,ilka'u,,
column18: ilmismu,$x_1$ is an ismu of $x_2$, having the same meaning, but with all places except the $x_3$-th (li/set) zi'o-deleted.,For example, "zo .{inku} .ilmismu zo {jinku} li pa": {inku} is {jinku} with only the x1. Named after la .ilmen, who pioneered defining such words. See {ismu}.,fu'ivla,,ilmismu,,
column19: imla,$x_1$ is {mi} / me / the speaker, in {selsku} / message / situation $x_2$.,See {odla},fu'ivla,me,the speaker,imla,,
column20: imperative,$x_1$ has an intention to influence the behavior of $x_2$, to command, control $x_2$,{zo} {ko} {valsi} {lo} {zu'e} {imperative} - '{ko} is a word expressing imperative action',fu'ivla,,imperative,,
column21: impetu,$x_1$ is the momentum [vector] of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$,$x_1$ can be a vector, e.g. four-vector. Might be pretty general in its semantic scope ("quantity of movement"); at the very least includes both Relativistic (four-vector) and Newtonian (three-vector) momentum (resp.: {nejnimpetu}, {sirmpetu}); might also encompass angular momentum ({cnampetu}, typically three-vector). See also {nejni}, {nejnimpetu}, {sirmpetu}, {ocnerta}, {tcelerita}, {cnampetu},fu'ivla,linear momentum,momentum,quantity of movement,impetu,,
column22: impofu,$x_1$ is an eland of species $x_2$,,fu'ivla,eland,impofu,,
column23: imposta,$x_1$ is an impostor, pretender; $x_1$ engages in deception under an assumed name or identity $x_2$.,See {jifkritrazu'e}, {tcica}, {cmene}, {sevzi},fu'ivla,imposter,impostor,pretend,pretender,imposta,,
column24: imxu,$x_1$ and $x_2$ do $x_3$ (binary ka) to each other.,Equivalent to x1 {ce} x2 {simxu} x3, but useful for some lujvo.,fu'ivla,,imxu,,
column25: inbri,$x_1$ (proposition) is a clause expressing adverbial relation $x_2$ (property of nonce place, has places for ce'u referring to members of $x_3$) and connecting members of $x_3$ (ordered group),The first member of $x_3$ is what follows after the adposition expressing adverbial relation $x_2$. The second member of $x_3$ can sometimes be called 'noun phrase of adposition'; it can e.g. be the current clause ({lo} {bridi}), $x_1$ of it, $x_2$ of it etc. See also {bridi}, {sumti}, {sumtcita}.,fu'ivla,clause expressed via adverbial,inbri,,
column26: inbrisni,$x_1$ (text) is a clause with adverbial $x_2$ (text) and connecting members of $x_3$ (ordered group of text),The first member of $x_3$ is usually called 'complement' or 'argument'; it is what comes after the adposition $x_2$. The second member of $x_3$ can sometimes be called 'noun phrase of adposition'; it can e.g. be the current clause ({lo} {brisni}), $x_1$ of it, $x_2$ of it etc. See also {brisni}, {sumti}, {sumtcita}.,fu'ivla,,inbrisni,,
column27: inci,$x_1$ is measured in $x_2$ (default 1) inches (US customary unit),See {zmaile}, {iarda}, {sfu'utu}, {gutci},fu'ivla,inch,inci,,
column28: inda,$x_1$ deserves / merits / is worthy of $x_2$ (property of $x_1$),See also {jerna}.,fu'ivla,deserve,merit,worthy,inda,,
column29: indigena,$x_1$ is indigenous to territory $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,indigena,,
column30: indika,$x_1$ (event/state) implies / suggests / is circumstantial evidence for $x_2$ (du'u); the probability that $x_2$ is true, given $x_1$, is greater than the probability without $x_1$,Similar to {nibli}, but merely means circumstantial/forensic, not logical, evidence, that may be contradicted by other circumstantial evidences or interpretations. See also {krinu}, {lakne}, {didni}, {nusna}, {tolna'e},fu'ivla,evidence,imply,indicate,suggest,indika,,
column31: indo,$x_1$ reflects/pertains to the regions which are approximated by the Indian subcontinent, or cultures vel sim. thereof, in aspect $x_2$.,This does not necessarily recognize political divisions or inclusions of such region. Can be used in a human-historical context. The Indian Ocean may be included in this designation.,fu'ivla,Indian,indo,,
column32: ii'au,attitudinal: yee-haw!,u'ivla. See also: {a'oi}, {o'ai}, {ni'au}, {mi'au}.,experimental cmavo,,,,,UI
column33: i'i nai,attitudinal:

column2: ii nai,attitudinal:

iinsi,$x_1$ (sequence) is a chain, the neighbouring elements of which are related by $x_2$ ($ckini_3$, former element in sequence first),cf. {linsi}, {ckini}, {efku},fu'ivla,,iinsi,,
column3: i ja,logical connective: sentence afterthought or.,,cmavo-compound,sentence or,,,,JA*
column4: i ja nai,logical connective: sentence afterthought: (preceding sentence) if this sentence.,,cmavo-compound,sentence if,,,,JA*
column5: i je,logical connective: sentence afterthought and.,,cmavo-compound,sentence and,,,,JA*
column6: i je'i,logical connective: sentence afterthought conn question.,,cmavo-compound,sentence conn ?,,,,JA*
column7: i je nai,logical connective: sentence afterthought x but not y.,,cmavo-compound,sentence but not,,,,JA*
column8: i jo,logical connective: sentence afterthought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if.,,cmavo-compound,sentence iff,,,,JA*
column9: i jo nai,logical connective: sentence afterthought exclusive or; Latin 'aut'.,,cmavo-compound,sentence xor,,,,JA*
column10: i ju,logical connective: sentence afterthought whether-or-not.,,cmavo-compound,sentence whether,,,,JA*
column11: ikfiio,$x_1$ is a icthyosaur [member of order Ichthyosauria] of subtaxon/type/genus/species/variety/breed $x_2$.,See also: {dinso}, {dinsauru}, {plesiio}, {disrmuzo}, {rexsa}, {ketslau}.,fu'ivla,icthyosaur,ikfiio,,
column12: iklki,$x_1$ clicks (press and release) button/switch $x_2$ to cause $x_3$ (nu).,See also {batke}, {danre}.,fu'ivla,click,iklki,,
column13: iksodida,$x_1$ is a tick/member of subgenus Ixodida of species $x_2$,,fu'ivla,tick,iksodida,,
column14: ilki,$x_1$ (text) is written in a dialect where every bridi has arguments expressed in Lakoff's image schemata,Labels of roles: {di'o} - {sedi'o} for CONTAINER, {pa'u} - {sepa'u} for PART-WHOLE, {ra'i} - {sera'i} for CENTER-PERIPHERY, {sepu'e} - {vepu'e} - {tepu'e} for SOURCE-PATH-GOAL, {ra'a} for LINK, {mau} - {semau} for MORE-LESS, {gau} for PROTOTYPE, {ja'i} for the rules describing the semantic cases schema. To be used with {sei}. To use only for a given bridi without affecting child bridi the transformation 'SELBRI => SELBRI .ilki' can be used (as an alternative to using {sei}) thus putting {ilki} as the tertau of a newly formed selbri. See also {jo'au}, {ensi}, {esme}, {onga}.,fu'ivla,,ilki,,
column15: ilnu,$x_1$ is a cloud.,See also {dilnu}.,fu'ivla,,ilnu,,
column16: impera,$x_1$ is an empire,,fu'ivla,empire,impera,,
column17: ike'as,IKEA,,cmevla,Ikea,,,
column18: i ku'i,'However,' 'But', 'In contrast'; separates utterances,,cmavo-compound,,,,
column19: implicite,$x_1$ is implicit, implied, understood, contained in the nature but not directly expressed or apparent,,fu'ivla,,implicite,,
column20: importe,$x_1$ (entity) imports $x_2$ (entity) to $x_3$ (entity),See also {eksporte},fu'ivla,import,importe,,
column21: impute,$x_1$ (entity) imputes, ascribes to $x_2$ (entity) an action $x_3$ (event),See also {sitna},fu'ivla,ascribe,impute,impute,,
column22: incala,$x_1$ (entity) expresses a wish for a given future event $x_2$ (event) to occur; $x_1$ expresses "god willing" / "deo volente" hope,Usually used in a Muslim country or Islamic context. See also {pacna}, {a'o},fu'ivla,inshallah,incala,,
column23: incipe,$x_1$ is the beginning/the initial stage/starting/inchoate/coming into existence/first part of $x_2$,See {ultime}, {cfari}, {fasnu}, {pruce},fu'ivla,beginning,incipe,,
column24: indice,$x_1$ (ordered set) is an index of unordered items $x_2$ (set) ordered by rule $x_3$ (proposition),See also {ce'o}, {ce}, {lidne},fu'ivla,index,indices,indice,,
column25: indigo,$x_1$ is indigo (color),,fu'ivla,,indigo,,
column26: indi'o,$x_1$ reflects/pertains to the Indian Ocean region/culture/history/geography/identity/[nationality] in aspect $x_2$.,Pertains to peoples or things bordering, embedded in (or on an island in), submerged in, located under or on the bottom of, or going through/over the Indian Ocean as well. "Trans-Indian" (in the sense of pertaining to the Indian Ocean) is closely related to this word. See also: ".{atlanto}", "{pakfiko}".,fu'ivla,Indian Ocean,indi'o,,
column27: in,yin,A Chinese philosophical concept. Cf. {ian},cmevla,yin,,,
column28: imperia,$x_1$ is an empire,,obsolete fu'ivla,,imperia,,
column29: i na ja,logical connective: sentence afterthought conditional/only if.,,cmavo-compound,sentence only if,,,,JA*
column30: i'o,attitudinal:

column2: io,attitudinal:

infakta,$x_1$ is an infarction of type $x_2$,,fu'ivla,infarction,infakta,,
column3: infarto,$x_1$ is an infarct, an area of dead tissue caused by a loss of blood supply, a localized necrosis,,fu'ivla,infarct,infarto,,
column4: infeste,$x_1$ (plural) infests, inhabits $x_2$ in unpleasantly large numbers,See also {zdani}, {xabju},fu'ivla,infest,infeste,,
column5: inflamati,$x_1$ is an inflammation experienced by/in body(-part) $x_2$ of type/characterised by $x_3$; $x_1$ is a medical condition of $x_2$ (part of body), consisting in congestion of the blood vessels, with obstruction of the blood current, and growth of morbid tissue; $x_2$ [if it is a body part rather than a whole person/organism] is inflamed,Might be manifested outwardly by redness, stiffness (especially in joints), tenderness or painfulness, and swelling and/or attended with heat and pain. See also {bilma}, {xunre}, {blaci}.,fu'ivla,inflammation,inflamati,,
column6: inflenza,$x_1$ is an influenza, grippe, flu,,fu'ivla,influenza,inflenza,,
column7: influ'enza,$x_1$ is an influenza, grippe, flu,,fu'ivla,flu,grippe,influenza,influ'enza,,
column8: info,$x_1$ is information about $x_2$ gathered by method $x_3$,,fu'ivla,,info,,
column9: infuje,$x_1$ (loi; result) is a quantity of a herbal infusion meant for consumption, from sources/herbs $x_2$ (list of primary ingredients), extracted and introduced to substrate liquid by process $x_3$ (default: steeping or soaking), introduced to substrate $x_4$ (default: liquid water).,"Herb" is rather general, as is "consumption". Tea, coffee, original hot chocolate, herbal/false teas, some medicines, sassafrass or root beers, etc. count. Typically, blood transfusion or other solutions introduced by intravenous means is outside the scope of this word, but there may be exceptions. See also: {tcati}, {ckafi}.,fu'ivla,herbal tea,infusion,tea,infuje,,
column10: inglico,$x_1$ is English/pertains to English-speaking culture in aspect $x_2$.,Generally assume broadest sense of 'English'; may refer to 'English', pertaining to the country/people/culture of England (normally requiring constraint = {inglicygu'e}); British English, the norm language of the UK (= {inglicybau}). This word is part of a movement to supplant cultural gismu.,fu'ivla,English,inglico,,
column11: ingoma,$x_1$ is an ingoma, a drum covered with a membrane of animal skin.,,fu'ivla,,ingoma,,
column12: ingulule,$x_1$ is a cheetah (Acinonyx jubatus) of breed $x_2$,See also {bramlatu},fu'ivla,cheetah,ingulule,,
column13: inka,$x_1$ causes $x_2$.,,fu'ivla,,inka,,
column14: inkapre,$x_1$ is an Inca person.,,fu'ivla,,inkapre,,
column15: inkara'a,$x_1$ pertains to Inka culture.,,fu'ivla,,inkara'a,,
column16: inku,$x_1$ is a vaccine.,,fu'ivla,,inku,,
column17: inmago,$x_1$ is an organism $x_2$ at its imago stage of development,Usually next after {larva} stage.,fu'ivla,imago,inmago,,
column18: inmo,$x_1$ feels the emotions/cognitive [psychological] phenomena expressed by indicators $x_2$ (text) about $x_3$,See also {cinmo}.,fu'ivla,,inmo,,
column19: inmune,$x_1$ is immune to pathogenic action $x_2$ (property of $x_1$) towards it by showing $x_3$ (property of $x_1$),See also {spuda}, {bilma}, {jurme}, {vidru}, {bandu},fu'ivla,immune,inmune,,
column20: inpociburu,$x_1$ (event / state / property) is impossible under conditions $x_2$,See also {na} {cumki}.,fu'ivla,impossible,inpociburu,,
column21: insmu,$x_1$ is the literal meaning of $x_2$ seen by $x_3$,Shortening of {pe'arnainsmu}.,fu'ivla,literal meaning,insmu,,
column22: insomni,$x_1$ is insomnia, a sleeping disorder with symptoms of unrest and the inability to sleep,See also {bilma}, {sipna},fu'ivla,insomnia,insomni,,
column23: inspekte,$x_1$ checks, inspects $x_2$ for $x_3$ (property of $x_2$),See {cipra}, {zgana}, {pajni},fu'ivla,to check,to inspect,inspekte,,
column24: instagrama,$x_1$ (entity) is an Instagram photo/record of $x_2$ (entity) done by $x_3$ (entity) and preserved in page/place $x_4$ (entity),See also {pixra}, {vidvi}.,fu'ivla,,instagrama,,
column25: instale,$x_1$ (entity) connects, sets up $x_2$ (entity) onto $x_3$ (entity),See also {punji}, {setca}, {pilno},fu'ivla,install,instale,,
column26: integrale,$x_1$ (number) is the integral (limit) of function $x_2$,See also {fancu}.,fu'ivla,integral,integrale,,

column87: iskuuil,Ithkuil,The Ithkuil language, an experimental constructed language developed by John Quijada ({la} {djankixadas}) and published in its final version in 2011. Ithkuil is both logical and unambiguous in its syntax and extremely precise in its semantics, designed to be suited for 'descriptions of the holistic vs. discrete componential structure of objects, situations, and phenomena', 'the causal dynamics of complex states, acts, [and] events', and many other areas of nuance (Ithkuil.net, 'Introduction'). It can pack such detail into short words and syllables due to its large phonemic inventory, use of phonemic tone and stress, and complex agglutinative morphology. Quijada describes the language as 'an exercise in exploring how human languages could function, not how human languages do function' (Ithkuil.net, 'Introduction'). Alternate names for the language: {itku'ile}, {itku'ilybau}.,cmevla,Ithkuil,Ithkuil language,,,

column59: jajrlanparti,$x_1$ (people mass/jo'u) have a LAN party at location $x_2$, coming from locations $x_3$ (mass/jo'u).,See also: LAN party (event) ({nunrlanparti}), gathering ({jmaji}), LAN ({selklosamseltcana}), video game {samyzilkei}.,fu'ivla,having a LAN party,jajrlanparti,,
column60: jaldiga,$x_1$=$g_1$ is a bumper on $x_2$=$j_1$, decreasing the collision impact with $x_3$=$j_2$,A metal rail or bar, usually horizontal, for protecting the front or rear of a car or vehicle.,fu'ivla,bumper,jaldiga,,
column61: jakob,Jacob,With French pronunciation /a.kb/, where // is changed to its Lojban approximation /o/,cmevla,Jacob,,,
column62: ja'au,subjective number which is decreasing over time,See also {jdika}, {zildika}, {ze'au}, {so'au}.,experimental cmavo,decreasing number,,,,PA4
column63: ja'ei,jai equivalent of la'e,tu'a:jai::la'e:ja'ei. So ko'a ja'ei broda equals la'e ko'a broda,experimental cmavo,referent conversion,,,,JAI
column64: ja'e nai,na'e {jalge} modal, 1st place (event causal); without result ...,Cf. {na'e} {jalge},cmavo-compound,without result,,,,BAI*
column65: jai'a,grammatically converts LAhE to SE; semantically the result tags the $x_1$ of the selbri as being LAhE the supplied $x_1$. Can be converted to other than $x_1$ with SE.,Cf. {jai} in the TAG sense. Note that {jai} in the non-TAG sense is the same as jai'a tu'a. Example usage: lo tadni cu jai'a lu'o sruri lo dinju gi'e krixa <-> loi tadni cu sruri lo dinju gi'e jai'a lu'a krixa <-> loi tadni cu sruri lo dinju .ije lu'a lo go'i cu krixa,experimental cmavo,,,,,JAIhA
column66: jai ca,convert time tense (tagged) place to 1st place; 1st place moves to extra place (fai).,,cmavo-compound,time conversion,,,,SE*
column67: jai'e,elliptical presence or absence of "jai".,If used without a sumtcita, the meaning is that the information about presence or absence of a "jai" has been left to context. "lo se pensi be mi cu jai'e jitfa" = "lo se pensi be mi cu jitfa gi'a jai jitfa". In cases where it is questionable whether or not a "jai" is needed for sumti raising, but the meaning is clear, this word can be used to bypass Lojban's very strict sumti raising semantics. Regardless of which of the two alternative meanings is then applied, the fai-place always contains the original x1. When used with a sumtcita, the meaning is identical to "jai". See also {jai}, {tu'a}, {fai}.,experimental cmavo,,,,,JAI
column68: jai gau,makes $x_{1}$ the agent of a bridi; old 1st place moves to extra place (fai).,,cmavo-compound,agent conversion,,,,SE*
column69: jai'i,takes NU or LE NU, turns into sumtcita: clarifies the semantic NU-type of the current bridi.,'mi jai'i li'i klama lo zarci', 'jai'i li'i ku mi klama lo zarci', and 'mi klama lo zarci jai'i li'i' are all acceptable and equivalent. Implies '(zo'e) li'i mi klama lo zarci', but avoids wrapping the bridi in an abstraction that makes its sumti hard to access via {le} {go'i} etc. Tagged sumti, if present, fills the $x_2$ of the NU; e.g. 'jai'i li'i do mi klama lo zarci' implies 'fe do li'i mi klama lo zarci',experimental cmavo,NU-type clarifier,,,,JAIhI
column70: jai vi,convert location tense (tagged) place to 1st place; 1st place moves to extra place (fai).,,cmavo-compound,location conversion,,,,SE*
column71: jamfu,$x_{1}$ is a/the foot [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: lowest portion] (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is pedal.,See also {jicmu}, {genja}, {zbepi}, {tuple}, {jubme}, {xance}, {tamji}.,gismu,foot,jaf,jma,jamf,jamfu,,
column72: jamna,$x_{1}$ (person/mass) wars against $x_{2}$ over territory/matter $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is at war with $x_{2}$.,See also {bradi}, {gunta}, {panpi}, {damba}, {darlu}.,gismu,war,jam,jamn,jamna,,
column73: janbe,$x_{1}$ is a bell/chime/[tuning fork] [tuned percussion instrument] producing sound/note $x_{2}$.,Also: $x_1$ rings/tolls (i.e. if it rings, then it is a bell); resonates (one sense, = {jabdesku}).  See also {zgike}, {tonga}, {desku}, {slilu}.,gismu,bell,jab,janb,janbe,,
column74: janco,$x_{1}$ is a/the shoulder/hip/joint [body-part] attaching limb/extremity $x_{2}$ to body $x_{3}$.,See also {birka}.,gismu,shoulder,jan,janc,janco,,
column75: janli,$x_{1}$ collides with/crashes/bumps/runs into $x_{2}$.,(also collide = {simjanli} for a collision between two moving objects); See also {darxi}.,gismu,collide,jal,janl,janli,,
column76: jansu,$x_{1}$ is a diplomat/consul representing polity $x_{2}$ in/at negotiation $x_{3}$ for function/purpose $x_{4}$.,(for) $x_3$ polity, (use tu'a); also ambassador (= {raljansu}, {trujansu}).  See also {jecta}, {krati}.,gismu,diplomat,jas,jans,jansu,,
column77: janta,$x_{1}$ is an account/bill/invoice for goods/services $x_{2}$, billed to $x_{3}$ by $x_{4}$.,See also {jdima}, {vamji}, {vecnu}, {canja}, {jerna}, {dejni}, {jbera}.,gismu,account,bill,jat,jant,janta,,
column78: jarbu,$x_{1}$ is a suburban area of city/metropolis $x_{2}$.,See also {nurma}, se {tcadu}, ve {tcadu}.,gismu,suburb,jarb,jarbu,,
column79: jarco,$x_{1}$ (agent) shows/exhibits/displays/[reveals]/demonstrates $x_{2}$ (property) to audience $x_{3}$.,[reveal (= {tolmipygau}, {mipyja'o}, {sivja'o}); also: $x_1$ shows that $x_2$, $x_1$ shows off $x_2$; Use {arco} for displaying objects.; See also {tigni}, {cipra}, {zgana}, {jvinu}, {lanli}, {mipri}, {simlu}.,gismu,show,ja'o,jarc,jarco,,
column80: jarki,$x_{1}$ is narrow in dimension $x_{2}$ [2nd most significant dimension] by standard $x_{3}$.,See also {caxno}, {cinla}, {tordu}, {tagji}, {cmalu}.,gismu,narrow,jak,jark,jarki,,
column81: jaspu,$x_{1}$ is a passport issued to $x_{2}$ (person) by authority $x_{3}$ allowing $x_{4}$ (activity).,See also {pikta}, {catni}, {curmi}.,gismu,account,passport,permit,jap,jasp,jaspu,,
column82: jatna,$x_{1}$ is captain/commander/leader/in-charge/boss of vehicle/domain $x_{2}$.,See also {jitro}, {lidne}, te {bende}, {minde}, {ralju}, {gidva}, {bloti}.,gismu,captain,ja'a,jatn,jatna,,
column83: javni,$x_{1}$ is a rule prescribing/mandating/requiring $x_{2}$ (event/state) within system/community $x_{3}$.,Regulation, prescription (also $x_2$), principle, requirement (also $x_2$), prescribe, require (conditions are usually contained within $x_2$); $x_1$ is regulatory; $x_2$, $x_3$ are regulated.  See also {flalu}, {ritli}, cmavo list {ja'i}, {marde}, {tcaci}, {tinbe}, {zekri}.,gismu,rule,term,jva,javn,javni,ja'i,se ja'i,te ja'i,
column84: jbama,$x_{1}$ is a bomb/explosive device with explosive material/principle $x_{2}$.,See also {cecla}, {spoja}.,gismu,bomb,bam,jbam,jbama,,
column85: jbari,$x_{1}$ is a berry (fruit/plant) of plant/species $x_{2}$.,See also {grute}, {tsiju}, {narge}.,gismu,berry,jba,jbar,jbari,,
column86: jbena,$x_{1}$ is born to $x_{2}$ at time $x_{3}$ [birthday] and place $x_{4}$ [birthplace]; $x_{1}$ is native to (fo) $x_{4}$.,$x_2$ bears/gives birth to $x_1$; also $x_3$: natal day.  See also {fange}, {gutra}, {rorci}, {mamta}, {salci}, {citsi}.,gismu,born,jbe,jben,jbena,,
column87: jbera,$x_{1}$ (agent) borrows/temporarily takes/assumes $x_{2}$ (object) from source $x_{3}$ for interval $x_{4}$.,Credit (= {jernu'e}); borrow/assume a property or quality as a chameleon does (= {zaskai}, {zasysmitra}, {zasysmitai}).  See also {dejni}, {janta}, {zivle}.,gismu,borrow,jer,jber,jbera,,
column88: jbini,$x_{1}$ is between/among set of points/bounds/limits $x_{2}$ (set)/amidst mass $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).,$x_2$ (a complete set, generally ordered) defines the bounds/limits/range for $x_1$. column97: jancaucreka,$cr_1$=$cl_1$=$j_2$ is a tube top of material $cr_2$.,A shoulderless, sleeveless "tube" that wraps the torso, generally very tight over the breasts in order to prevent the garment from falling. "halterneck" ({nebdadycreka}) is its subtype. Suggested shortest fu'ivla form: ancrka. Cf. {creka}.,lujvo,boob tube,tube top,,,
column98: jancelxa'i,$x1$=$xa1$ is a rifle/RPG/[near-shoulder weapon] against $x2$=$xa2$, used by $x3$=$xa3$=$j3$, shooting projectile $x4$=$c2$,,lujvo,rifle,,,
column99: jangalgau,$gas_1$=$j_2$ shrugs, raises their shoulders $gal_1$=$j_1$.,See also {gasnu}, {galtu}, {janco}, {galgau}.,lujvo,shrug,,,
column100: janjaknyxa'i,$x_1$ is a bazooka for use against $x_2$ by $x_3$.,Cf. {janco}, {jakne}, {xarci}, {sorjaknykarce}.,lujvo,bazooka,rocket launcher,,,

column104: jarcindu,$x_1$ is a leather oak (Quercus durata) of species/strain $x_2$.,,lujvo,leather oak,,,
column105: jarjinme,$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of tungsten [W],,lujvo,,,,
column106: jarmau,$z_1$=$j_1$ is firmer/tougher/harder/more resistant than $z_2$ by amount $z_4$.,Cf. {jdari}, {zmadu}, {jaryrai}.,lujvo,firmer,harder,tougher,,,
column108: jaryrai,$j_1$=$t_1$ is the tallest among set/range $t_4$.,Cf. {jdari}, {traji}, {jarmau}.,lujvo,firmest,hardest,toughest,,,
column109: jasybriju,$b_1$ is an embassy/consulate of $j_2$ at $b_3$.,From {jansu} {briju}. Omit ambassador(s) $b_2$=$j_1$,lujvo,consulate,embassy,,,
column110: jatny'utka,$x_1$ is the captain/commander/leader/boss/superior of/to the captain/commander/leader/boss/superior of/to the captain/commander/leader/boss/superior of/to the ... captain/commander/leader/boss/superior of/to $x_2$ (subject, entity, vehicle, domain), connected by intermediate steps $x_3$.,If $x_2$ is an entity, then $x_1$ is $x_2$'s boss' boss' boss'  boss. In the U.S. military, the President of the United States (in the capacity of Commander-in-Chief) is the jatny'utka of every member of the military along some graph-path/hierarchy of command. This word is a {brapagjvo} due to the presence of the {zevla} {veljvo} ".{utka}".,lujvo,boss of boss of boss ...,,,
column111: jaudje,$x_1$ is Wednesday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.,,lujvo,Wednesday,,,
column112: jaurbeima'i,$x_1$ is February of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.,Cf. {relmasti}, {kanbyma'i}, {nanca}.,lujvo,February,,,
column114: jaurcarvi,$c_1$=$b_1$ (some water) rains to $c_2$ from $c_3$.,{carvi} is the general form of this.,lujvo,to rain,,,
column115: jaurcarvrama'e,$m_1$ is a hydrocycle carrying $m_2$, propelled by force $m_4$ transmitted via pedal(s) $c_1$=$v_1$.,,lujvo,hydrocycle,,,
column116: jaurcigla,$c_1$ is a/the serous gland secreting serous/serosal fluid $d_1$=$c_2$ (including water), of body $c_3$.,,lujvo,serous gland,,,

column118: jaurgacmatra,$m_1$ is a steam engine driving $m_2$.,Cf. {djacu}, {gapci}, {matra}, {jacfebmatra}, {jaurgapci}.,lujvo,steam engine,,,
column119: jaurgacmi'imle,$x_1$=$m_1$ is steampunk to $x_2$=$m_2$ in aspect $x_3$=$m_3$ (ka).,,lujvo,steampunk,,,
column120: jaurgapci,$x_1$=$g_1$=$d_1$ is steam/water vapor under conditions $x_2$=$g_3$.,$x_2$ includes temperature and pressure. Cf. {djacu}, {gapci}.,lujvo,aqueous vapor,aqueous vapour,steam,water vapor,water vapour,,,

column123: jaurji'eta'e,$x_1$=$t_1$ is an aquarium(container for aquatic beings)/fish tank for $x_2$=$t_2$=$jm_1$,from {jaurji'e}+{tanxe},lujvo,aquarium,fish tank,,,
column124: jaurjinru,$j_1$ is completely submerged in water $j_2$=$d_1$; $j_1$ is underwater.,,lujvo,underwater,,,
column125: ja'urjukni,$ju_1$ is a scorpion of species $ju_2$.,,lujvo,scorpion,,,
column126: jaurjunla,$x_1$=$jl_1$ is a waterclock/clepsydra measuring time units $x_2$=$jl_2$ to precision $x_3$=$jl_3$,from {djacu} + {junla},lujvo,clepsydra,water clock,waterclock,,,
column128: jaursabypatxu,$p_1$ is a watering can used by $s_1$ to water/irrigate $s_3$ made of $p_3$,from {djacu} {sabji} {patxu} c.f. {jaursabji},lujvo,watering can,,,
column129: jaursfeblo,$x_1$ is an aquatic boat/ship/vessel for carrying $x_2$, propelled by $x_3$.,This is a vessel which floats on the surface of a sufficiently large body of water. {bloti} is too vague/general for this specific sense (for example, a spaceship ({kesyblo}) is arguably also a bloti, even though it is nothing like a jaursfeblo in its actual mechanics). {liksfeblo} is more general (not designed only for water surfaces); {flublo} is more general still, possibly encompassing airplanes, hot-air balloons, etc. Use {jirblo} for submarines/submersibles/U-boats/etc. (for any liquid).,lujvo,boat,,,
column130: jaurskiji,$s_1$ is a water-ski/surfboard supporting skier/surfer/cargo $s_3$,cf. {tumskiji}, {si'erskiji},lujvo,surfboard,water ski,,,
column131: jaursrasu,$s_1$ is/are a reed(s)/wetland grass of species $s_2$.,Cf. {djacu}, {srasu}, {jauspa}.,lujvo,reed,,,
column132: jaurvasmro,$m_1$ drowns in body of water $d_1$.,,lujvo,drown,,,
column133: jaurxarju,$x_1$ is a capybara of species $x_2$,Synonym: {tciuiro},lujvo,,,,
column134: ja'urxe'a,$j_1$=$x_1$ is a/the beak/talon-like jaw (body part) of $j_2$=$x_2$.,Made from {jgalu} + {xedja}.,lujvo,beak,,,
column135: jaurxilmi'i,$m_1$ is a water wheel for use/function $m_2$.,,lujvo,water wheel,,,
column136: jauspa,$s_1$ is a seaweed of  species/type $s_2$.,Cf. {djacu}, {spati}, {jaursrasu}.,lujvo,seaweed,,,

column140: jaxmu'i,$x_1$ (object) motivates/is a motive/incentive for action/event $x_2$=$m_2$, per volition of $x_3$=$m_3$, specifically with action/event/state $x_4$=$m_1$,Cf. {jaxri'a} {jaxyki'u},lujvo,motive,,,
column141: jaxnabmi,$x_1$ (object) is a problem / problematic to $x_2$=$n_2$ in situation/task/inquiry $x_3$=$n_3$ with event/state $x_4$=$n_1$,,lujvo,problem,,,
column142: jaxnalvai,$x_1$ (object/person) is unimportant/not crucial/doesn't matter to $x_2$ in aspect $x_3$ under circumstances/in instance (in which $x_1$ participates) $x_4$=$v_f$,cf. {jai}, {na'e}, and {vajni},lujvo,not to matter,unimportant,,,
column143: jaxnunco'e,$x_1$ is involved in / is related to / pertains to / is a sumti participant in abstraction $x_2$.,Equivalent to: {bo'a} {jai} {nu} {me'au} {bo'e}.,lujvo,,,,
column144: jaxpu'a,$x_1=p_{1j}$ (object/person) seems pleasant to/pleases $x_2$=$p_2$ in property $x_3$, in that $x_1$ does/is/partakes in $x_4=p_{fai}$,This is the first defined lujvo using -jax-, the proposed rafsi for {jai}. See also {pluka}.,lujvo,nice,pleasant,please,,,
column145: jaxri'a,$x_1$ (object) effects/physically causes effect $x_2$=$r_2$ (event/state) under conditions $x_3$=$r_3$ with $x_4$=$r_1$ (event/state),Cf. {jaxyki'u} {jaxmu'i},lujvo,cause,,,
column147: jaxyclira,$x_1$ (object/person) is early by standard $x_2$=$c_2$ in event $x_3$=$c_1$,,lujvo,early,,,
column148: jaxydicra,$x_1$ (object/person) interrupts/stops/halts/[disrupts] $x_2$=$d_2$ (object/event/process) due to quality $x_3$=$d_3$ with event $x_4$=$d_1$,,lujvo,interrupt,,,

column152: jaxyka'a,$x_1$ cuts [through]/splits/divides $x_2$=$k_2$ (object) into pieces $x_3$=$k_3$ with tool/blade/force $x_4$=$k_1$,,lujvo,cut,,,

column155: jaxyxai,$x_1$ (object/person) injures/harms/damages victim $x_2$=$xr_2$ in property $x_3$=$xr_3$ (ka) resulting in injury $x_4$=$xr_4$ (state) with event $x_5$=$xr_1$,,lujvo,injure,,,
column157: jbebau,$x_1$ is the native language of $x_2$,See {jbena}, {bangu},lujvo,native language,,,
column158: jbedetnunsla,$s_1$ is the birthday celebration of $x_2$=$j_1$ born at time $j_3$.,Cf. {detke'u}.,lujvo,birthday,,,
column159: jbedetri,$d_1$=$j_3$ is the birthday [day,{week},{month},year] of $j_1$ at location $j_4$=$d_3$ according to calendar $d_4$.,Cf. {jbena}, {detri}, {terjbe}, {jbedetnunsla}.,lujvo,birthdate,birthday,,,

column161: jbepiblei,$k1$ is the physical sex of $p2$,,lujvo,sex,,,
column162: jbeseltei,$x_1$ (living thing) is of age $x_2$ (time period since birth),See {jbena}, {temci}, {nanca},lujvo,age,,,
column163: jbetei,$x_1$ (amount of time) is the age of $x_2$.,Technically using lo nanca be li dau mi jbetei is a better alternative to using mi nanca li dau, since this latter seems to imply that the whole duration of the life of the speaker is (exactly) ten years.,lujvo,age,,,
column165: jbigau,$g_1$ makes  $j_1$ close to/approximate  $j_2$ in property/quantity $j_3$ (ka/ni).,Cf. {jibni}, {gasnu}, {jbibi'o}, {jbize'a}.,lujvo,bring close,make approximate,make close,,,

column168: jbikla,$x_1$=$j_1$=$k_1$ approaches $x_2$=$j_2$=$k_2$ from $x_3$=$k_3$ via route $x_4$=$k_4$ by means of transportation $x_5$=$k_5$.,Cf. {jibni}, {klama}, {jbibi'o}, {jbize'a}.,lujvo,approach,,,

column171: jbipru,$x_1$ is recent/is in the recent past/is in the near past of $x_2$.,Typically, $x_2$ being the current moment (in the frame of reference) would be used/assumed (resulting specifically in "{cabjbipru}"), unless context or explicit exception indicate otherwise.,lujvo,near past,recent,,,
column172: jbiprurai,$x_1$ is the most-recent event/instance/example of/among $x_2$ (set of similar things) as of/in the past of $x_3$.,,lujvo,most recent,most-recent,,,
column173: jambori,$x_1$ celebrates $x_2$ with jamboree, lavish, boisterous party $x_3$ (property of $x_1$),See also {salci}.,fu'ivla,,jambori,,

column175: jargone,$x_1$ is jargon dialect used by $x_2$ used to express specific terminology $x_3$,See also {bangu}, {lengua}, {tecyvla}, {pe'ainai},fu'ivla,jargon,jargone,,
column176: jarnezi,$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'text' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.,Inner structure of the rule: (NAI+)? (CMENE+ # | (indicators & free+))? (joik-jek)? text-1. Names in lower case are grammatical constructs. Names in UPPER CASE are selma'o (lexeme) names, and are terminals. Concatenation is expressed by juxtaposition with no operator symbol. '|' represents alternation (choice). '?' represents an optional element. '&' represents 'and/or' ('A & B' is the same as 'A | B | A B'). '+' represents optional repetition of the construct to the left. Left-grouping is implied; right-grouping is shown by explicit self-referential recursion with no '+'. '*' represents optional repetition of the construct to the left starting from 0 occurrences. Left-grouping is implied; right-grouping is shown by explicit self-referential recursion with no '*'. '()' serves to indicate the grouping of the other operators. Otherwise, '+' binds closer than '&', which binds closer than '|'. '#' is shorthand for '[free+]', a construct which appears in many places. '//' encloses an elidable terminator, which may be omitted (without change of meaning) if no grammatical ambiguity results.,fu'ivla,,jarnezi,,
column177: jasnce,$x_1$ is a voiced postalveolar sibilant fricative sound produced by $x_2$.,Derived from and synonymous with {jy zei sance}. The odd morphological form serves to place the most salient consonant in the stressed syllable.,fu'ivla,J sound,voiced postalveolar sibilant,voiced postalveolar sibilant fricative,jasnce,,
column178: jatnrpapa,$x_1$ is a pope of religion/patriarchy $x_2$.,Cf. {jatna}, {jdaja'a}.,fu'ivla,pope,jatnrpapa,,
column179: jaukpa,$x_1$ cooks/prepares some food satisfying $x_2$ (ka), by doing $x_3$ (event),,fu'ivla,prepare food,jaukpa,,
column180: javniso,$x_1$ is the ISO designation/result/standard/code for topic $x_2$ applied to specific case/individual/group/thing $x_3$ according to rule/ISO specification $x_4$ published by/according to mandating organization $x_5$ (default: ISO),Theoretically, the standard organization/body could be other than ISO, but it should be prominent and/or international (and internationally recognized) in scope and nature; in such a case, replace each occurrence of "ISO" in the definition with the appropriate name/designation/title (of the organization, etc.). x1 need not be a name-designation/code (it could be the result of any rule), although it likely will commonly be so. Examples of possible x2-filling sumti: code-designations for language, country, currency, etc.. For an entity with a given code, use {te javniso} or {te se javniso} (specifying the type of entity being designated by use of the appropriate terbri j2); for a given ISO rule, consider {ve javniso}; for the organization ISO, consider {xe javniso}. See also: {linga}, {landa}, {rucni}, {jvinjiata}, {jvinjica'o}. This word is the fu'ivla version of: {jviso}; equivalent to {jvaiso} (for slightly abbreviated form that preserves some pronunciations of "ISO").,fu'ivla,ISO,ISO code,javniso,,
column181: javnitabu,$x_1$ is a taboo forbidding $x_2$ (event) within community $x_3$,,fu'ivla,,javnitabu,,
column182: jbabaji,$x_1$ is not rightly able to apprehend the kind of confusion of ideas that could provoke such a question as $x_2$,Credit for the English definition goes to Charles Babbage (1791-1871),fu'ivla,incredulous,jbabaji,,
column183: jbakiui,$x_1$ is a kiwifruit (genus Actinidia) of species/breed $x_2$,,fu'ivla,kiwifruit,jbakiui,,

column189: jaurbarflegaus,$x_1$ is Aquarius [astronomical constellation/astrological sign].,From {djacu}, {barfle}, {gasnu}. Aquarius is identified as "The Great One" in the Babylonian star catalogues and represents the god Ea himself, who is commonly depicted holding an overflowing vase. In the Greek tradition, the constellation became represented as simply a single vase from which a stream poured down.,cmevla,Aquarius,,,
column190: ja'urjuknis,$x_1$ is Scorpius [astronomical constellation]/Scorpio [astrological sign].,The Babylonians called this constellation the 'Scorpion'. In Greek Mythology there are plenty of  myths associated with Scorpio.,cmevla,Scorpio,Scorpius,,,
column191: ja'oi,permutation cycle writer notation start,Basically like {jo'i}, but for cycles. Use {boi} in order to separate terms.  Terminated by {tei'u}. In this notation, each term maps to the the subsequent term as read from left to right or heard in chronological order of utterance; the last term (immediately before {tei'u}) maps to the first term. The object constructed is a cyclic permutation, a group element. The singleton cycle is identity on that term. It can be applied to a single element among its terms or may left group act upon a set or structure, or an element if the application is not directly upon it (such as when the application is to an index or variable of that element). Permutations are composed when viewed from outside of their group structure and have the group operator act upon them when within that context. The transposition (1  2) is expressed as ' li ja'oi pa boi re tei'u '. See also: {tei'u}, {ma'o'e}, {gu'ai}, {ru'ei}, {fa'ai}.,experimental cmavo,,,,,JAhOI
column192: ja'o nai,discursive/evidential: after all...,Polar opposite of {ja'o} on a scale: result - mutual equivalence - cause. See also {ja'o}, {ja'e}, {ki'u}.,cmavo-compound,,,,,UI*
column193: jdari,$x_{1}$ is firm/hard/resistant/unyielding to force $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.,See also {nandu}, {ralci}, {randa}, {ranti}, {tinsa}, {sligu}, {stodi}.,gismu,firm,hard,jar,jdar,jdari,,
column194: jdice,$x_{1}$ (person) decides/makes decision $x_{2}$ (du'u) about matter $x_{3}$ (event/state).,See also {pajni}, {cuxna}, {kanji}, {manri}.,gismu,decide,jdi,jdic,jdice,,
column195: jdika,$x_{1}$ (experiencer) decreases/contracts/is reduced/diminished in property/quantity $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.,See also {zenba}, {mleca}, {vimcu}.,gismu,decrease,jdik,jdika,,
column196: jdima,$x_{1}$ [amount] is the price of $x_{2}$ to purchaser/consumer $x_{3}$ set by vendor $x_{4}$.,$x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, {posyseldi'a} for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer ({friti}), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is {vecnu} or {canja}; neither is the same as "value" or {vamji}; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace).  See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji} for 'value', ve {vecnu} for 'cost', {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.,gismu,cost,price,di'a,jdim,jdima,,
column197: jdini,$x_{1}$ is money/currency issued by $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is financial/monetary/pecuniary/fiscal.,'currency' sometimes is restricted to paper money (= {pledi'i}).  See also {fepni}, {jdima}, {rupnu}, {sicni}, {canja}.,gismu,money,din,di'i,jdin,jdini,,
column198: jduli,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of jelly/semisolid [texture] of material/composition including $x_{2}$.,(adjective:) $x_1$ is gelatinous.  See also {litki}, {sligu}.,gismu,jelly,dul,jdu,jdul,jduli,,
column199: jecta,$x_{1}$ is a polity/state governing territory/domain $x_{2}$; [government/territory relationship].,(adjective:) $x_1$ is civil/political.  See also {gugde}, {tutra}, {turni}, {natmi}, {jansu}, {lanci}, {cecmu}.,gismu,polity,jec,je'a,ject,jecta,,

column45: jbovla,$x_1$ is a defined Lojban word, considered as a word as per Lojban's grammar, with meaning/role $x_2$,In Lojban, particles such as "lo", "ku" etc. are considered to be words, whereas they may not be considered so according to other standards (for example, as "lo" and "ku" cannot appear in isolation, they are arguably closer to clitics than independent words). See also {jbokravla} (native Lojban word) and {valsi}.,lujvo,Lojban word,,,
column46: jbovlaste,$x_1$=$li_1$ is a list of words $x_2$=$v_1$ in Lojban ($v_3$=lo lojbo), in order $x_3$=$li_3$, preserved in medium $x_4$=$li_4$.,In a la-description, jbovlaste refers to the online dictionary editing system.,lujvo,dictionary,,,
column47: jbovlazbakamnandu,$x_1$ is the difficulty of Lojban word-making.,Cf. {jbovlazbakemsedycro}. Making words in Lojban is difficult in a variety of ways, depending on what type of word you're trying to make. Proper {lujvo}-making requires a good grasp of the semantics of the relevant {gismu}; and of {tanru} syntax, especially the scope of various grammatical constructs; knowledge of Lojban morphology and phonotactics to correctly insert y-hyphens where needed and avoid unparseable wordlike forms such as *{tosmabru} and *{slinku'i} (see {valrtosmabru}, {valslinku'i}); and finally, if you want to add your word to the dictionary, facility with the lujvo-scoring algorithm. Making Type 4 {fu'ivla} (or {zi'evla}), on the other hand, presents the challenge of knowing, out of hundreds of wordlike phonological patterns, which will parse as  single-morpheme words and which will not. (For example, the nonce word {kadvati} will parse but *{kazvati} will not; {fra'aso} will but *{fra'asoi} will not; {kadnazbakai} will but {kadnazbackai} is a actually a lujvo.) Making Type 3 fu'ivla is comparatively easy, but still requires knowing how to use hyphen phonemes right and, of course, how to not violate phonotactical rules when lojbanizing foreign words. Luckily, the work of checking potential word forms can be mostly automated now, if you have access to {sutysisku} or {jbovlaste}.,lujvo,Lojban word-creation struggle,Lojban word-making difficulty,,,
column48: jbovlazbakemsedycro,$x_1$ has a headache from making new words in Lojban (or trying to do so).,Cf. {jbovlazbakamnandu}.,lujvo,headache from trying to make a new Lojban word,Lojban word-creation headache,Lojban word-making headache,,,

column83: jedlre,$x_1$ (event/state) is on Tuesday or the second day of a week $x_2$ in system $x_3$.,lo jedlre = lo se {jefydeidetri} be li {re}. column91: je'empe,$x_1$ (agent) receives and understands message $x_2$ (text/sedu'u) from $x_3$ (sender of message),See {je'e}, {jimpe}, {tersmu}, {terbe'i}, {ki'anmo},fu'ivla,understand,je'empe,,

column94: jedlno,$x_1$ (event/state) is on Sunday or the zeroth day of a week $x_2$ in system $x_3$.,In the system Gregorian, ``jedlno'' can be substituted for ``{jednze}''. See also {detri}, {detke'u}, {jeftu}; {jednpa}, {jednre}, {jednci}, {jednvo}, {jednmu}, {jednxa}, {jednze}.,fu'ivla,Sunday,the zeroth day of a week,jedlno,,

column1: {je'aucu'i} - inattentive/uncaring/neutral toward the presence of possible errors

column2: je'au cu'i,discursive: correcting/corrective/correction - inattentive/uncaring/neutral toward the presence of possible errors - permitting (known/likely/plausible) errordiscursive: correcting/corrective/correction - inattentive/uncaring/neutral toward the presence of possible errors - permitting (known/likely/plausible) error/incompleteness/approximation,Potentially useful for academic/technical honesty.,cmavo-compound,laxity toward correctness,,,,UI3*
column3: je'au nai,discursive: correcting/corrective/correction - inattentive/uncaring/neutral toward the presence of possible errors - permitting (known/likely/plausible) errordiscursive: correcting/corrective/correction - inattentive/uncaring/neutral toward the presence of possible errors - permitting (known/likely/plausible) error/incompleteness/approximation,Not quite lying since this construct alerts the audience in good faith to the presence of (known/plausible/likely) errors or "incomplete truths" in the utterance; the plausibility and pertinence of the presence of such errors is subject to the utterer's judgment, opinion, knowledge, philosphy, desire to draw attention to them at that stage in the discussion, belief, etc. - in other words, absolute Truth (such as in an existential sense external to the utterer) does not necessarily result in the utterance of this construct, even if errors may be present. Potentially useful for academic or technical honesty. "Error" may be rendered as "incompleteness of truth" or "approximation" in this context.,cmavo-compound,allowing some room for error or incompleteness,permitting known errors,,,,UI3*
column4: jecyselsa'a,$x_1$=$s_2$ is the national anthem of country/state/polity $x_2$=$j_1$,from {jecta}+{selsa'a},lujvo,national anthem,,,
column5: jbobau zei po'o zei pulji,$x_1$ is the "J B O B A U   P O h O" police.,{jbobau} {po'o} {pulji},zei-lujvo,,,,
column6: jbobanido,$x_1$ is a 'Lojbanido', a daughter-language (linguistic offspring, not mutually intelligible) of Lojban, used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$.,Also 'Lojclone'. Refers only to languages developed after the debut of Lojban and in some way built on Lojbanic priniciples. Such languages include {xorban} and {tanbau} (arguably). This word is patterned phonetically after the Esperanto word 'Esperantido', which refers to languages 'descended' from Esperanto (the word means 'Esperanto-offspring'). The -ido suffix has entered into general use in constructed-language circles (not only English- or Esperanto-speaking ones) to denote the 'offspring' of famous conlangs.,fu'ivla,Lojbanido,Lojclone,jbobanido,,
column7: jbofuvi,$x_1$ is a Lojban-derived zi'evla/"self-loan-word" with meaning $x_2$ derived from word(s) $x_3$,From {lojbo} + {fu'ivla}, shortening of jbojbofu'ivla. See {zi'evla}. Examples of jbofuvi: {crenzuue}, {gentufa}, {aiste}, and of course, jbofuvi itself. // Although usually refers to zi'evla, is not necessarily limited to it - {jinda} (from {jipno} {dirce} {tarmi}) is an experimental gismu that's a jbofuvi, while {dzipo} (from {cadzu} {cipni}) is an original gismu that's also a jbofuvi.,fu'ivla,,jbofuvi,,
column8: jboia,$x_1$ is a boa of species $x_2$.,see also {since}, {sincrxenakanda},fu'ivla,boa,jboia,,
column9: jboiu,$x_1$ is a Lojban lover/enthusiast.,,fu'ivla,,jboiu,,
column10: jboku'ile,$x_1$ reflects/pertains to a Lojban-Ithkuil hybrid culture/language in aspect $x_2$,See also {lojbo}, {itku'ile},fu'ivla,Ithkuil-Lojban hybrid,Lojban-Ithkuil hybrid,jboku'ile,,
column11: jbonobo,$x_1$ is a bonobo of species/breed $x_2$.,See {tcimpazi}, {smani}.,fu'ivla,bonobo,jbonobo,,
column12: jbo'ofuvi,$x_1$ is a jbofuvi constructed by y'yfication of non zi'evla $x_2$,See {jbofuvi}, {zi'evla}. For example, {smu'uni}.,fu'ivla,,jbo'ofuvi,,
column13: jbopomofo,$x_1$ is a jbopomofo orthography (bopomofo orthography adapted for lojban),Cf. {ciska}, {lerfu}, la {tenguar}.,fu'ivla,,jbopomofo,,
column14: jboponei,$x_1$ relates to/is an instance of jboponei dialect in aspect $x_2$,jboponei is a Lojban dialect in which the word {po} is redefined to mean {xu'u} or {lo}{su'u} (the general bridi abstractor), and {nei} is brought along as its terminator. See {tcekitau}, {bankle},fu'ivla,jboponei,jboponei,,
column15: jborefota,$x_1$ is a pair of Lojbanists who frequently talk to each other in Lojban by telephone.,a {jbofuvi} derived from "jbobo re mei fonxa tavla",fu'ivla,,jborefota,,
column16: jbo'u'i,$x_1$ is funny to $x_2$ because it is Lojbanic, in aspect $x_3$.,From -jbo- and {u'i}.,fu'ivla,,jbo'u'i,,
column17: jbovaseji,$x_1$ adds $x_2$ to Lojban dictionary $x_3$ (default la jbovlaste),Makes sense, since we talk so much about adding words.,fu'ivla,,jbovaseji,,
column18: jbovidai,$x_1$ is a mammal belonging to the Bovidae family,,fu'ivla,Bovidae,jbovidai,,
column19: jednpa,$x_1$ (event/state) is on Monday or the first day of a week $x_2$ in system $x_3$.,lo jednpa = lo se {jefydeidetri} be li {pa}. ex.) lo nu sanga ctuca mi cu jednpa ro loi re jeftu la gregoris (It's on Monday of every two weeks that I learn singing.) / mi'a kansa lo nunjmaji noi jednpa lo bavlamjeftu (We will attend the meeting on Monday of next week.) See also {detri}, {detke'u}, {jeftu}; {jednpa}, {jednre}, {jednci}, {jednvo}, {jednmu}, {jednxa}, {jednze}, {jednbi}, {jednso}, {jedndau}, {jednfei}, {jedngai}, {jednjau}, {jednrei} or {jednxei}, {jednvai}.,fu'ivla,Monday,the first day of a week,jednpa,,
column20: je'e'e,mekso operator: associated Legendre polynomial in $a$ with unassociated order $b$ and associated order $c$,$b$ is a nonnegative integer; $c$ is an integer. Lacks the Condon-Shortley phase. Normalized with $P_n(1)=1$ (outputs $1$ for $a$=$1$, $c$=$0$, for any $b$ in the domain set; this function is notably not normalized for integrations).,experimental cmavo,Legendre polynomial,,,,VUhU
column21: je'e nai,vocative:

column1: {je'e nai} - negative acknowledge (I didn't hear you),,cmavo-compound,negative acknowledge,,,,COI*
column2: jeftu,$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ weeks in duration (default is 1 week) by standard $x_{3}$.,Re. $x_3$, a week may be more or less than seven days, classically being tied to the time between trips to the marketplace; this week (= {cabjeftu}); next week (= {bavlamjeftu}); last week (= {prulamjeftu}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {masti}, {nanca}.,gismu,week,jef,jeft,jeftu,,
column3: jegvo,$x_{1}$ pertains to the common Judeo-Christian-Moslem (Abrahamic) culture/religion/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.,Also Muslim.  See also {lijda}, {muslo}, {dadjo}, {xriso}.,gismu,,jeg,je'o,jegv,jegvo,,
column4: jelca,$x_{1}$ burns/[ignites/is flammable/inflammable] at temperature $x_{2}$ in atmosphere $x_{3}$.,Default $x_2$/$x_3$ to normal temperatures in air; ignite (= {jelcfa}), flammable/inflammable (usually = {jelka'e} or {jelfrili}).  See also {fagri}, {kijno}, {sigja}, {livla}, {sacki}.,gismu,burn,jel,jelc,jelca,,
column5: jemna,$x_{1}$ is a gem/polished stone/pearl of type $x_{2}$ from gemstone/material/source $x_{3}$.,Also jewel (= {jmeja'i}); gemstone (= $x_2$, $x_3$, or {jmero'i}, {jmekunra}); pearl (= {selcakyjme} - a gem found inside a shell, {tercakyjme} - a gem made of shell material, {boijme} - any ball-shaped gem), mother-of-pearl (= {cakyjme}).  See also {kunra}, {rokci}, {jadni}, {dirba}, {kargu}, {krili}, {pulji}.,gismu,gem,jme,jemn,jemna,,
column6: jenca,$x_{1}$ (event) shocks/stuns $x_{2}$.,See also {darxi}, {gunta}, {spaji}.,gismu,shock,jen,jenc,jenca,,
column7: jendu,$x_{1}$ is an axle/spindle [tool] on which $x_{2}$ rotates, of material/properties $x_{3}$.,See also se {carna}, {gunro}, {tutci}.,gismu,axle,jed,jend,jendu,,
column8: jenmi,$x_{1}$ (mass) is an army serving group/community $x_{2}$ (mass) in function $x_{3}$ (activity).,See also {bilni}, {sonci}, {xarci}.,gismu,army,jem,jei,jenm,jenmi,,
column9: jerna,$x_{1}$ (agent/person) earns/[deserves/merits] wages/salary/pay $x_{2}$ for work/service $x_{3}$ (activity).,Also $x_2$ earnings, reward (= {zanseljerna} or {nemjerna}), punishment/comeuppance (= {sfaseljerna}, {malseljerna}); $x_3$ behavior; job (= {terjerna}); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyjerna}, {posyseljerna} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {jibri}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {cnemu}, {canja}, {jdima}, {jinga}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {janta}, {kargu}, {vamji}.,gismu,deserve,earn,merit,jern,jerna,,
column10: jersi,$x_{1}$ chases/pursues/(physically) follows after $x_{2}$; volition is not implied for $x_{1}$ or $x_{2}$.,$x_1$ follows after $x_2$.  See also {kavbu}, {rivbi}, {kalte}, {lidne}.,gismu,chase,follow,je'i,jers,jersi,,
column11: jerxo,$x_{1}$ reflects Algerian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {friko}, {xrabo}, {muslo}, {fraso}.,gismu,Algerian,jex,jerx,jerxo,,
column12: jesni,$x_{1}$ is a needle [pointed shape/form, not tool] of material $x_{2}$.,See also {konju}, {pijne}, {jipno}, {kinli}.,gismu,needle,jes,jesn,jesni,,
column13: jetce,$x_{1}$ is a jet [expelled stream] of material $x_{2}$ expelled from $x_{3}$.,See also {sputu}, {vamtu}.,gismu,jet,je'e,jetc,jetce,,
column14: jetnu,$x_{1}$ (du'u) is true/truth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_{2}$.,Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {stace}, {jitfa}, {fatci}, {birti}, {cfika}.,gismu,true,truth,jet,je'u,jetn,jetnu,,
column15: je'i,logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought conn question.,,cmavo,tanru conn ?,,,,JA
column16: jei,abstractor: truth-value abstractor; $x_{1}$ is truth value of [bridi] under epistemology $x_{2}$.,,cmavo,truth abstract,jez,,,NU
column17: je'o,shift letterals to Hebrew alphabet.,,cmavo,Hebrew shift,,,,BY1
column18: jenje,$x_1$ 'copies'/acknowledges/confirms of receipt and understanding of message/transmission/communication $x_2$ from sender/station $x_3$.,"Do you copy?" = "xu do jenje"; "please copy" (command" = "(.e'o) ko jenje". See also: "{je'e}".,experimental gismu,acknowledge receipt of transmission/message,jenje,,
column19: jensi,$x_1$ is a (set/pair) of scissors/shears/clippers/(hedge) trimmers/tongs [tool] with parts/blades $x_2$ (scissor) and used for purpose $x_3$,x1 is any whole tool composed of parts (blades, x2) which slide relative to one another, usually (but not necessarily) around a common pivot, so that little distance is between the blades.  The blades need not close all the way nor do they need to be sharp or used for cutting(they could be used for grasping). Tongs typically are grasping-scissors, but tweezers are not. The emphasis is on how the blades move relative to one another and how they are connected to handles; the design is usually simple with only a few separate funtional parts. At least part of the blades should be to the side of the respective part of the other blade (so that these regions can move/slide relative to one another), even if the blades as a whole meet and cannot slide passed one another completely (such as with tongs). x1 is the whole object/tool, x2 are the parts which move relative to one another; in English, x1 could be called the "(pair of) scissors" whereas x2 could be called "the scissor (blade)".,experimental gismu,scissor,shear,tong,jensi,,
column20: jefydei,$x_1$ is the $x_2$-th day of the week $x_3$, on calendar system $x_4$,,lujvo,day of week,,,
column21: jefydeidetri,$x_1$ (number) is the date/day notation of the week of event/state $x_2$, in system $x_3$.,{jeftu} zei {djedi} zei {detri}. As default, the number $x_1$ is counted from the first day of the week. See {de'i'u} for BAI. See also {detke'u}.,lujvo,day of the week,,,
column22: jefydiknalgundei,$x_1$=$di_1$=$dj_1$ is a regularly-occurring period of days off work [weekend] lasting $x_2$=$dj_2$ days, recurring every $x_3$=$j_2$=$di_3$ weeks (default 1), for worker $x_4$=$g_1$, at job $x_5$=$g_2$,cf. {nalgundei}, {jeftu}, {dikni}, {gunka}, {djedi}, {di'i}, {na'e}; "Weekend" (the last two days in a week, presumed to be a rest from work) is a culture-specific concept. It was felt more appropriate to make a word meaning "work holiday" and leave the days/week[s] to be specified by the person.,lujvo,weekend,,,
column23: jefyfa'o,$x_1$ is the weekend of week $x_2$,,lujvo,weekend,weekend,,,
column24: jefygundei,$x_1$ is a weekday (typical working day of the week) of week $x_2$, according to culture/custom $x_3$,See {jefsurdei}, {jeftu}, {gunka}, {djedi}, {detri},lujvo,weekday,,,
column25: jegycestu'a,$x_1$ is an expanse of sanctified/consecrated land/ground in an Abrahmic faith/religion, and which is located at $x_2$,Not the Holy Land ({jegvocestu'a}), although that region contains many such sites and may be viewed by some to be generally consecrated.,lujvo,consecrated land,,,
column26: jelbo'i,$x_1$ is a molotov's cocktail/bottle bomb containing $x_2$,from {jelca} + {botpi},lujvo,bottle bomb,molotov's cocktail,,,
column27: jelgau,$g_1$ burns $j_1$.,,lujvo,burn,,,
column28: jelka'e,$x_1$ is flammable / inflammable under conditions $x_2$,See {jelca}, {kakne},lujvo,flammable,inflammable,,,
column29: jelnanba,$n_1$=$j_1$ is toasted bread made from grain(s) $n_2$.,Cf. {jelca}, {nanba}, {titnanba}.,lujvo,toast,,,
column30: jelspo,$d_1$ (event) burns down $x_2$=$j_1$=$d_2$.,Cf. {jelspogau}.,lujvo,burn down,,,
column31: jemja'a,j$a_1$ is a general of army $je_1$ serving country/nation/group $je_2$ (mass) in function $je_3$ (activity).,Cf. {jenmi}, {jatna}, {vairsoi}.,lujvo,general,,,
column32: jempau,$x_1$ is an army corps, a subdivision of army unit $x_2$ which serves country/nation/group $x_3$.,Cf. {jenmi}, {pagbu}, {jempaupau}, {jempausle}.,lujvo,army corps,corps,,,
column33: jempaupau,$x_1$ is an army division, a subdivision of army unit $x_2$ which serves country/nation/group $x_3$.,Cf. Cf. {jenmi}, {pagbu}, {jempau}, {jempausle}.,lujvo,army division,division,,,
column34: jempausle,$x_1$ is an army brigade/regiment, a subdivision of army unit $x_2$ which serves country/nation/group $x_3$.,Cf. {jenmi}, {pagbu}, {selci}, {jempaupau}, {jempau}, {songri}.,lujvo,army brigade,army regiment,brigade,regiment,,,
column35: jemyzda,$z_1$ is a military base for armed forces $j_1$ serving group/community $j_2$ in function $j_3$.,,lujvo,base,,,
column36: jenselte'a,$x1$=$j1$=$t2$ is horrible to $x2$=$j2$=$t1$,,lujvo,horrible,,,
column38: jernysoi,$x_1$=$s_1$=$j_1$ is a mercenary hired by $x_2$=$s_2$ for battles $x_3$=$j_3$ to earn money $x_4$=$j_2$,from {jerna} + {sonci},lujvo,mercenary,,,
column39: jeske'a,$x_1$ is a needle eye of needle $x_2$,from {jesni} + {kevna},lujvo,needle eye,,,
column40: jespezli,$p_1$=$j_1$ is a needle [pointy leaf] of plant $j_2$.,See also: {jesni}, {pezli}.,lujvo,needle,,,
column42: jesymabru,$x_1$ is a hedgehog/spiny anteater of species $x_2$.,general term for spiny mammals; see also {ernace}, {zalgosu}, {jesyratcu},lujvo,hedgehog,spiny anteater,,,
column43: jesyratcu,$x_1$ is a porcupine of species $x_2$.,,lujvo,porcupine,,,
column44: jesyspa,$s_1$ is a cactus of species $s_2$.,,lujvo,cactus,,,
column45: jesystani,$s_1$ is a thorn of plant/species $s_2$,{stani} {jesni},lujvo,thorn,,,
column46: jetfrica,$x_1$ and $x_2$ have a different truth value; only one of $x_1$ and $x_2$ is true,See also .{onai}, {jetydu'i}, {kaxyje'u}, {vlinyje'u}.,lujvo,exclusive or,XOR,,,
column47: jetkai,$x_1$ is genuinely $x_2$ (ka) by standard $x_3$,E.g. "genuine money", as opposed to counterfeit. See {jetnu}, {ckaji}, {jifkai}, {markai}, {virtukai},lujvo,genuine,genuinely,,,
column48: jetka'u,$x_{1}$ is a quantum.,,lujvo,bit [binary digit; computer unit],,,
column49: jetlai,$x_1$ has truth-value $x_2$ under metaphysics $x_3$ on scale $x_4$.,See also {jei},lujvo,,,,
column50: jetmlu,$x_1$ (du'u) seems true to $x_2$ by epistemology $x_3$,See also {simlu}, {jetnu}, {faumlu}.,lujvo,seem true,,,
column51: jetpai,$p_1$ judges the veracity of $p_2$=$j_1$ by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_3$=$j_2$.,Cf. {tcica}, {stace}, {jetnu}, {jitfa}.,lujvo,judge,,,
column52: jetrinsku,$x_1$ makes $x_2$ (du'u) true by expressing it (performative act); $x_2$ is true because $x_1$ claims it to be so,See also {ca'e}, {ca'engau}.,lujvo,performative,,,
column53: jetsmi,$x_1$ seems to be the case to cognizer $x_2$.,,lujvo,,,,
column54: jetycipra,$x_1$ is a test for determining whether $x_2$ is the case.,See also {cipra}.,lujvo,,,,
column55: jek zei uanta,$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'jek' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.,Inner structure of the rule: NA? SE? JA NAI?. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.,zei-lujvo,,,,
column56: jetnu zei uidje,$u_1$ is a checkbox in user interface $u_2$.,The definition includes tri-state checkboxes as well. See also: {gribatke zei uidje}, {uidje}.,zei-lujvo,check box,checkbox,,,
column57: jegvocestu'a,$x_1$ pertains to the geography/culture/history(/diaspora/descendents) of the Abrahamic Holy Land in property/aspect $x_2$,This is a specific geographical location constituting parts of the eastern Mediterranean and Arabian peninsula, possibly among other contiguous regions. Use {jegycestu'a} for a more generalized "sanctified land". This is a politically neutral term; moreover, it can be used by people of all religions with implications of them and cruelly be living the region to be holy (in general or any part thereof), although it does contain a tacit acknowledgement of the regions intimate connection to the various Abrahamic religions.,fu'ivla,Holy Land,the Holy Land,jegvocestu'a,,
column58: jemnrsapfiro,$x_1$ is a sapphire [gem/polished stone] of type $x_2$ from source $x_3$.,Cf. {kunrsapfiro}, {jemna}.,fu'ivla,sapphire,jemnrsapfiro,,
column61: jei'o,$x_1$ is PA weeks in duration by standard $x_2$.,Example "pu lo re jei'o" meaning "two weeks ago". See also {jeftu}, {nei'o}, {lei'o}, {doi'e}, {coi'e}, {moi'e}, {soi'e}, {cei'a}.,experimental cmavo,,,,,MOI
column62: jei'u,evidential: I intuit... / I suspect...,Contains no negative connotation. See {jijnu}, {jijyji'i}, {pe'i},experimental cmavo,I intuit,I suspect,,,,UI2
column63: je ku'i,but,Compared to {je} and {ku'i} separately this compound more closely corresponds to English 'but', which has meanings of both a conjunction and a discursive.,cmavo-compound,,,,
column64: je nai,logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought x but not y.,,cmavo-compound,tanru but not,,,,JA*
column65: jgalu,$x_{1}$ is a/the claw/nail/talon [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: pointed, penetrating, physical weapon].,See also {denci}, {jirna}, {batci}.,gismu,claw,ja'u,jgal,jgalu,,
column66: jganu,$x_{1}$ is an angle [2-dimensional shape/form] from vertex $x_{2}$ subtended by lateral [segment] $x_{3}$.,Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is angular; $x_2$ corner; (segment $x_3$ can be defined by interval).  See also {kojna}, {linji}, {konju}, {mokca}.,gismu,angle,jga,jgan,jganu,,
column67: jgari,$x_{1}$ grasps/holds/clutches/seizes/grips/[hugs] $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ (part of $x_{1}$) at locus $x_{4}$ (part of $x_{2}$).,Hug (= {birjai}, {pamjai}); handshake (= {xanjaisi'u}); hold with hands (= {xanjai}); handle (= {jaitci}).  See also {ralte}, {pencu}, {darxi}, {batke}, {rinju}.,gismu,grasp,hold,jai,jgar,jgari,,
column68: jgena,$x_{1}$ is a knot/tangle in/between $x_{2}$ (object/jo'u-objects).,Knot (verb = {jgegau}, {jgezu'e}, {jgeri'a}, {jgela'a}), knot: fastening between two or more cords (= {jgeterjo'e}).  See also {pluja}, {julne}, {lasna}, {skori}.,gismu,knot,jge,jgen,jgena,,
column69: jgina,$x_{1}$ is a gene of creature [or locus on creature] $x_{2}$ determining trait/process $x_{3}$.,Also chromosome = ({gincilta}, {ginpoi}).  See also {cerda}.,gismu,gene,gin,jgin,jgina,,
column70: jgira,$x_{1}$ (person) feels/has pride in/about $x_{2}$ (abstraction).,An emotional combination of satisfaction and respect/esteem towards property(ies) or action(s) of person/entity that has a specific tie to emoter; self-pride (= {se'ijgi}, {tolcumla}); use $x_2$ tu'a for pride in non-specific actions/properties of someone.  See also {cinmo}, {cumla}, {sevzi}, {sinma}, {snada}.,gismu,pride,jgi,jgir,jgira,,
column71: jgita,$x_{1}$ is guitar/violin/fiddle/harp [stringed musical instrument] with actuator/plectrum/bow $x_{2}$.,Also lute, viola, cello.  See also {zgike}.,gismu,guitar,git,jgit,jgita,,
column72: jibni,$x_{1}$ is near/close to/approximates $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni).,See also {darno}, {nenri}, {vanbi}, {jbini}, {lamji}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {bartu}, {diklo}, {stuzi}.,gismu,near,jbi,jibn,jibni,,
column73: jibri,$x_{1}$ is a job/occupation/employment/vocation (a type of work regularly done for pay) of person $x_{2}$.,Working for another (= {selplijibri}).  See also {briju}, {gunka}, {te} {jerna} which is employment specifically for pay and not specifically for another, {te} {pilno} which is employment not necessarily for pay and not necessarily regular or lasting but for another, {se} {gasnu} and {se} {zukte} for incidental activities.,gismu,job,jib,jibr,jibri,,
column74: jicla,$x_{1}$ (object, or event: force) stirs/mixes/[roils/agitates] fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$.,Convection (= {nenflejicla}); agentive stirring (= {jiclygau}, {jiclyzu'e}).  See also {fanza}, {tunta}, {mixre}.,gismu,stir,jicl,jicla,,
column75: jicmu,$x_{1}$ is a basis/foundation/underlying or fundamental principle of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is at the bottom of $x_{2}$.,$x_2$ is founded on basis $x_1$ (= {selcmu} for reordered places); (adjective:) $x_1$ is basic/basal/fundamental); (generally events and properties will be bases for events and states, while objects may be bases/bottoms for objects).  See also cmavo list {ji'u}, {jamfu}, {zbepi}, {genja}, {krasi}.,gismu,basic,basis,principle,cmu,jicm,jicmu,ji'u,se ji'u,

column2: ji,logical connective: sumti afterthought connective question.,,cmavo,sumti conn ?,,,,A
column3: ji'a,discursive: additionally.,See also {jmina}.,cmavo,also,as well,besides,in addition,too,,,,UI3b
column4: jguvi,$x_1$ is a monster of species/variety $x_2$, Mandarin "gui"; Cantonese "gwaai3" (monster, strange),experimental gismu,,jguvi,,
column5: jicfo,$x_1$ is after $x_2$ in sequence $x_3$,Synonym of {selyli'e}. See {lidne}.,experimental gismu,after,follow,jicfo,,
column6: jetydu'i,$x_1$ and $x_2$ have the same truth value; either both or none of $x_1$ and $x_2$ is true,See also .{o}, {jo}, {gi'o}, {go}, {jetfrica}, {kaxyje'u}, {vlinyje'u}.,lujvo,both or none,if and only if,,,
column7: jetyja'o,$x_1$ proves / provides evidence for / demonstrates the truth of $x_2$ (du'u) to audience $x_3$,,lujvo,prove,,,
column8: je'utra,$x_1$ pretends $x_2$ is true; $x_1$ behaves as someone would behave if they knew $x_2$ to be true,,lujvo,pretend,,,
column9: jexru'u,$r_1$ is measured in algerian dinar (.DZD) as $r_2$ (quantity), in the Algerian monetary system $r_3$.,,lujvo,algerian dinar,,,
column10: jezystisni,$sin_1$ signals whether $sin_3$=$sis_1$ should stop; $sin_1$ is a traffic light,also pedestrian signal (jezystisni lo cadzu),lujvo,traffic light,,,
column11: ji'apro,$f_1$=$j_1$ defeats $f_2$=$j_3$ in competition $f_3$=$j_4$.,Cf. {fapro}, {jinga}, {bandu}.,lujvo,beat,defeat,,,
column12: je'urna,$x_1$ induces from their auditive perception that $x_2$ is the case.,,fu'ivla,,je'urna,,
column13: jgitrvolino,$x_1$ is violin/fiddle/ with bow $x_2$.,Cf. {jgita}, {jgitrxu}, {mosyjgita}, {zgica'a}.,fu'ivla,fiddle,violin,jgitrvolino,,
column14: jgitrxu,x$_1$ is an erhu with bow $x_2$.,Cf. {jgita}, {jgitrviolino}, {jgitrpipa}, {mosyjgita}, {zgica'a}.,fu'ivla,erhu,jgitrxu,,
column15: je'u'a,logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought always true.,Created to complete the scope of truth tables to include TTTT and FFFF, despite being described as relatively useless. Etymology: j + jetnu + A.,experimental cmavo,Always True,,,,JA
