column2: jezyje'u,$x_1$ is the truth value / degree of truth of $x_2$ (bridi) by epistemology/metaphysics $x_3$,See also {jetnu}, {jei},lujvo,degree of truth,truth value,,,
column3: jgegau,$g_1$ ties $j_1$ in a knot.,,lujvo,tie,,,
column4: jgenanba,$j_1$=$j_2$=$n_1$ is a pretzel made from grains $n_2$.,,lujvo,pretzel,,,
column5: jgicro,$c_1$=$j_1$ is offended/[feels hurt pride] about $j_2$ (abstraction).,Cf. {jgira}, {cortu}, {cnicro}, {cnixai}.,lujvo,affronted,feel affronted,feel hurt,feel insulted,feel offended,insulted,offended,,,
column6: jgidu'esku,$x1$=$j1$=$d1$=$c1$ boasts/brags $x2$=$j2$=$c2$ (text) to audience $x3$=$c3$ via medium $x4$=$c4$,,lujvo,boast,brag,,,
column7: jibgaucpe,$x_1$ applies for job $x_2$ to $x_3$ in form $x_4$.,The $x_3$ is likely the future employer. The $x_4$ can be used to say "apply online" or "apply by mail". See also {jibri}, {gasnu}, {cpedu}.,lujvo,apply,,,
column8: jibmu'o,$j_2$=$m_1$ quits/retires from job $j_1$,Elided SE from se jibri mulno.,lujvo,quit,retire,,,
column9: jibybre,$b_1$=$j_2$ is ready for the (paid) job/occupation/employment/vocation $j_1$.,Cf. {gunbre},lujvo,,,,
column10: jibycu'e,$c_1$ is a trade/vocational school at $c_2$ teaching job skills $c_3$=$j_1$ to audience/community $c_4$=$j_2$ operated by $c_5$,,lujvo,trade school,vocational school,,,
column11: jibykai,$x_1$ does their job / works (activity done regularly for pay).,Since {gunka} doesn't require working in the sense of a job, this word is necessary. It differs from {jibgu'a} in that one could perform their job without satisfying {gunka}.,lujvo,work,,,
column12: jibykansa,$k_1$ is a coworker/colleague of $k_2$=$j_2$ in job/occupation $j_1$,k3 is implicitly "lo nu se jibri j1",lujvo,colleague,coworker,,,
column13: jibypante,$p_1$=$j_2$ strikes (stops working), complaining about $p_2$=$j_1$ to audience $p_3$ with action $p_4$.,Cf. {pante}, {jibri}, {cpedu}.,lujvo,strike,,,
column14: jibypilno,$x_1$=$p_1$ hires $x_2$=$p_2$ for position/work $x_3$=$p_3$=$j_1$,from {jibri} + {pilno},lujvo,hire,,,
column15: jibytreicyfamti,$x_1$ is work-heirarchy "uncle/aunt" of $x_2$ via relation/partial ordering $x_3$; $x_1$ is either (in a narrow sense) a direct subordinate of the direct boss/superior/manager of $x_2$'s direct boss/superior/manager, or is (in a broader sense) an equal-level co-worker of $x_2$'s direct boss/superior/manager (no matter the exact relation).,This word is a brapagjvo from "{treicu}". See also: "{jatny'utka}".,lujvo,co-worker of boss,work aunt,work-heirarchy uncle/aunt,work uncle,,,
column16: jibyxelflese,$x_1$ is a professional philosopher/philosophe with job/position $x_2$, associated with philosophy $x_3$,{flese} is an experimental gismu.  For a more symmetric and descriptive lujvo, see: {creseljibyxelflese}; for a less descriptive lujvo see: {xelflese}; see also: {filsofo}, {crexelflese}, {flese}.,lujvo,philosophe,philosopher,,,
column17: jicfle,$x1$=$f_1$ is a tributary of $x2$=$f_2$ flowing in direction to/towards $x3$=$f_3$=$j_1$ from direction/source $x4$=$f_4$,{jimca}+{flecu},lujvo,tributary,,,
column18: jicycma,$c_1$ is a twig/sprig of $j_2$,from {jimca} {cmalu},lujvo,sprig,twig,,,
column19: jicyjutsi'o,$x_1$ is cladistics about organisms $x_2$ according to $x_3$.,,lujvo,cladistics,,,
column20: jicymivykle,$k_1$=$jm_1$=$ji_3$ is a phylum [animals]/division [plants] within/of kingdom [biology] $k_2$=$ji_2$.,From {jimca}, {jmive}, {klesi}. For biological cathegory in general (={ji'eske} {klesi}), domain (=?), kingdom (={seljimcymivykle}), phylum (=this definition), class (={xeljutsi}), order (={veljutsi}), family (={terjutsi}), genus (={seljutsi}), species (={jutsi}).,lujvo,division,phylum,,,
column21: je'unse,$x_1$ perceives that $x_2$ is the case (inference from perception).,,fu'ivla,,je'unse,,
column22: jgenrtrefoili,$x_1$ is a trefoil knot (shape/object) with characteristics $x_2$,Not necessarily mathematical. Chirality, tightness, etc. may be specified in the x2 terbri. See also:  {trifoli},  {spartrifoli},fu'ivla,trefoil,trefoil knot,jgenrtrefoili,,
column23: jgitrgitara,$x_1$ is guitar with plectrum $x_2$.,Cf. {jgita}, {jgitrsita}, {jgitrpipa}, {zgica'a}.,fu'ivla,guitar,jgitrgitara,,
column24: jgitrnikelarpa,$x_1$ is a nyckelharpa [traditional swedish string instrument] with bow $x_2$.,,fu'ivla,nyckelharpa,jgitrnikelarpa,,
column25: jgitrpipa,x$_1$ is a pipa.,Cf. {jgita}, {jgitrgitara}, {zgica'a}, {jgitrsita}.,fu'ivla,pipa,jgitrpipa,,
column26: jgitrsita,$x_1$ is sitar with plectrum $x_2$.,Cf. {jgita}, {jgitrgitara}, {jgitrpipa}, {zgica'a}.,fu'ivla,sitar,jgitrsita,,
column27: jglandi,$x_1$ is a walnut of species $x_2$.,see also {narge}, {tricu},fu'ivla,walnut,jglandi,,
column28: ji'a'a,logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought always false.,Created to complete the scope of truth tables to include TTTT and FFFF, despite being described as relatively useless. Etymology: j + jitfa + A.,experimental cmavo,Always False,,,,JA
column29: jgitrviolino,x$_1$ is violin/fiddle/ with bow $x_2$.,Cf. {jgita}, {jgitrxu}, {mosyjgita}, {zgica'a}.,obsolete fu'ivla,fiddle,violin,jgitrviolino,,
column30: jgitrviolino zei konceto,$x_1$ is violin concerto number $x_2$ in key $x_3$ composed by $x_4$ performed by/at $x_5$( event).,Cf. {zgike}, {nolzgi}, {konceto zei pagbu}, {konceto}, {jgitrviolino}, {pipnrpiano zei konceto}, {simfoni}, {zgifi'i}.,obsolete zei-lujvo,concerto, violin,violin concerto,,,
column31: ji'a cu'i,discursive: continuing/extending/belaboring the point,See also: "{ke'u}".,cmavo-compound,continuing the point,,,,UI*
column32: ji'ai,job descriptor: the one which does ,,experimental cmavo,job descriptor,,,,LE
column33: ji'a nai,discursive: returning to or correcting a previous point, moving back in the conversation/discourse,If "{ji'a}" is "additionally", then this is "subtractionally".,cmavo-compound,returning to previous point in discourse,,,,UI*
column34: ji'a sai,even,Used to indicate an intense additional case or intense additional cases. ex.) lo xagji cribe cu citka lo cinki ku ji'a sai (A hungry bear will eat even insects.),cmavo-compound,even,,,,UI*3b
column35: jijnu,$x_{1}$ (person) intuits $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$; [epistemology].,Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {djuno}, {facki}, {jimpe}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {sidbo}, {smadi}.,gismu,intuit,jij,jijn,jijnu,,
column36: jikca,$x_{1}$ interacts/behaves socially with $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ socializes with/is sociable towards $x_{2}$.,See also {tarti}, {penmi}.,gismu,social,socialize,jik,jikc,jikca,,
column37: jikru,$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of liquor/spirits distilled from $x_{2}$.,See also {barja}, {vanju}, {birje}, {xalka}.,gismu,liquor,jikr,jikru,,
column38: jilka,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali/base of composition including $x_{2}$.,(adjective:) $x_1$ is alkaline.  See also {sodna}, {bakri}, {sodva}.,gismu,alkali,jil,jilk,jilka,,
column39: jilra,$x_{1}$ (person) is jealous of/envies $x_{2}$ (person) about/for $x_{3}$ (property - ka).,See also {cinmo}.,gismu,jealous,jilr,jilra,,
column40: jimca,$x_{1}$ is a branch/bough/limb of $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ forks into branches $x_{1}$; [preferred over metaphorical birka].,Also appendage.  See also {birka}, {rebla}, {tuple}.,gismu,branch,jic,jimc,jimca,,
column41: jimpe,$x_{1}$ understands/comprehends fact/truth $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ understands (fi) $x_{3}$.,See also {djuno}, {jijnu}, {morna}, {smuni}, {saske}, {viska}.,gismu,understand,jmi,jimp,jimpe,,
column42: jimte,$x_{1}$ is a limit/extreme/bound/border/[confinement] of $x_{2}$ in property/domain $x_{3}$.,Restrain/constrain within limits (= {jitri'u}, {jitygau}, {jityzu'e}).  See also cmavo list {ji'e}, {traji}, {korbi}, {kuspe}, {rinju}, {bapli}, {curmi}, {fanta}, {jbini}.,gismu,limit,jit,jimt,jimte,ji'e,se ji'e,te ji'e,
column43: jinci,$x_{1}$ is a pair of shears/scissors for cutting $x_{2}$.,See also {katna}.,gismu,shears,jinc,jinci,,
column44: jinga,$x_{1}$ (person/team) wins/gains prize $x_{2}$ from/over $x_{3}$ [competitors/losers] in competition $x_{4}$.,Also: $x_1$ is a victor; $x_2$ reward; $x_3$ competitors here are opponents and in many situations, defeated/losers, vs. the set of those competing for a goal; $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyji'a}, {posyselji'a} for unambiguous semantics).   See also {cirko}, {jivna}, {talsa}, {cnemu}, {prali}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {bradi}, {kargu}, {kelci}.,gismu,win,jig,ji'a,jing,jinga,,
column45: jinku,$x_{1}$ is a vaccine/immune-system stimulant protecting $x_{2}$ against disease $x_{3}$ introduced by method $x_{4}$.,Also serum; inoculation (= {jestu'u} {veljinku}). See also {jurme}, {mikce}, {jesni}, {bilma}.,gismu,vaccine,jink,jinku,,
column46: jinme,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of made of metal of composition including $x_{2}$.,(adjective:) $x_1$ is metallic.  See also {cnisa}, {gasta}, {lastu}, {margu}, {nikle}, {ransu}, {romge}, {sodna}, {tinci}, {tirse}, {tunka}, {zinki}, {kunra}, {sodva}.,gismu,metal,jim,jinm,jinme,,
column47: jinru,$x_{1}$ (object/person) is immersed/submerged/bathes in liquid $x_{2}$.,Take a bath/bathe (= {jirsezlu'i}).  See also {lumci}, {nenri}, {jinsa}.,gismu,immersed,submerged,jir,jinr,jinru,,
column48: jinsa,$x_{1}$ (object) is clean/pure of material/contaminant/dirt $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.,See also {lumci}, {jinru}, {curve}, {sepli}.,gismu,clean,jis,jins,jinsa,,
column49: jinto,$x_{1}$ is a well/spring of fluid $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.,See also {krasi}, {djacu}, {fenra}.,gismu,well,jint,jinto,,
column50: jinvi,$x_{1}$ thinks/opines $x_{2}$ [opinion] (du'u) is true about subject/issue $x_{3}$ on grounds $x_{4}$.,Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also cmavo list {pe'i}, {djuno}, {krici}, {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {senpi}, {sidbo}, {birti}, {pinka}.,gismu,opine,jiv,ji'i,jinv,jinvi,,
column51: jinzi,$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is an innate/inherent/intrinsic/natural property/quality/aspect of $x_{2}$.,See also {lakne}, {rarna}, {stati}, cmavo list {ka'e}, {tcaci}.,gismu,innate,proper,jiz,jinz,jinzi,,
column52: jipci,$x_{1}$ is a chicken/[hen/cock/rooster]/small fowl [a type of bird] of species/breed $x_{2}$.,See also {cipni}.,gismu,chicken,jipc,jipci,,
column53: jipno,$x_{1}$ is a tip/point/vertex/extremity/end [0-dimension shape/form] on object $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.,See also {mokca}, {jesni}, {fanmo}, {kojna}, {krasi}.,gismu,tip,jip,ji'o,jipn,jipno,,
column54: jirna,$x_{1}$ is a/the horn [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: pointed extremity].,See also {jgalu}, {bongu}.,gismu,horn,jirn,jirna,,
column55: jisra,$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of juice/nectar from-source/of-type $x_{2}$.,Water-based extract from a (generally) biological source. See also {pinxe}, {djacu}, {grute}, {stagi}.,gismu,juice,jisr,jisra,,
column56: jitfa,$x_{1}$ (du'u) is false/is an untruth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_{2}$.,Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {fatci}, {stace}, {jetnu}, {cfika}.,gismu,false,jif,jitf,jitfa,,
column57: jitro,$x_{1}$ has control over/harnesses/manages/directs/conducts $x_{2}$ in $x_{3}$ (activity/event/performance).,$x_2$ are aspects/individuals controlled within activity/event $x_3$; manage (= {selzuktro}, {selzukfu'e}, {gu'etro}, {gunfu'e}, {xaktro}, {xakfu'e}) (as distinct from manager/boss = {gunterbe'e}, {gunja'a}, {gunmi'e}, {gunca'i}).  (cf. cmavo list {ji'o}, {bapli}, te {bende}, {gidva} - which does not necessarily control or command, {jatna}, {macnu}, {minde}, {ponse}, {ralju}, {rinka}, {sazri}, {turni}, {vlipa}, {xance}, {xlura}),gismu,control,tro,jitr,jitro,ji'o,se ji'o,te ji'o,
column59: jivna,$x_{1}$ competes/vies with opponent $x_{2}$ in contest/competition $x_{3}$ (event) for gain $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ rivals $x_{2}$.,Also $x_2$ opponent(s), competitor(s), rival(s); $x_3$ competition, race; $x_4$ prize, reward, recognition (gain may be internal or external).  See also {cnemu}, {jinga}, {talsa}, {bradi}, {fapro}, {kelci}.,gismu,compete,jvi,jivn,jivna,,
column60: jmaji,$x_{1}$ (mass/jo'u) gathers/collects at location $x_{2}$ from locations $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).,Also focus (= {seljmaji}).  See also {crepu}.,gismu,gather,jaj,jmaj,jmaji,,
column61: jmifa,$x_{1}$ is a shoal [shallow hazard]/reef of material $x_{2}$ in body of water $x_{3}$.,Rapids (= {ri'erjmifa}, {ri'ercaxno}).  See also {caxno}.,gismu,reef,shoal,jmif,jmifa,,
column62: jmina,$x_{1}$ adds/combines $x_{2}$ to/with $x_{3}$, with result $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ augments $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.,See also {zmadu}, {banro}, {sumji}, {zenba}, {setca}.,gismu,add,min,jmin,jmina,,
column63: jmive,$x_{1}$ lives/is alive by standard $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an organism/living thing.,(adjective:) $x_1$ is vital, organic.  See also {lifri}, {morsi}, {stuzi}, {zvati}, {xabju}.,gismu,live,miv,ji'e,jmiv,jmive,,
column64: jordo,$x_{1}$ reflects Jordanian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {filso}.,gismu,Jordanian,jor,jo'o,jord,jordo,,
column65: jorne,$x_{1}$ is joined to/connects to/is united with $x_{2}$ at common locus $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ are a union.,Also joined/fastened/attached by joint $x_3$/by means of $x_3$/with fastener $x_3$; fastener (= {jo'etci}, {jonvelyla'a}); train, sequence of joined objects (= {jonpoi}; {porjo'e} for a single object joined into a sequence).  See also {lasna}, {fenso}, {kansa}, {pencu}, {penmi}.,gismu,joined,jon,jo'e,jorn,jorne,,
column66: jubme,$x_{1}$ is a table/flat solid upper surface of material $x_{2}$, supported by legs/base/pedestal $x_{3}$.,See also {ckana}, {jamfu}, {nilce}, {zbepi}, {tsina}, {stizu}.,gismu,table,jub,jbu,jubm,jubme,,
column67: judri,$x_{1}$ is an address of/are coordinates of $x_{2}$ in system $x_{3}$.,See also {tcita}, {cmene}, {ciste}, {stuzi}.,gismu,address,judr,judri,,
column68: jufra,$x_{1}$ (text) is a sentence/statement about $x_{2}$ [topic/subject/predicate/focus] in language $x_{3}$.,Phrase (= {jufpau}, {suzrelvla}, {suzvla}, {gensle}).  See also {valsi}, {bangu}, {gerna}, {cusku}, {smuni}.,gismu,sentence,juf,ju'a,jufr,jufra,,
column69: jukni,$x_{1}$ is a spider/arachnid/crustacean/crab/lobster/non-insect arthropod of species/breed $x_{2}$.,Due to the unusual grouping of concepts in this definition, {ankabuta} is favored for "spider". See also {cinki}, {danlu}.,gismu,,juk,jukn,jukni,,
column70: jukpa,$x_{1}$ cooks/prepares food-for-eating $x_{2}$ by recipe/method $x_{3}$ (process).,Cook with heat (= {glajukpa}, {glaterjukpa}), bake (= {tokyjukpa}); fry (= {rasyjukpa}).  See also {cupra}, {bredi}.,gismu,cook,jup,jukp,jukpa,,
column71: julne,$x_{1}$ is a net/filter allowing passage of $x_{2}$, prohibiting passage of $x_{3}$, netting properties $x_{4}$.,Also sieve.  See also {komcu}, {ciste}, {jgena}.,gismu,block,net,ju'e,juln,julne,,
column72: jundi,$x_{1}$ is attentive towards/attends/tends/pays attention to object/affair $x_{2}$.,See also {kurji}, {zvati}.,gismu,attend,attentive,follow,mind,jud,ju'i,jund,jundi,,
column73: jungo,$x_{1}$ reflects Chinese [Mandarin, Cantonese, Wu, etc.] culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {xazdo}.,gismu,Chinese,jug,jung,jungo,,
column74: jvinu,$x_{1}$ is the view/scene/panorama/sight/prospect of $x_{2}$ (object/location) from point-of-view $x_{3}$.,Also $x_1$ is on display to $x_2$/$x_3$.  See also {catlu}, {kanla}, {viska}, {canko}, {jarco}.,gismu,scene,sight,view,vin,ji'u,jvin,jvinu,,
column75: kabri,$x_{1}$ is a cup/glass/tumbler/mug/vessel/[bowl] containing contents $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.,A kabri is normally eaten from by lifting it; a palta is not.  See also {palta}, {citka}, {blaci}, {tansi}.,gismu,cup,kabr,kabri,,
column76: kacma,$x_{1}$ is a camera/photographic equipment recording illumination type $x_{2}$ images to medium $x_{3}$.,See also {lenjo}.,gismu,camera,kacm,kacma,,
column77: kadno,$x_{1}$ reflects Canadian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {bemro}, {glico}.,gismu,Canadian,kadn,kadno,,
column78: ji'e,{jimte} modal, 1st place                            limitedly; up to limit ...,,cmavo,up to limit,,,,BAI
column79: ji'i,digit/number: approximately (default the typical value in this context) (number).,,cmavo,approximately,,,,PA4
column80: ji'o,{jitro} modal, 1st place (control)                  controlledly; under direction of ...,,cmavo,under direction of,,,,BAI
column81: ji'u,{jicmu} modal, 1st place (assumptions);             given that ...; based on ...,,cmavo,based on,,,,BAI
column85: jo'i,join mathematical expression (mex) operands into an array.,,cmavo,array,,,,JOhI
column86: joi,non-logical connective: mixed conjunction; "and" meaning "mixed together", forming a mass.,,cmavo,in a mass with,jol,joi,,,JOI
column88: jo'u,non-logical connective: in common with; along with (unmixed).,,cmavo,in common with,jo'u,,,JOI

column2: jy,letteral for j.,,cmavo,j,,,,BY2
column3: ka,abstractor: property/quality abstractor (-ness); $x_{1}$ is quality/property exhibited by [bridi].,,cmavo,lambda,property abstract,kam,,,NU
column4: ka'a,{klama} modal, 1st place                            gone to by ...,,cmavo,gone to by,,,,BAI
column5: jidge,$x_1$ has the opportunity to do/be $x_2$ (event/property) under conditions $x_3$; $x_1$ gets to do $x_2$,Parallels {kakne}, but with emphasis on opportunity rather than potential. See also {prali}, {xamgu}, {zukte}. Proposed rafsi -jid-,experimental gismu,get to,opportunity,jid,jidge,,
column6: jijgi,$x_{1}$ is a connective question, requesting the connective between $x_{2}$ (du'u) and $x_{3}$ (du'u) in that order, assuming that they are true.,This word is to "{ji}" approzimately as "{kanxe}" is to "{je}". See also: {vlina}, {kanxe}, {tsida}, {ribga}.,experimental gismu,connective question,jijgi,,
column7: jikfi,$x_1$ is a physical interaction [colloquially: force] between $x_2$ (interacting participants/objects; symmetric) with characteristics/of type $x_3$,Not necessarily fundamental. Can include: forces ({forse}), pressures ({danre}), the fundamental interactions ({tsaba}, {dicma}, {vubla}, {grava}), the 'Higgs' mechanism ({xigzo}), etc. Direction (as of application) can be specified in $x_3$. See also {fisli}.,experimental gismu,physical interaction,jikfi,,
column8: jikni,$x_1$ consists of the economic system (production and distribution and consumption) of sector components $x_2$; $x_1$ is economic.,x2 may be a country or other area, the labor, capital and land resources, and the economic agents that socially participate in the production, exchange, distribution, and consumption of goods and services of that area; they may be joined with JOI. {pavmomseljikni} for "primary sector", {relmomseljikni} for "secondary sector", {cibmomseljikni} for "tertiary sector", and {vonmomseljikni} for "quaternary sector"; {gubyseljikni} for "public/state sector", {sivyseljikni} for "private sector", and {jikseljikni} for "social/voluntary sector". Cf. {venci'e}, {selpraci'e}.,experimental gismu,economic,economy,jikni,,
column9: jitni,$x_1$ pertains to politics/political affairs/political dynamics/interactions in system $x_2$, involving actors $x_3$ (set), and concerning topic $x_4$.,This word focuses on the dynamic of social maneuvering or strategic interaction. It is general in that is is intended to handle any dynamic involving social strategizing and execution for the purpose of achieving some goal or gaining/maintaining power/authority. It happens in work places, in schools, in families - not just governing. For that specific sense, use a tanru or lujvo. See also: {trucu'u}, {jikca}.,experimental gismu,political dynamics,politics,jitni,,
column10: jmite,$x_1$ meets (encounters for the first time) $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$,From Loglan "jmite". Refers to "meeting" in the sense of "first becoming acquainted with/introduced to." For the more literal sense of individuals encountering one another at a given location, see {penmi}.,experimental gismu,encounter,meet,jmite,,
column11: jonse,$x_1$ accesses $x_2$ for purpose $x_3$, access/interaction in manner $x_4$; $x_1$ approaches / reaches / interacts with / reads / uses $x_2$.,See {kargau}, {jorne}, {cpacu}, {tcidu}, {pilno}, {gasnu}. This word is intended to have a very broad meaning. Proposed rafsi: "-jos-".,experimental gismu,access,jos,jonse,,
column12: jviso,$x_1$ is the ISO designation/result/standard/code for topic $x_2$ applied to specific case/individual/group/thing $x_3$ according to rule/ISO specification $x_4$ published by/according to mandating organization $x_5$ (default: ISO),Theoretically, the standard organization/body could be other than ISO, but it should be prominent and/or international (and internationally recognized) in scope and nature; in such a case, replace each occurrence of "ISO" in the definition with the appropriate name/designation/title (of the organization, etc.). x1 need not be a name-designation/code (it could be the result of any rule), although it likely will commonly be so. Examples of possible x2-filling sumti: code-designations for language, country, currency, script, etc.. For an entity with a given code, use {terjviso} or {terseljviso} (specifying the type of entity being designated by use of the appropriate terbri j2); for a given ISO rule, consider {veljviso}; for the organization ISO, consider {xeljviso}. See also: {linga}, {landa}, {rucni}, {cilfu}, {jvinjiata}/{jvisiata}, {jvinjica'o}/{jvisica'o}, {jvisuai}, {jvisiupaco}, {jvisrcei}, {jvisrbipmo}. This word is the gismu version of: {javniso}/{jvaiso}.,experimental gismu,ISO,ISO code,jviso,,
column13: ji'efri,$l_1$=$j_1$ lives/experiences life.,,lujvo,live life,,,
column14: ji'erslegreku,$x_1$ is the cytoskeleton of cell $x_2$,from {ji'esle} + {greku},lujvo,cytoskeleton,,,
column15: ji'eske,$x_1$=$s_1$ (mass of facts) is biology based on methology $x_2$=$s_3$.,,lujvo,biology,,,
column16: ji'esle,$s_1$=$j_1$ is a biological cell of $s_2$.,See also {jmive}, {selci}.,lujvo,cell,,,
column17: ji'exru,$x_1$ resurrects/brings back to life $x_2$=$j_1$ by standard $j_2$.,From xruti and jmive.,lujvo,resurrect,revive,,,
column18: jifkemlojvro,$v_1$ is a NOT gate / inverter with input [pin] $v_2$ and output [pin] $v_3$ in circuit/system $v_4$.,Cf. {jitfa}, {lojvro}.,lujvo,inverter,NOT gate,,,
column19: jifkri,$x_1$ is heretical/a heretic/heathen/infidel according to faith/religion/belief/creed $x_2$,cf. {jitfa}, {krici}.,lujvo,heathen,heretic,infidel,,,
column20: jifkritrazu'e,$x_1$ pretends to be/do $x_2$ (ka) in order for $x_3$ to falsely believe untruth $x_4$ (du'u), false by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_5$,,lujvo,pretend,,,
column21: jifmlu,$x_1$ (du'u) seems to be false to $x_2$ by epistemology $x_3$,See also {jetmlu}, {faumlu}.,lujvo,seem false,,,
column22: jifnarju'o,$x_1$ does not know that fact(s) $x_2$ (du'u), which are about subject $x_3$, are false by epistemology $x_4$ / it is consistent with $x_1$'s knowledge that $x_2$ may be true,,lujvo,do not know that something is false,,,
column23: jifpedle'u,$x_1$ is a "false friend" (letter/symbol in a different writing system that looks similar, but differs significantly in meaning) to $x_2$, in alphabet/character-set $x_3$ representing $x_4$,This is a {cimjvo}, with a rather obvious calque from a metaphor common to many languages. See {lerfu}, {smuni}, {bangu},lujvo,false friend,,,
column24: jifpedvla,$x_1$ is a "false friend" (word in different language that looks or sounds similar, but differs significantly in meaning) to $x_2$, meaning $x_3$ in language $x_4$.,This is a {cimjvo}, with a rather obvious calque from a metaphor common to many languages. See {valsi}, {smuni}, {bangu}. Synonymous to {pevjifpedvla}.,lujvo,false friend,,,
column25: jifselbetfu,$x_1$ is a pseudocoelomate with pseudocoelom $x_2$.,,lujvo,pseudocoelomate,,,
column26: jifselvi'a,$v_2$=$j_1$ is an illusion/mirage/etc. seen by $v_1$.,See also: {jitfa}, {viska}, {se}.,lujvo,illusion,,,
column27: jifxu'a,$xu_1$ is wrongly/falsely claiming $xu_2$=$j_1$, by truth standard $xu_3$.,Cf. {xusra}, {srera}.,lujvo,wrong,,,
column28: jifyjunxu'a,$x_1$ knowingly claims lie $x_2$ (du'u), false/untrue by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_3$,,lujvo,lie,,,
column29: jigycitri,$x_1$ is history of $x_2$ according to winners $x_3$ in conflict $x_4$.,A particularly weird lujvo: one based on the concept that "history is written by the winners."  Generally, x2 will be the losers in x4.  Perhaps this word could also be used as a single-word sentence to mean that.  The x3 of {jinga} was removed because it would presumably be the ability to write x1 in the first place.  See also {jinga} {citri}.,lujvo,history written by the winners,winners' history,,,
column30: ji'isre,$x_1$ mistakenly thinks/opines that $x_2$ (du'u) is true about subject $x_3$,Also see {jinvi}, {srera}, {dubji'isre},lujvo,mistakenly think,thought,,,
column31: jijyji'i,$jin_1$=$jij_1$ has intuition-based opinion (hunch/suspicion) $jin_2$=$jij_2$ (du'u) on subject $jin_3$=$jij_3$,Cf. {jinvi}, {jijnu}. This word coined when looking for a suitable word for "to suspect", or "suspicion". Intended to be neutral, however, rather than matching the negative connotation in English.,lujvo,have a hunch,suspect,suspicion,to suspect,,,
column32: jikfanta,$x_1$ prevents $x_2$ from interacting with them; $x_1$ "blocks" $x_2$.,On Facebook or Twitter, say.,lujvo,block,,,
column33: jiknyske,$x_1$=$s_1$ is economics of/about subject matter $x_2$=$s_2$ based on methodology $x_3$=$s_3$,from {jikni} + {saske},lujvo,economics,,,
column34: jikryckafi,$c_1$ is a quantity of liqueur coffee/coffee drink  with a shot of liqueur/spirit $j_1$.,See also: coffee making (={kafpra}), Gaelic/Highland/Irish Coffee (={kotyjikryckafi}), Bailey's Coffee (={kafrbeili}), Monk's Coffee (={kafrbenediktine}), Whisky Coffee (={ckafruiski}), Russian Coffee (={kafrvo'otka}), Karsk (={kafrkarska}).,lujvo,liqueur coffee,,,
column35: jiksei,$s_1$=$j_1$ is aloof/alone/solitary/a hermit, separated from $s_2$=$j_1$.,,lujvo,alone,aloof,eremitic,lone,solitary,,,
column36: jikselvai,$x_1$=$v_2$=$j_1$ finds it important to interact socially with $x_2$=$j_2$ for reason $x_3$=$v_3$ (ka); $x_1$ is extroverted,,lujvo,extroverted,,,
column37: jikske,$s_1$ is the science of the social behaviour of $x_2$=$j_1$ towards $x_3$=$j_2$ based on methodology $x_4$=$s_2$,$s_1$ refers to sociology in the sense of social behavior. For the study of the study of societies see {cemci'eske}. See also {jikca}, {saske}.,lujvo,science of social behaviour,sociology,,,
column38: jiksre,$s_1$ commits faux pas (social error) $s_2$, which is wrong under conditions $s_3$ according to standard $s_4$.,,lujvo,,,,
column39: jiktra,$x_1$=$t_1$=$j_1$ behaves/conducts themself as/in-manner $x_2$=$t_2$ when interacting/behaving socially with $x_3$=$j_2$,See also {tarti}, {jikca}.,lujvo,,,,
column40: jikydansu,$d_1$=$s_1$ (individual, mass) social dances with $s_2$ to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.,,lujvo,social dance,,,
column41: jikyfetsi,$j_1$=$f_1$ is a female/doe of species $f_2$ evidencing feminine cultural trait(s) $f_3$ (ka); $j_1$=$f_1$ is feminine.,Only cultural traits of femaleness should be applied, for physical traits, see {fetsi}.,lujvo,culturally female,female,,,
column42: jikykamxaujdi,$jd_1$=$ji_1$ is tactful in making decision $jd_2$ in matter $jd_3$ (event/state) in social interaction with $ji_2$.,,lujvo,tactful,,,
column43: jikynakni,$j_1$=$n_1$ is a male/buck of species $n_2$ evidencing masculine cultural trait(s) $n_3$ (ka); $j_1$=$n_1$ is masculine.,Only cultural traits of maleness should be applied, for physical traits, see {nakni}.,lujvo,culturally male,male,,,
column44: jilkemdicysro,$s_1$ is an alkaline battery in containment $s_3$.,See also {jilka}, {dicysro}.,lujvo,alkaline battery,,,
column45: jimbo'u,$j_1$=$b_1$ is a prosthetic bone made of metal, performing function $b_2$ in body $b_3$.,,lujvo,prosthetic bone,,,
column46: jimdaxsna,$s_1$ is a zing/clang produced by metal $j_1$=$d_2$=$s_2$ being hit.,,lujvo,clang,zing,,,
column47: jimdei,$x_1$ is Friday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.,,lujvo,Friday,,,
column48: jimki'e,$x1$ is a washer placed beneath $x2$,{jinme}, {kicne},lujvo,washer,,,
column49: jikrnjenevre,$x_1$ is a quantity of gin of composition  $x_2$,,fu'ivla,gin,jikrnjenevre,,
column50: ji'e'ai,mekso unary operator: determinant, det(A),A must be an nn matrix, or a linear operator or a system of equations which can be represented as such.,experimental cmavo,determinant,matrix determinant,,,,VUhU

column2: ji'ei nai,{ji'ei } - animate

ji'i ma'u,rounded up (appended after string of digits indicating a rounded value).,,cmavo-compound,rounded up,,,,PA*
column3: ji'i ni'u,rounded down (appended after string of digits indicating a rounded value).,,cmavo-compound,rounded down,,,,PA*
column4: ji'isku,$j_1$=$c_1$ expresses/says opinion $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) about subject/issue $j_3$ to audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$ on grounds $j_4$.,$j_2$ is defined by $x_2$=$c_2$,lujvo,to express an opinion,,,
column5: jikfytsa,$x_1$ (force) is physically strong in aspect $x_2$ by standard $x_3$,{jikfi}, {tsali}. Specifically refers to the physical aspect of {tsali}. Syn. {fislytsa},lujvo,strong,,,
column6: jiktru,$t_1$ is an institution governing social/cooperative human behaviour $t_2$.,Use x2 tu'a for e.g. education. Cf. {turni},lujvo,institution,,,
column7: jikykrali,$x_1$ (NU) is a social right/entitlement of $x_2$ (individual/mass) by standard $x_3$. $x_2$ is a legal person.,See also: {krali} for rights in general; {rarkrali} for "natural rights and {flakrali} for "legal rights"; {xuskrali} for "claim rights" and {zifkrali} for "liberty rights"; {srakrali} for "positive rights" and {ri'urkrali}/{badykrali} for "negative rights"; {sepkrali} for "individual rights" and {gumkrali} for "group rights"; {selcemkrali} for "civil rights" and {seljeckrali} for "political rights"; {jiknykrali} for "economic rights", and {klukrali} for "cultural rights"; {remkrali} for "human rights" and {dalkrali} for "animal rights"; perhaps {kralyxai} for "violate". Cf. {jikca}, {krali}, {selfla}, {selzi'e}, {terzi'e}, {selzau}, {selpikta}.,lujvo,entitlement,freedom,privilege,right,,,
column8: jimbo'i,$b_1$ is a metal bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container made of metal for $b_2$ with lid $b_4$.,,lujvo,metal bottle,,,
column9: jimda'izbe,$z_1$ is an anvil for striking metal $d_2$=$j_2$ with instrument $d_3$.,Cf. {mruli}.,lujvo,anvil,,,
column10: jimsko,$j_1$=$s_1$ is a wire/cable of metal $j_2$=$s_2$,This may be a single or multiple strand, but must be metallic.,lujvo,cable,wire,,,
column11: jimto'a,$x_{1}$ is a brassy tone with pitch $x_{2}$ with tone source $x_{3}$.,,lujvo,brassy tone,,,
column12: jimxre,$x_1$ is an alloy including metals $x_2$,,lujvo,alloy,,,
column13: jimyzba,$x_1$=$z_1$ forges $x_2$=$z_2$ out of metal $x_3$=$z_1$=$j_1$,from {jinme} + {zbasu},lujvo,forge,,,
column14: jincyba'e,$b_1$ is a blade of the pair of shears/scissors $j_1$.,,lujvo,,,,
column15: jinjongau,$x_1$ solders $x_2$ and $x_3$ together,,lujvo,solder,,,
column16: jinkytoldu'e,$t_1$=$j_1$ is an immune-system deficiency of $j_2$.,From {jinku}, {toldu'e}. t2, t3, j3, j4  based on relative uselessness (you could use tanru to get what type-of immune deficiency you're referring at).,lujvo,immune-system deficiency,,,
column17: jinmapku,$x1$=$d1$=$m1$ is a crown of material $x2$=$d2$=$m2$,,lujvo,crown,,,
column18: jinpastu,$p_1$ is a diving suit of material $p_2$,,lujvo,diving suit,,,
column19: jinplita,$x_1$ is a disc with a hole in the middle; $x_1$ is a flat torus.,,lujvo,,,,
column20: jinrcaibyca'u,$x_1$ is a region/room/volume of space which is shaped like a washer (or thin or flattened torus/toroid), between inner disk/sphere $x_2$ and outer disk/sphere $x_3$, defined by midplane $x_4$, and containing $x_5$.,$x_1$ {canlu}. This word contrasts with "{torxesu}" in that, while neither is necessarily a material object, this is a region of space and not an idealized object per se, and that, while this region is technically three-dimensional, it is mostly considered to be flat or nearly two-dimensional (similar to "{karda}"). Therefore, it will not take up/fill all of the space between the inner and outer spheres; it is confined approximately to the plane $x_4$. $x_3$ should enclose $x_2$ (except at most one point unless the case be degenerate), but they need not be mutually concentric. $x_1$ need not be perfectly circularly toroidal; for example, it could be elliptical (in which case, $x_2$ or $x_3$ would not be perfectly spherical either). Contrast with "{bolbi'i}", which is the whole region between the spheres $x_2$ and $x_3$ when this word makes sense, but which also does not require the nesting of the said spheres. This word is a {brapagjvo}; see: "{jinrcaiba}", "{belta}". Consider just using either "{djine}" (for an object) or "{jinca'u}" (for a region of space).,lujvo,belt,flat toroidal region,washer-shaped region,,,
column21: jinsru,$d_1$=$s_1$ is a ring/belt/band/girdle around/circling/ringing $s_2$ near total containment in some dimension(s).,,lujvo,circle,encircle,,,
column22: jintitnanba,$n_1$ is a quantity of doughnut.,Cf. {jinynanba}.,lujvo,donut,doughnut,,,
column23: jintyke'a,$k_1$=$j_1$ is a well in $k_2$ containing fluid $j_2$ at location $j_3$.,C.f. {jinto}, {kevna}.,lujvo,well,,,
column24: jinxabdakfu,$d_1$ is a sickle for cutting $d_2$, with blade of material $d_3$.,Defined by semicircular blade shape. Possible synonyms: {bagdakfu}, {krudakfu}.,lujvo,sickle,sickle-shaped knife,,,
column25: jinynanba,$n_1$ is a bagel.,Cf. {jintitnanba}.,lujvo,bagel,bublik,,,

column27: jipcyfe'i,$x1$=$f1$ is a hen of species $x2$=$j2$,,lujvo,hen,,,

column29: jirfirgai,$g_1$ is a diving/dive/scuba mask covering the face of $g_2$=$f_2$=$j_1$, for use in liquid $j_2$.,,lujvo,dive mask,diving mask,scuba mask,,,
column30: jirgau,$x_1$=$g_1$ immerses $x_2$=$j_1$ in liquid $x_3$=$j_2$,,lujvo,immerse,,,
column31: jirlu'i,$l_1$ (agent) bathes $l_2$=$j_1$ in liquid $j_2$=$l_4$.,Cf. {cavlu'i}, {brabaktu}.,lujvo,bathe,take a bath,,,
column32: jirnytabra,$t_{1}$=$j_{1}$ is a/the horn [brass-wind/lip-reed musical instrument; default,jirnytabra refers generally to the common horn (brass instrument). "..the instrument is often informally known as the French horn. However, this is technically incorrect since the instrument is not French in origin, but German. Therefore, the International Horn Society has recommended since 1971 that the instrument be simply called the horn." (wikipedia). Also natural horn (=sampu jirnytabra), vienna horn (=vin zei jirnytabra or {tabrviena}), mellophone (={tabrmelofono}), wagner tuba ({tabrvagnri}). See also {jirna} and {tabra}.,lujvo,horn,,,
column33: jirsu'u,$s_1$ dives [manner of controlled falling] to $s_2$ from $s_3$ into liquid $j_2$.,Different styles of diving: head first (=nitfarstedu jirsu'u), "cannonball" (=boitse jirsu'u), etc. See also {zajyjirsu'u}.,lujvo,dive,,,
column34: jirvi'odja,$x_1$=$v_1$=$c_1$ is preserved food/feed/nutriment pickled/immersed in $x_2$=$j_2$.,$x_2$=$j_2$ is salt (= {silna}), vinegar (= {slami}), alcohol (= {xalka}), sugar (= {sakta}), honey (= {bicysakta}), soy sauce (= {sobysanso}), bean paste (= {furso'epesxu}), mold paste (= {mledi} {pesxu}) and so on. {jinru} {vitno} {cidja}. See also {slamystogau}.,lujvo,,,,
column35: jisygau,$x_1$ cleans $x_2$ of contaminant(s)/dirt $x_3$ to standard of cleanliness $x_4$.,Cf. {fesyseigau} 'remove waste', {denjisygau}, {firjisygau}, {xanjisygau}, {krejisygau}, {pibjisygau}, {gaxyjisygau}, {xadyjisygau}, {prejisygau}, {zdajisygau}, {loljisygau}, {tcijisygau}, {jbujisygau}, {kabryjisygau}, {paltyjisygau}, etc.,lujvo,clean,clean up,make clean,make something clean,remove contaminant(s),remove dirt,to clean (tr.),,,
column36: jisygauple,$x_1$=$p_1$ is a tissue paper/toilet paper from source $x_2$=$p_2$ for cleaning $x_3$=$j_1$,from {jisygau}+{pelji},lujvo,tissue,tissue paper,toilet paper,,,
column37: jisystota'u,$x_1$=$t_1$ is an apron of $x_2$=$j_1$=$s_1$, keeping them clean from contaminant $x_3$=$j_2$,See {jinsa}, {stodi} and {taxfu},lujvo,apron,,,
column38: jitcau,$c_1 = x_1$ is limitless/unlimited/boundless/unbounded (one sense) in property/domain $j_3 = x_2$.,,lujvo,boundless,limitless,unbounded,unlimited,,,
column39: jitseldejykarda,$x_1$=$k_1$ is a credit card with accumulated debt $x_2$=$d_1$ to creditor $x_3$=$d_3$, with credit limit $x_4$=$j_1$,Credit cards has credit limits; for charge cards limited by a due payment date see {detseldejykarda}. Cf. {lejykarda}, {baxydinkarda}, {vamveile'ikarda}, {maksriveikarda}, {lejykardymi'i}, {banxa}, {pleji}, {jdini}.,lujvo,credit card,,,
column40: jivbi'o,$b_1$=$j_1$ comes to the conclusion that $j_2$ [opinion] (du'u) is true about subject/issue $j_3$ on grounds $j_4$, under conditions $b_3$.,Cf. {jinvi}, {binxo}, {lojycpa}, {ja'o}.,lujvo,conclude,conclusion, come to,determine,,,
column41: jivyfrica,$x_1$=$f_1$=$j_1$ is unlike $x_2$=$f_2$=$j_1$ in their opinion of $x_3$=$j_3$.,,lujvo,,,,
column42: jizyselpre,$p_2$=$j_1$ is the temperament (innate personality) of $p_1$=$j_2$.,Cf. {selpre}, {jinzi}.,lujvo,temperament,,,
column45: jmadegycalku,$c_1$ is a toenail of toe $c_2$=$d_1$ of body $d_3$.,Cf. {degycalku}, {xandegycalku}, {jmatajycalku}, {xantajycalku}.,lujvo,toenail,,,
column47: jmagutci,$g_1$ is $g_2$ international foot/feet (length unit) in length.,Cf. {jamfu}, {gutci}, {degygutci}, {tapygutci}, {birgutci}, {cibjmagutci}, {minli}.,lujvo,feet,foot,international feet,international foot,,,
column48: jmani'a,$j_1$ is a sole (part of foot) of $j_2$.,Cf. {jmati'e}, {jmadegji}.,lujvo,sole,,,
column49: jmatajycalku,$c_1$ is the big toe nail of body $t_3$=$j_2$.,Cf. {jgalu}, {brajmadegycalku}, {jmatamji}, {degycalku}, {xandegycalku}, {xantajycalku}.,lujvo,big toe nail,,,
column50: jmatamji,$t_1$ is the big toe of $t_3$=$j_2$.,Cf. {brajmadegji}.,lujvo,big toe,,,
column52: jmavra,$v_1$ is a pedal with function $v_2$, fulcrum $x_3$, and lever arm $x_4$.,,lujvo,pedal,,,
column53: jmifrili,$x_1$ (du'u) is easy to understand to $x_2$,See also {jmiselfrili}, {filseljmi}, {gasfrili}.,lujvo,Easy to understand,,,
column54: jminandu,$x_1$ (du'u) is hard to understand to $x_2$,,lujvo,Difficult to understand,,,
column55: jmiselfrili,$x_1$=$f_2$=$j_1$ easily understands fact(s) $x_2$=$j_2$ about $x_3$=$j_3$ under conditions of ease $x_4$=$f_3$.,Composed of {jimpe}, {frili}. Completely jvajvo. See also {jmifrili}.,lujvo,easily understand,,,
column56: jmisre,$s_1$=$j_1$ misunderstands fact/truth $j_2$ (du'u) about subject $j_3$, an error under conditions $s_3$ by standard $s_4$.,The implication is that x2 is understood by x1 about x3, but that this is an incorrect understanding. See {ki'a}, {uafli}.,lujvo,misconceive,misconstrue,misunderstand,,,
column57: jonga'e,$x_1$ perceives concrete experience $x_2$ synesthetically as $x_3$ by means $x_4$ under conditions $x_5$,Synesthesia (or synaesthesia) refers to a phenomenon whereby a given sensory experience is involuntarily associated with a sensation ordinarily experienced through a different sensory pathway: for instance, the auditory experience of different sounds may trigger the visual experience of various different colors, or different kinds of visual imagery may be associated with different textures.,lujvo,synaesthesia,synesthesia,,,
column58: jongau,$g_1$ (agent) causes $j_1$ to be joined to/connected to/united with $j_2$ at common locus $j_3$.,(see also {lasna}),lujvo,attach,bind,connect,join,link,,,
column59: jonpoi,$p_1$ [ordered set] is a train/procession/caravan/string sequenced/ordered/listed by comparison/rules $p_2$ on unordered set $p_3$=$j_1$=$j_2$.,,lujvo,train,,,
column62: jonsnu,$x_1$=$j_3$ interprets discussion/relays messages between $x_2$=$c_1$ (set) about topic/subject $x_3$=$c_2$,Doesn't explicitly imply translation like {fanva}. Here $x_1$ joins the members of $x_2$ who may otherwise be unable to communicate. $x_1$ is an interpreter.,lujvo,interpret,,,
column63: jonsumji,$x_1$ is the union of sets $x_2$ and $x_3$.,See also {jo'e}, {terkruca},lujvo,union,,,
column64: jorny'utka,$x_1$ is joined/connected to/with something which is joined/connected to/with something which ... which is joined/connected to/with something which is joined/connected to/with $x_2$ via intermediate things/steps $x_3$ (ce'o), with respective points/loci of (con)juncture $x_4$ (ce'o).,See ".{utka}". $x_3$ and $x_4$ are ordered lists; everywhere within this description, denote the $i$th term of $x_k$, for $k$ in Set($3, 4$), as "$x_k(i)$", where $i$ is an integer and begins indexing at $1$. $x_4$ must have exactly one term more than $x_3$ (unless this is either a vacuous selbri (id est: $x_3$ is empty and at least one of $x_1$ and $x_2$ also is/are empty) or a trivial selbri (id est: $x_1 = x_2$)); thus, $x_4$ will typically be non-empty. If $x_3$ is empty but the selbri is not vacuous or trivial, then this {selbri} means "$x_1$ {jorne} $x_2 \, x_4(1)"$; else, if the selbri is neither vacuous nor trivial, then: it means "where $N$ denotes the cardinality/list-length of $x_3$: $x_1$ {jorne} $x_3(1) \, x_4(1)$ .ije $x_3(1)$ {jorne} $x_3(2) \, x_4(2)$ .ije ... .ije $x_3(n)$ {jorne} $x_3(n+1) \, x_4(n+1)$ .ije ... .ije $x_3(N-1)$ {jorne} $x_3(N) \, x_4(N)$ .ije $x_3(N)$ {jorne} $x_2 \, x_4(N+1)$". The {veljvo} of this word break the requirement that utka$_3$ be a binary predicate (because "{jorne}" is ternary). The linking which is referenced/described by this word is the same as that which is described by "{jorne}", and each one is applicable where the other is. Thus, this word might be able to be used for Internet hyperlinking, at least in a metaphorical sense.,lujvo,form a chain,indirectly bound to,indirectly conjoin,indirectly connected to,indirectly joined to,indirectly linked to,indirectly united,,,
column65: joryru'u,$r_1$ is measured in jordanian dinar (JOD) as $r_2$ (quantity), in the Algerian monetary system $r_3$.,,lujvo,dinar,,,
column66: joska'e,$x_1$ has access to $x_2$ for purpose $x_3$ ; $x_1$ is able to access $x_2$ ; $x_2$ is accessible to $x_1$,See {jonse}, {kakne},lujvo,has access to,,,
column68: judgau,$x_1$ makes $x_2$ pay attention to $x_3$; $x_1$ directs $x_2$'s attention to $x_3$.,,lujvo,direct attention,,,
column69: judrysni,$j_1$=$s_1$ is a hyperlink/URL of resource/web page $j_2$=$s_2$ for browser $s_3$.,Cf. {kibro}.,lujvo,hyperlink,,,
column70: judryuidje,$u_1$ is an address bar of user interface $u_2$; $u_1$ is a widget of user interface $u_2$ for entering an address.,See also: {samjudri}, {uidje}. Syn. {samjudri zei uidje},lujvo,address bar,,,
column71: ju'erboijvi,$j_1$ plays tennis against $j_2$ in competition $j_3$ for prize/title $j_4$.,Cf. {julne}, {bolci}, {jivna}, {ga'arboijvi}, {bolrtenis}.,lujvo,tennis,,,
column72: jufmei,$x_1$ is a paragraph about $x_2$ including sentence(s) $x_3$.,Cf. {jufra}, {mei}, {vlagri}, {vlali'i}. See also {ni'o}, {no'i}.,lujvo,paragraph,,,
column73: jufpau,$p_1$ is a phrase of sentence $p_2$=$j_1$ about $j_2$ in language $j_3$.,,lujvo,phrase,,,
column74: jufspi,$s_1$ is a fragment of sentence $s_2$=$j_1$ about $j_2$ in language $j_3$.,Cf. {jufra}, {spisa},lujvo,sentence fragment,,,
column75: juftogmo'a,$t_1$=$m_1$ is the intonation of sentence $j_1$=$m_2$ with characteristics $t_2$=$m_3$.,Cf. {jufra}, {tonga}, {morna}.,lujvo,intonation,,,
column76: jugbau,$j_1$=$b_1$ is the Chinese-Mandarin language, used by $b_2$ to communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote),Cf. {jungo}, {bangu}, {jugygu'e}, {djunguos}, {xa'anzu}.,lujvo,Chinese,Chinese Mandarin,Mandarin,,,
column77: jugle'u,$x_1$ is a Chinese character in writing system $x_2$ (traditional/simplified/bopomofo/etc.) meaning $x_3$.,,lujvo,Chinese character,,,
column78: jugnimre,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of Citrus sinensis [fruit/tree, etc.] of species/strain $x_{2}$.,,lujvo,,,,
column79: jugru'u,$r_1$ is measured in renminbi yuan (; RMB) as $r_2$ (quantity), in the Chinese monetary system $r_3$.,,lujvo,renminbi yuan,yuan,,,
column81: jugysmuci,$sm_1$=$j_1$ is/are Chinese style soup spoon(s) () [item of cutlery] for eating $sm_2$ made of material $s_3$.,A type of spoon used in Chinese cuisine with a short, thick handle extending directly from a deep, flat bowl. It is used for eating soups, stews, or loose solids such as rice, and is commonly made using porcelains and ceramics.,lujvo,Chinese soup spoon,,,
column82: jugzgu,$r_1$=$j_1$ is a China rose (Rosa chinensis) of species/strain $r_2$.,,lujvo,China rose,,,
column83: juknyxarju,$x_1$ does whatever a spider pig does.,,lujvo,spider pig,,,
column84: jukte'a,$t1$ fears/is afraid/scared/frightened by/fearful of spiders/arachnids/crustaceans/crabs/lobsters/non-insect arthropods of species/breed $j2$.,,lujvo,arachnophobia,,,
column85: jumske,$x_1$=$s_1$ (mass of facts) is microbiology studying microorganisms $x_2$=$j_1$ based on methodology $x_3$,See also bacteriology (={cuvjumske}).,lujvo,microbiology,,,
column86: jungau,$x_1$ tells/makes known to $x_2$  fact(s) $x_3$ (du'u) about subject $x_4$ by epistemology $x_5$.,See also {djuno} {gasnu},lujvo,inform,report,tell,,,
column87: jvicpe,$c_1$=$j_1$ wages a contest $c_2$=$j_3$ on $c_3$=$j_2$ for gain $j_4$.,Cf. {cpedu}, {jivna}, {jamna}.,lujvo,wage,,,
column88: jvikei,$k_1$=$j_1$ plays competively against opponent $j_2$ in game $k_2$=$j_3$ (event) for gain $j_4$.,Cf. {jivna}, {kelci},lujvo,play,,,
column89: jvilu'a,$x1$=$j3$=$p1$ is a course/[competition route] to $x2$=$p2$ from $x3$=$p3$ via points $x4$=$p4$,,lujvo,course,,,
column90: jvixi'a,$xi_1$ is a racehorse of breed $xi_2$ competing in race $j_3$.,,lujvo,racehorse,,,
column91: jvocme,$c_1$ (quoted word(s)) is a name of $c_2$ used by $c_3$ that morphologically [strict] is a Lojbanic lujvo built from predicates metaphor/tanru $l_4$,The morphology is according to Lojban grammar rules; as such, the word(s) c1 must end with vowels and in fact must exactly follow the morphology of brivla (and, moreover, lujvo; else, they would not be morphologically correct lujvo). l1 is essentially c1 modulo meaning and exact syntactic operation. The other terbri of {lujvo} (namely, l2 and l3) are not useful for names.  See also: {jvosmicme} for a slight generalization, {brivlasmicme} for a greater generalization thereof.,lujvo,lujvo name,,,
column92: jvocmeborvla,$x_1$ is a word which is a {cmevla} (morphological name-word), referring to $x_2$ and used by $x_3$, and which is also of the form of a lujvo (excepting the last rafsi) formed from veljvo $x_4$, in language $x_5$,See also: {jvocme} (closely related but sort of opposite), {cmevla} (a different generalization), {jvosmicme} (a different generalization), and {jvocmevla} (which is essentially the same except slightly narrower in assumptions and terbri).,lujvo,lujvonic cmevla,,,
column93: jvocmevla,$x_1$ is a cmevla meaning $x_2$ in Lojban, which looks like a lujvo but ends with a non-terminal rafsi,Examples include {lojban}, {mergug}, {camgusmis}. Officially, of course, these are just {cmevla} but the rafsi are often suggestive of the meaning. See also {cmevla}, {lujvo}.,lujvo,,,,
column94: jvocmevo,$x_1$ is a lujvo-like cmevla meaning $x_2$,Refers to words like {lojban}, which are built from {rafsi} like {lujvo}, but ends in a consonant and is therefore a {cmevla} rather than a {lujvo}. See {cmevo}. Syn. {jvocmevla}.,lujvo,lujvo-like cmevla,,,
column95: jvokatna,$k_1$ separates affix compound $k_2$ into its constituent affixes $k_3$; $k_1$ does morphological analysis.,Cf. {lujvo}, {katna}, {rafsi}, {lanli}, {rafske}, {genturfa'i},lujvo,analyze morphologically,,,
column96: jvomi'u,The lujvo $m_1$=$l_1$ (text) is an equivalent/interchangable lujvo form of lujvo $m_2$=$l_1$ (text).,This refers to the fact that Lojban's lujvo can have many forms, all of which are considered to be equal in meaning automatically. See The Lojban Reference Grammar, chapter 4, section 5: https://lojban.github.io/cll/4/5/ Not to be confused with synonymous ({selsmudu'i}), which may apply to entirely different words. Cf. {lujvo}, {mintu}.,lujvo,,,,
column97: jvonu'oblo,$x_1$ is the dust at the bottom of the cereal box, thereby illustrating the principle that the definition of a lujvo need not be constrained by that of its constituent selrafsi,,lujvo,,,,
column98: jvopro,$x_1$ (quote) is a lujvo/compound word(s) form which conflicts with other lujvo $x_2$ (quote) according to rule $x_3$ in language $x_4$.,In Lojban, this is the case when two lujvo have different meanings/definitions but are identical in veljvo except possibly for the presence of "{zei}" (or similar) and the presence of grouping markers (which may be rendered unnecessary in some veljvo constructs but not in others, such as in "LUJVO1 {zei} LUJVO2" versus "LUJVO1 {bo} LUJVO2"). See also: "{gimkamsmikezypro}".,lujvo,lujvo conflict,,,
column99: jvosmicme,$c_1$=$s_1$ (quoted word(s)) is a name of $c_2$ used by $c_3$ that morphologically [loose] evokes/is similar to/is Lojbanic lujvo $l_1$=$s_2$ (text; may be multiple words), similar in property/quality[/amount?] $s_3$ (ka/ni),s3 will likely just be morphological structure. Strict jvocme are a subclass of jvosmicme.  The name must "look like" a (sequence of) lujvo (according to Lojban rules), but need not exactly follow the morphological requirements thereof (in particular, c1 may end with a consonant, in which case it is a {jvocmeborvla}). See also: {jvocme} (a specialization), {jvocmeborvla} (a specialization), {brivlasmicme} (a generalization); essentially synonymous with {jvocmevla}.,lujvo,lujvo name,,,
column100: jvotau,$x_1$ is the base-tanru / base-compound-phrase of lujvo / compound-word $x_2$,lo jvotau = lo {veljvo}; only the place structure differs.,lujvo,base compound phrase,base tanru,,,
column101: jvotauborkra,$x_1$=$k_1$=$t_1$=$l_4$ is the metaphor behind the compound word $x_2$=$k_2$=$l_1$.,(The places: t2, t3, t4, t5 and l2, l3 are all dependent on t1 and l1, respectively, so they are all elided.) See {tanru}, {lujvo}, {krasi}.,lujvo,,,,
column102: jvova'i,$x_1$ (number) is the lujvo score of lujvo $x_2$ (text) determined under scoring algorithm $x_3$.,"lujvo score" is a term specific to Lojban {lujvo}. Lujvo can be assigned a "score" by some algorithm in order to compare those lujvo. One lujvo scoring algorithm is described in The Lojban Reference Grammar, chapter 4, section 12: https://lojban.github.io/cll/4/12/ See also {vamji}.,lujvo,lujvo score,,,
column103: jvozba,$x_1$=$z_1$ assembles/builds a compound predicate word from metaphor $x_2$=$z_2$=$l_4$ with meaning $x_3$=$l_2$ and arguments $x_4$=$l_3$,See also {lujvo}, {zbasu},lujvo,to make lujvo,,,
column104: ka'amru,$m_1$ is an axe for cutting $k_2$ with blade $m_3$=$k_1$ propelled by $m_4$.,,lujvo,axe,,,
column105: ka'arbatci,$b_1$=$k_1$ bites through $b_2$=$k_2$ (object) on/at specific locus $b_3$ with $b_4$ to pieces $k_3$.,See also: {katna}, {batci}.,lujvo,bite through,,,
column106: ka'arde'i,$d_1$ is an incisor of $d_2$.,cf. denci, gerde'i, crazalde'i, zalde'i,lujvo,incisor,,,
column109: kabrylai,$k_1$ is $k_2$ (quantifier, default: one) cupfuls in quantity.,Cf. {kabri}, {klani}.,lujvo,cupful,glassful,,,
column110: kacmre,$x_1$ (agent) count-measures/evaluates $x_2$=$m_2$ [quantity] as $x_3$=$k_3$=$m_3$ [number counted] items/units of/in/pertaining to set $x_4$=$k_2$, on scale $x_5$=$m_4$ (si'o; default: from 0 representing nothing/no instances of the item, and by (units of) 1 for each additional occurrence if the item is quantized) with accuracy $x_6$=$m_5$ (ideally should be exact/perfect). $x_2$ is countably measurable.,The scale sets the "counting [off] by units" and most countable things are counted from "0" (meaning nothing/no instances of the item in question) with each additional occurrence of the (quantized) item being represented by an addition "1". See: {kamre}, {zilkacmre}.,lujvo,count-measure,,,
column111: kacmyterxra,$p_3$ takes a photo/picture $p_1$ depicting/representing/showing $p_2$.,Cf. {kacma}, {pixra}, {kacmyxra}.,lujvo,photograph,take a photo,take a picture,,,
column112: kacmyxra,$p_1$ is a photograph of $p_2$ taken by photographer $p_3$ in medium $p_4$=$k_3$.,,lujvo,,,,
column113: kacmyxramre,$m_1$ (photogrammetrist) measures $m_2$=$p_2$ as $m_3$ (dimensions) with accuracy $m_5$,photogrammetry = zu'o kacmyxramre,lujvo,photogrammetry,,,
column114: kacna'u,$x_1$ is a natural number.,Includes zero and all successors of zero. See also {mulna'u}, {frinyna'u}, {mrena'u}, and {lujna'u},lujvo,natural number,,,
column115: kacpoi,$p_1$ is a sequence of numbers in ascending order.,Cf. {kancu}, {porsi}, {namcu}, {zenba},lujvo,sequence,,,
column116: kadnyfasybau,$k_1$=$f_1$=$b_1$ is the Canadian French language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).,from {kadno} {fraso} {bangu} c.f. {fasybau},lujvo,Canadian French,,,
column117: kadnyglibau,$k_1$=$g_1$=$b_1$ is the Canadian English language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).,Cf. {kadno}, {glico}, {bangu}, {glibau}, {bangenugu}.,lujvo,Canadian English,,,
column119: kaircu'a,$x_1$ chooses/selects $x_2$ from $x_3$ (set) for purpose $x_4$ (property).,Under one interpretation, $cuxna_2$ must be a proposition and $cuxna_3$ must be a set of propositions, meaning cuxna is more similar to "decide". This word is equivalent to "cuxna lo du'u ckaji", and allows us to avoid implicit sumti raising with cuxna.,lujvo,choose,pick,,,
column120: kairda'o,$x_1$ is far from being $x_2$ (ka),See {darno}, {kaijbi},lujvo,far from being,,,
column121: kairdu'a,$x_1$ gives/confers property $x_2$ (ka) to $x_3$.,Or: $x_1$ makes $x_3$ exhibit $x_2$. Essentially equal to something like {selkaigau}.,lujvo,,,,
column122: kairji'i,$x_1$ thinks/opines that $x_2$ is/does $x_3$ (ka) under grounds $x_4$,See {ckaji}, {jinvi}, {dubji'i},lujvo,opine,,,
column123: kairpai,$x_1$ considers $x_2$ to have quality $x_3$ (ka) ; $x_2$ qualifies as / counts as being $x_3$ according to $x_1$,See {ckaji}, {pajni}, {markai},lujvo,consider to be,,,
column124: kairpau,being $x_1$ (ka) is part of being $x_2$ (ka),Or "$x_2$ implies $x_1$", but stronger than the logical sense; this word is definitional or essentialistic, and implies that if something stopped being $x_1$, it'd stop being $x_2$. See {kai'a}, {bi'ai}, {nibli}, {jinzi},lujvo,part of being,,,
column125: ka'irtrusi'o,$s_1$ is the concept of representative democracy (default: political representative democracy) as it applies to the governance of $t_2$ based on the works of thinker(s) $s_3$,From {krati}, {turni}, {sidbo}. Cf. {dzejdasratrusi'o}, {vricykricrutrusi'o}, {fairpaltrusi'o}, {guntrusi'o}, {natpamtrusi'o}, {tsarainaitrusi'o}.,lujvo,democracy,representative democracy,,,
column126: kairxadni,$x_1$=$xa_1$ is an avatar/physical embodiment of property/force $x_2$=$c_2$ (ka); $x_1$ is $x_2$ incarnate.,,lujvo,Avatar,Incarnate,,,
column127: kaitcu,$x_1$ needs to be/do $x_2$ (ka) for purpose $x_3$,ka-version of {nitcu}, that strengthens the relationship between $x_1$ and the property.,lujvo,needs to be,,,
column128: kajmi'i,$x_1$ is a calculator / computer / reckoning machine computing $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$,See also {skami}, {zmiku}.,lujvo,calculator,computer,,,
column129: kajnyta'e,$t_1$=$k_2$ is a cupboard for storing $t_2$, made of $t_3$, with shelves $k_1$.,Cf. {kajna}, {tanxe}.,lujvo,cupboard,,,
column130: kajyzmi,$x_{1}$ is a program / automaton calculating/reckoning/computing $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$,See also {proga}, {skami}.,lujvo,,,,
column131: kakcalotylakse,$x_1$ is (or is made of/from) a quantity of spermaceti (spermaceti wax/oil).,See the {zevla} "{kakcalote}".,lujvo,spermaceti,,,
column132: kakpyca'a,$c_1$=$k_4$ is an excavator/power shovel for digging in $k_3$, operated by $k_1$=$c_3$.,Not for pushing bulldozer.,lujvo,bulldozer,digger,digging apparatus,dozer,excavator,power shovel,shovel,,,
column133: kaksna,$s_1$ is a sob/sobbing produced by $k_1$ with tears $k_2$ about/for reason $k_3$ (event/state).,Cf. {klaku}, {sance}.,lujvo,sob,sobbing,,,
column134: kakydirgo,$x_1$ is a teardrop wept by $x_2$ for reason $x_3$.,,lujvo,teardrop,,,
column135: kalboi,$b_1$=$k_1$ is an eyeball (body part) of $k_2$.,Cf. {kalgai}, {kalgaikre}, {kalselvi'i}, {kalvi'i}.,lujvo,eyeball,,,
column136: kalca'o,$x_1$ is the pupil of the eye of $x_2$,Synonym: {kalke'a}.,lujvo,pupil,,,
column137: kalca'osrumu'a,$x_1$ is the iris of the eye of $x_2$,,lujvo,iris,,,
column138: kalca'osrumu'aska,$x_1$ is an iris of color $x_2$ as perceived by $x_3$ under viewing conditions $x_4$; $x_2$ is $x_1$'s eye color.,,lujvo,eye color,,,
column139: kalca'osrumu'askakemsloskajavburjoiri'o,$x_1$'s eye(s)/iris(es) is/are hazel as perceived by $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$,Hazel in this context is a brown and/or gold color that is mixed with or has a tint of green (or vice-versa). Really, only objects that have qualities similar to eye irises can be hazel; other combinations of brown and green do not necessarily constitute hazel (rather, they are often a muddy green or a mossy brown), but if the object has these qualities sufficiently, it may qualify. The point is that not all brown-greens are hazel. This color is distinct from amber.,lujvo,hazel,,,
column140: kalcycinki,$c_1$ is a dung beetle [dung-eating arthropod] of species/breed $c_2$.,A beetle (or, metaphorically, other arthropod) whose diet primarily consists of the feces of other animals.,lujvo,dung beetle,,,
column142: kalgai,$g_1$ is an eyelid of eye $k_1$=$g_2$.,,lujvo,eyelid,,,
column143: kalgaikre,$ke_1$ is an eyelash (body part) of $ke_2$=$ka_2$.,Cf. {kalgai}, {kalboi}, {kalvi'i}, {kalselvi'i}.,lujvo,eyelash,,,
column145: kaljba,$x_1$ is a longan berry (Dimocarpus longan) of type $x_2$,See {kanla}, {jbari}. Named for superficial similarity of the peeled fruit to an eye, as paralleled by the Chinese name,  (lngyn, lit. "dragon's eye").,lujvo,longan,,,
column146: kalmebykre,$ke_1$ is an eyebrow (supraorbital ridge) of $ke_2$=$ka_2$=$m_2$.,Cf. {kerfa}, {kanla}, {mebri}, {kalgaikre}.,lujvo,eyebrow,,,
column147: kalselvi'i,$x_1$=$v_2$ is a tear/tear fluid of $x_2$=$v_1$.,Cf. {kalboi}, {kalgai}, {kalgaikre}, {molselpu'u}.,lujvo,tears,,,
column148: kalsrumu'a,$x_1$ is a surrounding cover/curtain that surrounds the eye structure of $x_2$,This can include eye stalks (if the eye can be retracted into/enveloped by the surrounding tissue), etc.; it might include eye lids, although it is arguable that they do not really "surround" the eye. A purpose of the curtain must be to cover the eye, not just encase it. Essentially, this must be a circular/ringlike/sphincter eyelid.,lujvo,eye-surrounding-curtain,,,
column149: kalta'u,$x_1$ is an eyewear or are eyeglasses,See also {lacni}.,lujvo,eyegasses,eyewear,glasses,,,
column150: kalty'utka,$x_1$ hunts another which hunts another which ... which hunts another which hunts $x_2$ via intermediate steps $x_3$ (ce'o).,,lujvo,indirectly hunt,,,
column151: kalvi'i,$v_1$=$k_2$ weeps/lacrimates tear(s) $v_2$ from $v_3$ via means/route $v_4$.,Cf. {klaku}, {kalselvi'i}, {kalboi}, {kalgai}, {kalgaikre}.,lujvo,lacrimate,weep,,,
column152: kamba'i,$k_1$ is the greatness/majesty/splendour/magnificence/grandeur of $b_1$ according to standard $b_3$.,Cf. {ka}, {banli}, {kamnolraitru}.,lujvo,greatness,majesty,splendour,,,
column153: kambandu,$k_1$ is a security condition of $b_1$ protecting $b_2$ from threat $b_3$.,When used as "security", x3 is a planned threat. "security" is comparable to "safety" ({kamnu'a}), "reliability" ({kamylacri}), and "continuity" ({kamra'i}).,lujvo,protection,security,,,
column154: kambebna,$k_1$ is quality/property exhibited by $b_1$ of being foolish/silly/stupid in event/action /property (ka) $b_2$.,Cf. {ka}, {bebna}, {nunbebna}.,lujvo,foolishness,sillyness,stupidity,,,
column155: kambla,$x_1$ is blueness,This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL,lujvo,blueness,,,
column156: kamckire,$x_1$=$k_1$ is the property of gratitude/thankfulness/appreciation of $x_2$=$c_2$ for $x_3$=$c_3$ (event/property),It is implicitly assumed that ce'u is assigned to ckire1.,lujvo,,,,
column157: kamcre,$k_1$ is $c_1$'s expertise/prowess in/skill at/mastery of $c_2$ (event/activity) by standard $c_3$,,lujvo,expertise,mastery,skill,,,
column158: kamdu'o,$x_1$ is the identity function/equality relation,brivla form of ka ce'u du ma kau.,lujvo,equality relation,identity function,,,
column159: kamgei,$x_1$ is happiness experienced by $x_2$ about (event/state/idea) $x_3$,Extension of $gleki_2$ to $x_3$ in order to include/accomodate idea type sumti.,lujvo,happiness,,,
column160: kamgusycai,$x_1$ is (the quality of) luster/sheen/shininess/finish of $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$,In heraldry, characterizes the distinction between tinctures (metals and colours/dyes).,lujvo,finish,luster,sheen,shininess,tincture distinction,,,
column161: kamji'e,$x_1$ is the life (property of being alive) of $x_2$.,For the event of living, see {nunji'e}.,lujvo,life,,,
column164: kamjunmre,$m_1$  tests/evaluates/measures $j_1$'s knowledge of facts (du'u)  $j_2$ in subject area $j_3$  as $m_3$ units on scale $m_4$ with accuracy $m_5$,The x2 through x4 places are = m2.,lujvo,evaluate,quiz,test,,,
column165: kamjybo'u,$k_1$=$b_1$ is a vertebra of $b_3$ ; $b_3$ is a vertebrate.,Cf. {bongu}, {bogykamju}, {terbo'u}.,lujvo,vertebra,,,
column166: kamjysunga,$x_1$ is a leek of variety $x_2$.,see also {sunga}, {sluni}, {tu'ursluni},lujvo,leek,,,
column167: kamka'o,$kam_1$ is the health of $kan_1$ by standard $kan_2$.,Cf. {kanro}.,lujvo,health,,,
column168: kamnolraitru,$k_1$ is the majesty of $t_1$=$n_1$ being a regent/monarch of $t_2$ by standard $n_2$.,Cf. {ka}, {nobli}, {traji}, {turni}, {kamba'i}.,lujvo,majesty,,,
column169: kamprije,$x_1$ is wisdom of $x_2$ on matter $x_3$,,lujvo,wisdom,,,
column170: kampu'a,$x_1$=$k_1$ is pleasure generated from event/state $x_2$=$p_1$ for experiencer $x_3$=$p_2$ under conditions $x_4$=$p_3$.,From {ka} {pluka}. See also {kamgei} 'happiness', {kamymle} 'beauty', {kamxau} 'goodness/beneficiality'.,lujvo,pleasantness,pleasure,satisfaction,,,
column171: kamra'a,$k_1$  is the relation of $s_1$ to $s_2$.,Cf. {srana}, {ckini}, {jorne}.,lujvo,relation,,,
column172: kamtatpi,$k_1$ is the fatigue of $t_1$ in being/doing $t_2$ (event).,Cf. {tatpi}, {sipna},lujvo,fatigue,,,
column173: kamtende,$x_1$=$k_1$ is the tendency of $x_2$=$t_1$ to $x_3$=$t_2$,from {ka}+{tende},lujvo,tendency,,,
column174: kamtsa,$k_1$ is the strength of $t_1$ in property/quality $t_2$ (ka).,Cf. {ka}, {tsali}.,lujvo,strength,,,
column175: kamve'a,$c_1$ is the childhood (state of being a child) of $v_1$.,Cf. {ka}, {verba}, {vercedra}.,lujvo,childhood,,,
column176: kamvli,$k_1$ is the power of $v_1$ in aspect $v_2$ under conditions $v_3$.,Cf. {ka}, {vlipa}, {trubasti}.,lujvo,power,strength,,,
column177: kamxansa,$x_1 = $ka$_1$ is handedness/chirality/stereoisomerism/property of being chiral which is exhibited by $x_2 = $xansa$_1$, the chirality having type/signature/manifestation $x_3 = $xansa$_2$, according to standard/rule/consideration $x_4 = $xansa$_3$ and under conditions $x_5 = $xansa$_4$.,Relies on experimental {gismu} "{xansa}".,lujvo,chirality,handedness,stereoisomerism,,,
column178: kamymeckezra'a,$x_1$ pertains to the numerically lower/lesser/inferior side of $x_2$ under order relation/judging aspect $x_3$.,See also: {kamyzmakezra'a} (the notes there apply here with appropriate analogs substituted).,lujvo,the lesser end,the numerically lower end,,,
column179: kamymeckezrai,$x_1$ is the least $x_2$ or in property $x_2$ (ka) among set/range $x_3$.,"{traji}" allows for both extremities but defaults to the positive side/valence (resulting in its meaning "most" in that case); this word 'defaults' to the negative side/valence and does not even have an alternative.,lujvo,least,lessermost,,,
column180: kamymrokemjbijvebi'o,$x_1$ exhibits extremis/the property of (pertaining to) both being near and approaching the death of $x_2$.,,lujvo,extremis,,,
column181: kamyzi'e,$x_1$ is the quality of whom/what is free to do/be $x_2$=$z_2$; $x_1$ is freedom/liberty of $x_2$=$z_2$,Cf. {ka}, {zifre}, {nunzi'e}, {selzi'e}, {zi'ejva}.,lujvo,freedom,liberty,,,
column182: kamyzmakezra'a,$x_1$ pertains to the numerically higher/greater/superior side of $x_2$ under order relation/judging aspect $x_3$.,For example, a Gaussian has two tails; the tail with the greater numbers (which is traditionally/conventionally plotted on the right side of a horizontally oriented scale) is kamyzmakezra'a. For another example, suprema and infima are the bounds on a set; suprema are bounds from (so-called) above - in other words, from the numerically greater side of the set in question. This word is used for every reference of saying "above", "upper", or "right" in the context of ordered numbers, since these terms are culturally-dependent. See also: {kamymeckezra'a}.,lujvo,the greater end,the numerically higher end,,,
column183: kanbycirla,$c_1$ is a quantity of Chvre/goat cheese of variety/from goat $c_2$=$k_1$.,,lujvo,Chvre,goat cheese,,,
column184: kanbyku'i,$ku_1$ is a goatherd/takes-care-of/attends to//is caretaker for animals $ku_2$=$ka_1$.,See also herder (={danku'i}).,lujvo,goatherd,,,
column185: kanbyma'i,$x_1$ is January of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.,Cf. {pavmasti}, {nanca}, {jaurbeima'i}, {fipma'i}, {lanma'i}, {bakma'i}, {matsi'uma'i}, {mlajukma'i}, {cinfyma'i}, {xlima'i}, {laxma'i}, {rebjukma'i}, {celma'i}.,lujvo,January,,,
column189: kanjunla,$j_1$=$k_1$ is a watch (portable timepiece) measuring time units $j_2$ to precision $j_3$ with timing mechanism $j_4$.,Cf. {junla}, {temci}.,lujvo,watch,,,
column190: kanpyclira,$x_1$ happens sooner than expected by $x_2$,,lujvo,sooner than expected,,,
column191: kanpylerci,$x_1$ happens later than expected by $x_2$,,lujvo,later than expected,,,
column193: kansmu,$x_1$ (du'u/si'o) is a connotation/undertone of $x_2$ (text or act of expression), recognized by $x_3$,See {kansa}, {smuni},lujvo,connotation,undertone,,,
column194: kanxa'u,$xa_1$=$k_1$ is a roommate of/lives with $k_2$ at location/habitat/nest/home/abode $x_3$=$xa_2$.,,lujvo,cohabitant,roommate,,,
column195: ka'omlu,$s_1$=$k_1$ is sickly/appears healthy to observer $s_3$ by standard $k_2$.,Cf. {bi'amlu}.,lujvo,healthy looking,,,
column196: kapcikna,$cikna_1$=$skapi_2$ experiences goose bumps.,,lujvo,goose bumps,have goose bumps,,,
column197: kapkevna,$k_1$ is a skin pore of pelt/skin/hide/leather $k_2$=$s_1$ from $x_3$=$s_2$.,Cf. {nazbi}, {pilka}, {xasne}.,lujvo,pore,skin pore,,,
column198: kapxra,$x_1$=$p_1$ is a tattoo/body art/brand/[image on the body] depicting $x_2$=$p_2$ on animal/body part $x_3$=$s_2$ made by artist $x_4$=$p_3$,Cf. {skapi}, {pixra}.,lujvo,henna,tattoo,,,
column199: karcutci,$c_1$ is a sandal for protecting feet $c_2$, and of material $c_3$.,Cf. {tupcutci}, {smoka}.,lujvo,sandal,,,
column200: karcycelxa'i,$x_1$=$c_1$=$k_2$ is a self-propelled artillery gun for use against $x_2$ by $x_3$, launching projectile $c_2$ propelled by $c_3$.,Cf. {karce}, {cecla}, {xarci}, {xumjimcelxa'i}, {gutyjamkarce}, {xiljamkarce}, {karcycelxa'i}, {sorjaknykarce}.,lujvo,mobile artillery,self-propelled artillery,self-propelled artillery gun,,,
column201: karcyckiku,$c_1$ is a car key opening/unlocking a lock of car $c_2$=$k_1$, and having relevant properties $c_3$.,,lujvo,car key,,,
column202: karcyflani,$x_1$ is a vehicle horn, a klaxon,,lujvo,,,,
column203: karcykla,$x_1$ comes/goes to $x_2$ from $x_3$ via route $x_4$ using car $x_5$,This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL,lujvo,go by car,,,
column204: karcymra,$m_1$ is a carport protecting car $m_2$=$k_1$ from $m_3$ (normally getting rained on or the like),See also {karcyzda}.,lujvo,,,,
column205: karcystacpestu,$x_1$ is the drive-thru/drive-through lane of restaurant $x_2$,See also {gusta}, {sazri}, {cidja}.,lujvo,drive-through,drive-thru,,,
column206: karcyzda,$z_1$ is a garage for car $z_2$=$k_1$,See also {karcymra}.,lujvo,,,,
column207: kardyckiku,$x_1$=$k_1$=$c_1$ is a key card unlocking lock $x_2$=$c_2$ by property/card type $x_3$=$c_3$,Various types of cards include mechanical holes, bar code, magnetic stripe ({maksriveikarda}), Wiegand wire, microchip and RFID. Cf. {maksrikardymi'i}.,lujvo,bar code keycard,keycard,magnetic keycard,mechanical hole keycard,microchip keycard,RFID keycard,Wiegand wire keycard,,,
column208: kardyserlaxi,$x_1$ is a ray, skate, etc. (flat fish which is a relative of sharks) of taxon  $x_2$,Colloquial; approximates taxon Batoidea, but focuses on the relative flatness and thinness of the individual (or what is typical for the species). In jocular English translation, this concept could be described as "pancake shark" or "flat shark".,lujvo,flat shark,pancake shark,ray,sawfish,skate,,,
column209: karfigre,$f_1$ is in the genus Dorstenia, species $f_2$,,lujvo,,,,
column210: kargau,$g_1$ opens portal/passage/entranceway $k_1$, permitting access to $k_2$ by $k_3$.,Cf. {kalri}, {gasnu}, {toltelgau}.,lujvo,open,,,
column211: karnyke'u,$x_1$ is the $x_3$'rd issue/number of journal/periodical/magazine/publication $x_2$ with content $x_4$ published by $x_5$ for audience $x_6$  .,,lujvo,issue,number,,,
column212: karpo'i,$x_{1}$ is an open-break with broken piece $x_{2}$.,,lujvo,something breaks open,,,
column213: karpo'ijbe,$j_1$=$k_3$ hatches from eggshell $j_2$=$p_1$=$k_1$,{kalri}+{porpi}+{jbena} This is based on the lujvo {karpo'i}, glossed as "something breaks open". It is not obvious to me whether any of $k_2$ (portal destination), $p_2$ (pieces of broken thing), $j_3$ (birthdate), or $j_4$ (birthplace) are appropriate to include in this lujvo.,lujvo,hatch,,,
column215: kasygau,$x_1$ (agent) scrambles/mixes/shuffles/messes up/disorganizes/chaotically rearranges $x_2$ in property/aspect $x_3$.,,lujvo,mix up,scramble,shuffle,,,
